Reviews.Title: “Wedding trip”
Reviews.Author: Sean T
Reviews.Content: We stalked Rome for the right hotel for our wedding trip to Rome. Finally, we got somewhere that was good looking online, had good reviews, was reasonably priced and in a handy location. We could not have done better. Starhotels Metropole not only has a nice facade but the lobby is also beautiful. We normally stay in budget hotels, but my beautiful (WIFE TO BE) could not be walking out of a dungeon or cellar door on out big day so we plumped for this hotel. The staff were helpful, attentive to our needs and very friendly. They could not have been any nicer. The room was spacious, clean, recently refurbished, modern and comfortable. This place is a bit of a gem in comparison to what some of our friends, family and guests stayed in for a similar price. GREAT breakfast with a wide choice of breads, cereals, fruit, yogurt, drinks and hot foods. This basically set us up until dinner time, except of course for a daily gelato around 3 o'clock!!!! Quality hotel, thank you for making our stay special. Go raibh maith agaibh, Seán and Kathy Turner, Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Natasha0017
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great hotel to stay in. Close to Termini and easily walkable to all the sights (sights are about 15-20 minutes walk) Road signs can be a bit difficult so we found it a little difficult to locate the hotel but we asked a few people and they helped us. The map that is given in hotels.com is not very helpful so i suggest you get a more in dept map! Rooms are a good size and beds comfortable. Toilets are a little small but not too bad! No shower only bathtub. Breakfast was included in the price we paid and it was excellent with aot of choice. Breakfast is buffet style and included sausages, bacon, scrambled eggs, selection of ham and cheese, yogurt and fruit and a bread selection . If you want toast you can ask for it at no additional charge. The price we paid for the hotel was worth. Surrounding area had lots of eating places. Very lively area! The gym at the hotel is 24hrs but very small (4 machines) so better use it when it is not very crowded. Free Wi Fi only available at the lobby. Hotel rated as a 4 star but i would give it a 3 star superior. Highly recommend this hotel to all travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: SussexJudith
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 3 nights in a superior twin bedded room and couldn't have been more pleased with the room,comfy beds,complimentary room safe,tea and coffee making facilities etc. The room was quiet and tastefully decorated and we appreciated the choice of pillows,clean daily linen and towels. The breakfast buffet choices were good and I must mention the excellent waiter, Renato, who has to be the best waiter we have ever come across, he went out of his way to be helpful and is an excellent ambassador for the hotel. We would definitely stay here again and will recommend. We didn't find it easy to get around Rome even with a map and would recommend that you take a good map with an A-Z street directory. I don't know how many times we saw the colosseum when looking for other venues! But we weren't alone in getting lost,at every junction when you looked around we saw other tourists looking at maps and looking just as confused as we were! One thing I must warn you about is crossing the roads, I don't know which I'm more scared of, spiders or Rome roads! The drivers take no notice of the green man on crossings or any other crossings either. They use the roads like a race track! We found that if there is a nun about to cross then take advantage that the drivers are unlikely to want to run over a nun! Seriously,it's like trying to cross at Hyde Park Corner. Be brave and bold and walk purposely. Don't dither and accept that scooters and motor bikes will zipp around you. Our taxi driver on the way back to the airport said that he would never apply his brakes for a man! Be careful.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and convenient for Termini station”
Reviews.Author: maggih
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days in April. The rooms were very comfortable with linen and towels changed every day. Lovely hot shower and a deep bath, very welcome after a day sightseeing in the rain. Breakfast buffet was fine but basic. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect beds”
Reviews.Author: TheHeinles
Reviews.Content: Dear trippers, my wife and I stayed for four nights during Easter in this hotel. Breakfast is fine, staff is not great but effective. Beds are almost Marriott quality if you know what I mean. The room was clean and a bit small for what we are used in 4 or 5 star hotels. Location of this hotel is perfect. Termini station wthin a 10 minutes walk. City tour bus stops also within 10 minutes and if you are in perfect condition it's even possible to do everything by foot. If you want to take a taxi to the Vatican the staff can give you a ticket and taxi arrives whithin 4 minutes to take you for 9 euro's to the Via della Consilliatione 42 Caffe San Pietro which is 50 metres from the St Peters Basilica. If you walk the Via Princip Armedeo there are many nice restaurants with great pizza and pasta's for a reasonable price. A special advice from us to have diner http://www.ristoranteaquilanera.com/it/gli_esterni.html Enjoy Rome like we did !!! The Heinles

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Duncan M
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel in a very good position; many of the main attractions are within walking distance. Smart and spacious public areas and good sized, well equipped bedrooms. Breakfast is reasonable without being outstanding. Staff are without fail friendly, with many going out of their way to be helpful (take a bow Renato from the breakfast team). Nice bar area - a bit expensive but that goes with the territory

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: gollWestSussex
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay in this hotel. We had a deluxe room on the 4th floor facing inwards to courtyard and it was very nice and quiet for a busy city. The room was large and comfortable with tea/coffee making facilities and a mini bar. Service was good and attentive and breakfasts better than normal for Italy with a good selection of dishes available, albeit not all warm enough for us. I was concerned about some negative comments about the location I need not have been worried as we encountered no problems at all and the benefit of all types of Rome transport virtually on the doorstep surmounted any downside. We took a shuttle bus from Fiumicino airport direct to the Termini station and it only cost E4 each way and was quick and easy.Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Comparing apples and oranges...”
Reviews.Author: ls1202
Reviews.Content: This was an adequate hotel. We recently travelled with a Globus tour of Europe and stayed here two nights. It was clean and adequate. The staff were adequate; friendly enough in a distant kind of way. This was our first overseas visit and there were a few things that we were not used to - no coffee in the rooms, the rooms were hot (a/c is centrally controlled). If we had not been able to open a window to the cool night March air it would have been very uncomfortable. The lobby is nice and spacious. The breakfast is large and good (the eggs are not cooked to American standards - they're kinda raw). Very large and nice bathroom. Having travelled extensively in America our experiences in European hotels were very different. 'Just rolled it into part of the overall experience. Also, a general bit of advice; many European hotels do not provide wash clothes. Buy up a set of cheap ones to take with you and just throw them away after you've used them.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel by Termini”
Reviews.Author: DePo79
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at this hotel and we definitely will stay here again. The rooms are spacious, modern and clean with tea kettle and minibar. The reception is welcoming and ready to help. Breakfast is plentiful, though could offer slightly more variation. But the food quality is good. Service is perfect - all waiters are attentive. The only thing I can come up with is that the hotel should consider is free WiFi in the rooms. However they offer free 30 mins WiFi in the lobby which is a very good option to check the email etc.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms in good location, reception staff could be friendlier”
Reviews.Author: dulin38
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Starhotels Metropole for 4 nights for business reasons. It is in a very good location close to the Stazione Termini, so easily accessible when coming from the airport. It is close to a large shopping street and many sights such as the Colosseum and Roman Forum are in walking distance as well. My room was very big and comfortable with a large bathroom. It had two single beds that made up a large double, there is a wide choice of pillows available and the room was very quiet, so I slept very well in the hotel. Small remarks regarding cleanliness of the room: when I arrived there were hairs on one of the beds and in the bathtub, probably from the housekeeping staff - apart from that it was spotless. I liked the fact that the room has tea and coffee making facilities (tea and coffee is refilled everyday, so are toiletries in the bathroom). Breakfast is included in the room rate and consist of a large breakfast buffet. Even though it is a big hotel that seems to cater for tour groups as well, the breakfast restaurant was never overly crowded, food was there in good supply and I never had to queue. Waiters in the breakfast room are very friendly and make sure you have everything you need. I tried room service one morning and evening and again, food was of very good quality and plentiful and the staff was extremely friendly. Unfortunately, I can't say the same of the staff at the reception. My check-in experience was quite unpleasant. I arrived late in the evening after a long day at work, followed by my flight to Rome. The staff checked me in, handed me my key card and some flyers without further comment. I had to ask them for standard information such as breakfast times and location as well as Internet connection. Wifi is free of charge for 30 mins in the lobby, but not in the rooms. I had to ask twice how to connect to the Wifi in the room and how much it is before they bothered to explain it to me. When I asked for directions to the conference center I had to go to the next morning, they just looked at the address I gave them, told me it was 15 mins away (not true, just 2 mins across the road) and didn't bother to make the effort to show it to me o the map they had just handed out to me. I was very annoyed by this experienced and didn't feel welcome at all. Given the fact that check-in is the first experience of guests in the hotel and can make or break the impression you get of the hotel. At a later stage I needed to print something and was direction to the business center (more a corner in the lobby with two computers and a printer). Usage is not free, even though wifi is for 30 mins, if you have your own laptop.... you pay 2 EUR for 15 mins of usage. When I asked, if they could print something for me they agreed to do so, but wouldn't have offered it themselves. What was also missing was general information regarding the hotel and its facilities in the rooms. I am a bit torn with regards to my stay in the Starhotels Metropole: on the one hand, I was very comfortable in my room, Wifi worked well (which you'd hope when paying 11 EUR per day for it), breakfast was good and restaurant and housekeeping staff are very friendly. I was put off by the reception staff, the general paid Internet policy (in 4 star hotels that see themselves as business hotels it should be included in the room rate or at least less expensive) and the lack of information on the hotel in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Earle F
Reviews.Content: I actually found this hotel to be fantastic for the few days we spend in Rome. First of all the location is awesome if you want to be close train and bus station. If you are willing to use the public transportation in Rome, this is only like a block away. Additionally if you are a walker you have a few sites within reach, however the big attractions require a little bit of walking. The facilities and staff were all top notch. The most important thing for me in hotels has been sleeping, and thats why this place was awesome. The rooms were comfortable with all the amenities I could ask for. Additionally breakfast was included and a great way to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!!!”
Reviews.Author: AMIT_9
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is placed very close to the Roma Termini and hence it is a very important area for staying in rome as every thing is close by. By foot ad with some luggage, it would take some 8 minutes to walk to the Hotel. If the location is important for your stay, this is a good area. The Terravision bus center, Termini shopping area, Metro, Local Bus, Tram, Trevi Fountain...everything is close by...So i would rate the hotel 4/5 on location. Hotel is clean and Tidy so, i would rate it 3.75/5. But, this is where the good things end... 1) Staff steals...for sure...i forgot my New Sunglasses ( quite expensive Label) on the table on the first day, it was flicked. Another small book of religious importance was missing the second day. I spoke to the reception on this, and they were not very alarmed or suprized or even rendered help. 2) NO AIRCONDITIONING!!!! shocks you as you enter as the hotel claims it self to be 4 Star...but...they DO NOT provide airconditioning in March...( dont know when they do) 3) Room is small, but clean...and so is the bathroom...clean and small. 4)Buffet on breakfast ends ...before it starts...but...if you love scrambbled eggs...and you can can eat it for the rest of your life...you would find it everyday :) you get internet in lobby for free, so thats a small plus, but there are hotels which provide wi fi in room...in close by area... So...lock every thing you before you leave the room...staff is not interested in your being there...forget about your well being...the hotel was not more than 50-65% capacity, coupled with petty thefts....NOT a very safe place for individual women for sure!!! Would rate over all 2.85/5...Not recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location, so so Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: pippadog
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 night break. We had a deluxe room which was really nicely appointed. Large king sized bed and linen changed daily. We arrived at the Termini and it was really easy to find and not needing a taxi ride. The hotel isn't perfect and these are the so so bits. The breakfast was the same each morning so it got very boring by the 4th day. It was also a bit for our liking and it can be a bit manic at times. The internet (at modem speed) is free for 30 mins. It was painful as most people are used to have good broadband speed. However you can pay 12Euro for a 24 hour usage for a faster speed. On principle I refused to pay!. Rome was surprisingly warm but the hotel wouldn't switch on the AC which makes it quite stuffy a night. I would probably use this hotel again as the service was excellent and the bar is expensive but it appears everywhere is pricey anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Very conveniently located from Termini, good quality”
Reviews.Author: drtuono
Reviews.Content: Nice clean international hotel, 5 min waliking distance from Termini station, 3 minutes from via Nazionale. Clean, reasonably quiet rooms. Good breakfast buffet. Free wifi (30') only in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Vitaly P
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very comfortable, a great place to come back to after a long day out in Rome, and fantastic value for money. Clean, spacious and nicely decorated room, good breakfast, nice and professional staff. Beds extremely comfortable - had good night sleep every night. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good city hotel”
Reviews.Author: TimandJaneT
Reviews.Content: As three couples we recently stayed at the Hotel during the weekend of the Italy England six nations game. The hotel was clean and the rooms spacious. The location was good too as it was just a short walk from the metro although it was easy enough to walk (20minutes) to the main attractions. The breakfast were plentiful and the staff were great. There english was excellent too and this helped when asking for directions. Overall very good.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Amazing Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: AGainer
Reviews.Content: We had a brilliant time in Rome staying at the Star Hotels Metropole - We loved the location and walked everywhere republica underground was a 3 minute walk and there was lots of places to eat close by. The area around the is fine, it gets a bit dodgy as you get close to the termini at night but that cause no problems whatsoever. Rooms were old school and grand and perfect for us. a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: DantheMan36
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family to see the rugby and it was brilliant - staff, food, room and service. Well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Rome trip for my husband's 60th”
Reviews.Author: Victoria R
Reviews.Content: We've just come back from the most amazing weekend in Rome to celebrate my husband's 60th. Stayed at Starhotels Metropole for 3 nights booking with Citalia. Lovely hotel, very clean and comfortable room overlooking Via Principe Amedeo with mini bar and complimentary robes and slippers, good cooked buffet breakfast. My only criticism is that the hotel is very large and impersonal, the reception staff seemed rather unfriendly, when checking out they didn't even ask if we had enjoyed our stay. Also seemed very expensive even for Rome prices 2 coffees and 2 amaretto liqueurs 24.00 euros! They do have a restaurant but apart from included breakfast didn't eat there. Close to Termini but no problems with begging as others have said. Maybe better to be nearer the centre, say Spanish Steps or Trevi Fountain area for sightseeing but near to Metro to get around. We walked everywhere except Vatican City, caught the Metro for 1 euro and took about 10 mins. Excellent pizzeria in Via Cavour going towards the Colesseo about 10 mins. walk away called Gallo Matto, very lively and great food. Also tried Est, Est, Est directly opposite the hotel, very disappointing, would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: nikkig257
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Huge bed, and very comfy. Big bathroom, and room. Great service, and great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, good location”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler465
Reviews.Content: We picked this particular hotel based entirely off its TripAdvisor rating and we weren't disappointed! I emailed the hotel a week or two before our arrival and told them of my wife's allergy to citrus based cleaner and when we arrived they had upgraded us to an 'allergy-free' room with hardwood floors because the carpet in the other rooms was cleaned with citrus products. On our first night in the room, one of the legs of the bed broke and spilled us onto the floor, but the night manager came up himself and tried for 5 solid minutes to fix it in his suit and tie after the doorman had tried as well. They wound up finding a stack of phone books to prop us up for the night and they fixed it "good as new" while we were out the next day. The location is pretty solid, as others have mentioned - a bit of hike to the major sights, but an easy walk to Termini station with buses that can get you anywhere. There are a number of places to eat in the immediate area so if you don't feel like going too far for dinner, you'll be all set. We visited during the recent economic protests in the city and the staff was very helpful in telling us which locations to avoid and providing us with maps and directions to the sights. Overall, we would definitely recommend the hotel to others visiting the Eternal City!

Reviews.Title: “Big and clean hotel by the train station”
Reviews.Author: LazNYC
Reviews.Content: Starhotel Metropole is a good hotel between the Termini station, the Opera and Piazza Repubbica. It's pretty big and busy, has lots of rooms to choose from. We stayed there for 10 days in January, and enjoyed our trip. I would not say that the hotel room met my expectations.... The rooms were not too big, and the furniture was pretty outdated... It did not feel any special at all, pretty blah... But the staff was VERY, extremely helpful!!! The concierge service was always the best, very kind and polite, answered all the questions. They could give recommendations on the guide tours, restaurants, shopping, night life, spas, and etc. What else would a girl need? ;) Breakfast is till 10.30 and gives lots of options to choose from. If you need something special, the very helpful waiters will bring it to you, starting from pancakes to the best cappuccino ever. The lobby bar offers good wine selection, the bartenders are also very professional :) WiFi is free in the lobby - the concierge will provide you with tickets with login/password for 30 minutes use (you can have as many tickets as possible). Otherwise you can use the WiFi for 5.50 Euro a day in your room. The hotel also offers a small gym for free, parking (35 euro a day? not sure), and a business center with computers (not sure about the price). I would highly recommend to get to the hotel from the airport by taxi, it's about 45 Euro. I would not recommend you to use the Termini subway station at all, as it's CRAAAAAAAAAZY! Its was crazy packed and I felled the crowd would push me under the train. 3 trains passed by me, and I still could not get on any of them even though I was just by the entrance to the train. There is also the Opera/Repubblica station by the hotel, which concierge said is much better. But I was so scared of the Termini station experience, that always called taxi or walked. In conclusion, I would recommend this hotel if you're in the city for business, it's good for it price, good location and very helpful professional staff. Not the best choice for romantic vacation.

Reviews.Title: “business hotel”
Reviews.Author: charlie73Wales
Reviews.Content: just returned from 3 nights at the hotel, my fiancee and i were on a sightseeing weekend. on arrival the reception staff were cold and unwelcoming, this is definatly a hotel for business use, there were a few conferences being held, and the bar area was closed off during the day to accomadate this. but saying that you would'nt spend a great deal of time in the bar as it is very pricey, we had 4 drinks one evening, the bill was 44 euro. and the first drink took 45 minutes to arrive, there were 5 people in the bar including us. but it was decorated really tastefully and comfortable. all the communal areas are extremely clean. the room was spacious and the bed was comfortable,but the bathroom was a bit mouldy, shower just ok, had to turn the air con off to sleep as quite loud. take a hairdryer the one in the bathroom is just a puff of air and there is no iron. room service just walked in the room in the morning without knocking, not a great experiance. breakfast was just ok also. the breakfast staff were slightly more friendly than the reception. the location is great, just around the corner from termini station.so easy for travel to other parts of the city.but its easy to walk around rome, we normally do the bus tours which we did, but if i went again i would just walk it, rome is'nt really that big. there are a couple of retaurants in the area but if you want to be in the hub i would suggest staying near the trevi fountain, there are loads of sidestreets with lovely little places. this seems a bit of a negative review of the hotel, but i think if the staff had been a bit more friendly and we had a felt more welcome, im sure the little niggles wouldnt have been that important. i wouldnt stay here again, it was average.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Jock286
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in November 2011 for a long weekend. Overall it's an average hotel, nothing special but nothing offensive. The location is good, close to Termini, close to a bus stop for the hop-on hop-off buses and there were some good restaurants / coffee shops nearby. The customer service at the hotel was indifferent, the room average, but clean & comfortable. Overall I didn't feel it was worth the price I paid and I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel in a convienent location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Littlegerald
Reviews.Content: I has chosen this hotel cause of its positive reactions, but I found it kinda dissapointed for the money that I paid for it. The hotel is at a very good location 10 min from Termini station, where you can take trains that go every where in Italy. And lots of restaurants nearby by the hotel. I found the room outdated and the walls were thin, cause you could hear the toilet flush from your neighbors. Breakfast was good and there was a lot of choice. It was alright overall,but for 160 euro a night I expected better

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Rome ...”
Reviews.Author: alindtown
Reviews.Content: Spent two weeks in Italy and our first stop was Rome and the StarsHotel Metropole. The hotel is conveniently located near the train station and convenient to visiting all the historic sites. Rooms were very nice and clean. Morning meal, included in price, was a very positive experience as the food and service was very good. Nice bar area to sit, relax and enjoy a drink at the end of the day. Internet awkward ... used in the bar area which was free. Front desk personnel where very helpful most of the time. Overall ... very good value .... would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Internet Ripoff!!!”
Reviews.Author: SukhyBahra
Reviews.Content: I am staying at this hotel as I write, using their 30 minute limited Internet service! Yes, you read that right! 30 minutes of use for free, if you want to use it for 24 hours it is 11 euros!!! Who in their right mind would charge customers for wifi in the 21st century. This hotel clearly thinks not everyone uses Internet these days, they are clearly living in the dark ages. I have just checked in, been told to pay 11 euros for Internet and I will not be held to ransom over my 3 night stay. I am really disappointed and I hope anyone who needs Internet which is probably like 99% of the visiting population avoids this hotel if they continue this policy, it is quite outrageous. I have just. Checked in and now i hope I had not.

Reviews.Title: “Ecellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikethewanderer
Reviews.Content: This is the second Starhotel we have used (the other being Venice - excellent) and we were pleased with our choice. The Metropole is a 5 minuite walk from Termini (heed the warnings about the people you may encounter here and on the metro. a young woman, part of a group of 3, with a baby tried to pick my pocket !). We were given a free upgrade on checking in and had a very comfortable room looking onto the main street. The room was as you would expect from a 4 star, and the buffet breakfast had enough choice of both hot and cold food to satisfy the most picky diner. Every memeber of staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. Most of the main tourist sights are within walking distance, but remember Rome is a huge city, and take a comfortable pair of shoes. In short, the Metropole is a fantastic base while in the eternal city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, staff have attitude”
Reviews.Author: Travelling224
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the termini train station. The gym is tiny and there is not enough air being vented through. I thought I was going to faint. The breakfast was loverly and the rooms were clean. Internet is a rip off, paid for it and does not even work, the desk staff said this was our problem and we had to call the company that provides internet. Free internet is in the foyer, this last for 30mins which is very annoying as one needs to be putting passwords in ever 30mins.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Lascelless
Reviews.Content: It's hard for me to find fault with this hotel. The location is great, just a short 5 minute walk from the Central Train station. We had a deluxe double room (free upgrade from a superior double because of a special offer) and it had all the comforts you expect from a 4*. They even offer a pillow menu if you're particularly picky about that. Free wifi in the lobby for guests which is pretty much standard these days and a good choice of food at breakfast made for a perfectly comfortable stay in Rome. I would highly recommend this hotel to couples, business travellers and even those travelling with young children.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: bennett-on-the-go
Reviews.Content: I can confirm all the great things said about this hotel, it is just perfect for visiting Rome, easy to get to from airports as just down the road from Stazione Termini (main train/bus station in Rome). Very spacious room and spotlessly clean, towels etc changed daily etc. and very comfortable with air conditioning/heating. Buffet breakfast excellent with great selection of everything served up to 10.15am and staff wonderful, especially Renato who looked after us so well. We walked everywhere in Rome and very accessable. Would highly recommend this hotel and we will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Ando-A-78
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel well locate near Termini Station and close as well to Repubblica Metro Station. Great staff and service and great breakfast buffet included Spacious and modern room (double). If i have to think to some bad points,one would be the Wi-Fi access (free just in the lobby and not working properly during our stay. The second was mattress, quite a bad one. Anyway this hotel will be one of our first choice for a future stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Conferene facilities, great location”
Reviews.Author: Luca_KTM
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel during a big company meeting, from this point of view the hotel is good, though the conference room are OK for no more than 80 people and they're not flexible in the setup. The staff is very cooperative and friendly and the food is very good also. A big issue was the VERY costly wifi connection, it was not possible to get a corporate discount for it. Rooms are big and clean, though quite small. The A/C was not working, indeed it wasn't possible to set it on warm...

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: Seftonslady
Reviews.Content: This very comfortable hotel is a 5 minute walk from the Termini station and just round the corner from the city sightseeing tour buses. A short stroll takes you to the Via Nationale, with shops and restaurants in abundance. Our room on the 8th floor was small but very comfortable, with good storage space and to our surprise, tea and coffee making facilities. The room was very quiet, insuring a good night's sleep and spotlessly clean, with bedding and bath towels changed daily. Fridge and mini bar in room for storing your own bottled water. Breakfast offers all the usual items-do ask for boiled eggs if that's your preference- they come freshly made. Concierge explained the tipping protocol in restaurants- the 'service charge' does not go to the staff- so add extra if you've been pleased. Staff are friendly and very helpful. We would certainly stay again- very good value for money- and a great base from which to explore Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect City Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: vgs34
Reviews.Content: This hotel really is perfect if your aim is to sight see and explore the city from every angle. Termini Station is within close proximity, and if travelling from Ciampino airport you can get return 'Terravision' bus travel for 4 euro per person, taking you right to Termini Station. We stayed for three nights and had no complaints. The room was above average for 4*, in comparison to similar located hotels. Breakfast is hearty and alot of choice. Our room was quiet and the shower was quite powerful (which is always a bonus, as sometimes they arent). The reception staff were very helpful. You have to be reminded that they won't fall over themselves to help you out (as some expect) but will give you the right information to enhance your stay. We managed to walk to all sights from this hotel, although our feet were sore and I would recommend comfy shoes, but thats because we wanted to see everywhere in a day. The metro system is also another option and you will find these within easy reach. I didn't really like this option as when we used it, there was alot of begging, which is sad. Overall, I would say don't be put off at all if reading negative reviews of this place. It's really clean and smart and you won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good option”
Reviews.Author: Ashish29
Reviews.Content: A very conveniently located property with the Termini station just 400 mts away and the Republica Metro station around 250 mts. away. We had booked a superior room and got one on the 5th floor, which was decent sized, comfortable, clean smart toilet, with good linen. Front desk staff was very helpful and guided us precisely with whatever we had to ask. All in all a good property to choose, although may be expensive on some days, as we too encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable & loved the service”
Reviews.Author: Salxfield
Reviews.Content: Could not fault the service at the hotel, in particular the breakfast staff were very friendly, efficient and polite. We had two nights and stayed on the 9th floor where the room was quiet and very clean. Would go back as we had a fantastic trip!

Reviews.Title: “recent stay”
Reviews.Author: theresaKent
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed here in october,we had a great time,check in,checkout brilliant,staff very efficiant,we got an up grade at no extra cost.breakfast was very good everything you could want and the staff eager to help.bed linen changed every day and towels.we walked every where in rome and the hotel was very convenient to all the major sites,some good places to eat near the hotel at a good price.could definatley reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Rue_O
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at Starhotels Metropole. Good breakfast selection, very friendly staff, daily cleaned room (fresh linen and towels) with air con. Location is good with main attractions close by and 5mins from Termini train station. Plenty of restaurants nearby at a reasonable price. Things to note: - Order Vatican tickets online! You can skip the queue - Restaurants overlooking attractions are double the normal price, so beware. - Wear comfortable shoes!! You will be walking lots. - Top of St Peters Basillica is amazing! Worth the 500 steps climb.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: Amesylou
Reviews.Content: I stayed here toward the end of october for two nights. The location is great if your going to use the trains. Not ideal if you want to walk around because its a good 30 minute walk to the main attractions. But being a 1 minute walk from termini station (the main train station) was really helpful and made travelling around rome really quite easy. We had a mixed experience with the staff. Most were really nice and friendly, there was only one lady on reception (cant remember her name but she had shoulder length brown hair- i think it was lorraine or something) who was icy and seemed to resent helping us at all. We arrived after the heavy rain/flooding, and the colosseum had been closed for a few days, the gentleman at reception told us to go down at 9am to get them to ring to check if it had reopened so we didnt have to waste our time going if they were closed. We came down to find this lady look at us like total idiots when we asked, she then resentfully rang for us.. no smiles at all. If she was the only staff who we encountered i certainly wouldnt have much positive stuff to say. However, the man on the desk was lovely, and the staff in the breakfast room were very friendly. The room was average/good. the beds were comfy. the bathroom was clean. You had to pay to use wifi in your room so we didnt bother, but you can get it in free 30 minute intervals from reception to use down in the bar/lounge area. One thing i would recommend is make sure you have your own drinks from one of the shops down the road. We forget to buy water and had to buy it from the bar... we payed 5 euros for a 1 litre bottle... total rip off when there is a little market a couple of doors down where you can get a 1 litre bottle for 1.50. Dont make that mistake!!!!! the room wasnt cheap but for the location being so close to termini it wasnt bad compared to a lot of the other places.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for Rome”
Reviews.Author: Rockyy7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights while visiting Rome at the end of August 2011. The location couldn't be have been more perfect. We came to Rome by train and the hotel was less than a 5 minute walk from the station. When we arrived at the hotel they actually upgraded us to a deluxe suite which was very nice. It had an actual Queen bed not two twins pushed together like some other places we've stayed at. We were very happy with the size of the room as well as the bathroom which had a full bathtub with a shower. The breakfast had plenty of options to choose from, we were given free internet, only problem was you had to use it in the lobby which wasn't too much trouble. The staff was very helpful in telling us how to and where to go using the metro, which I highly recommend as well. Being in Rome we didn't spend much time in the room, but for the time we did it got the job done.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location, ask for a quiet room”
Reviews.Author: crmack
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for nine days in September. We had a deluxe room in order to get free internet which they don't offer any more. It was a vacation and I love this location and I loved the hotel except that I had requested a quiet room (and was right on the street on the 6th floor so it was noisy) and it is a real pain to get your boarding passes on your return flight. The front desk won't do it and charge $2 for each printed item at their "hotel" computer. I had to spend quite a bit of time getting my boarding passes for the return flights. And the other complaint is that a glass of (very good) wine at the bar is 6 euros. Too expensive. Breakfast is very good. Hotel staff very accommodating. I would stay here again. CRMack Washington, D.C.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: leila i
Reviews.Content: Located in a good area next to Termini station with access to all parts of Rome. Clean, air conditioned room. Excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great position”
Reviews.Author: platoCoventry
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and were upgraded to a Junior Suite on arrival- we had booked with Citalia and said it was for a special occasion. The room was spacious and clean with a large comfortable bed. There was plenty of choice at breakfast and the waiters were efficient and friendly. The hotel was well placed, being a few minutes from the main Termini station, the Metro and the stop for hop-on hop-off buses- well worth using these to get about the various sites of Rome. The main tourist sites were close by with the Colossium, Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps being about 20 minutes walk and the Vatican only a short Metro ride away. We found a couple of good, reasonably priced restaurants. Left out of the hotel and right at the junction was Alessio's, while right from the hotel just down the block was L'Europeo serving family-type local food. Staying at the hotel really made our stay in Rome special.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended by an Experienced Traveler”
Reviews.Author: Palisades9
Reviews.Content: Having travelled to many cities/countries on business, I can tell you that you will not be disappointed by this hotel. For the price, it is an excellent value and the accomodations are very comfortable. The rooms are not luxurious, but are more than adequate and clean. Breakfast is included and has everything you could want. Cable tv is available and my room had a full bath with shower and hair dryer. Some rooms have terraces, which are great. On our last night we were upgraded to a suite which was beautiful. The location is within walking distance of the train station. Major tourist sites require a taxi ride, but are less than 5-10 minutes away by taxi. The staff was incredibly helpful, particularly Daniela, who arranged our taxi services and was very helpful in making dinner reservations. Overall I was very happy and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room and breakfast, but noisy staff were a problem!”
Reviews.Author: Roxy_DeMilo
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Metropole at the beginning of August for four nights, and it was an ideal spot for a lot of the tourist attractions, including the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and the Colosseum, with each being about a 20 minute slow walk away, which is a fantastic selling point. It’s also just over five minutes away from the Termini Station, which has direct links to the Fiumicino airport. The staff were a little abrupt, but overall quite friendly, especially when we had a problem watching a movie that we had bought, which was too dark and fuzzy that you couldn’t hear it properly. The breakfast buffet was a wide choice of cooked options, cold meats, pastries, yogurts, fruit and cereal and was really filling for a day of site seeing. The room and en suite was very clean. The bed was huge and so comfortable, so we slept pretty well until the early morning: our room was by the service staircase, so the staff were going up and down from about 6am and had absolutely no problem with banging doors or stomping on the stairs at that hour of the morning. Fine if you’re an early rise or you want to be out early to hit the sites before the scorching August afternoon sun, but really it was just a nuisance and they should be told that even though they’re working the guests may be sleeping. Apart from that, I can’t really fault it.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location,”
Reviews.Author: diana b
Reviews.Content: we had great holiday in Rome and found starhotels metropole excellent. Very comfortable and spacious room, clean. Staff very good and very helpful. Breakfast was great and plentiful. We would certainly go back if ever in Rome again. We found reception to be very helpful. A few hundred yards along the road was our favourite little family restaurant where we had lunch every day. We sat in the window with roses on our table and felt like royalty! Thoroughly enjoyed our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “3 days in Roma”
Reviews.Author: anniep65
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights early Oct 2011. Room and bathroom were large with very comfortable beds. Breakfast was included with hot and cold selections. Great coffee !!! Waiters were the best even down to reminding us to watch our purses o n the street. Rome has her share of purse snatchers and pick picketers Service at the front desk could have been a little cheerier

Reviews.Title: “Always a good choice”
Reviews.Author: tatirlima
Reviews.Content: Keeping it simple and short: good location, confortable room, efficient stadd and free wifi in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for a 3 1/2 star”
Reviews.Author: porscheblue
Reviews.Content: Not quite what I expect from a Four Star hotel but overall very better than most that saw in the area of the Termini station. Beds were comfortable and the room was spacious. The bathroom was a little small but to be expected in Europe. The Hotel is starting to look a little dated. The staff were very helpful and eager to please. The breakfast was better that some other hotels in Italy. Watch out for the extras, those two drinks from the Bar was a whopping 22 Euros. Close to the metro line which was a big plus. Feel a lot safer in Rome than anywhere in Naples.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced. No value for money.”
Reviews.Author: hmalecka
Reviews.Content: Hotel is overpriced and service quite bad. Receptionists are inattentive. Was queuing to check in and few other people came in after me and they got served first as they did not bother to queue just came up directly to reception desk. Receptionists did not seem to care that I anybody was waiting in the queue. Same thing happened when checking out. For the price you pay you should be treated with some respect at least. The only nice person in the whole hotel was a waiter called Renato. He made my stay there. Very attentive and nice person. We stayed at triple room which was very outdated and needed some work to be done. Walls were dirty and scratched. There were three of us but the triple room wad prepared for only two people so we had to request everything for another person. A bit stupid not to equip triple room for three people. The hotel is close to all tourist attractions so we could walk everywhere. I believe that was the only thing that was really good in this hotel. I would not recommend it and I will definitely not come back!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort in the heart of Roma”
Reviews.Author: Mel_Aberdeen
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at the Metropole on a solo trip to Rome last December. I arrived at the central train station and had just a short walk from there to the hotel itself. The check-in staff were very helpful and friendly which was a relief after a 7 hour flight delay. My luggage was also delayed so during my stay I had to check with reception periodically to check if it had arrived and they were always pleasant. When it finally arrived through the night they had it sent to my room first thing in the morning (the day before my departure). When I was shown to my room I found I had been upgraded (I booked with Citalia) to a very spacious corner room with an inward view. The view wasn't much, but it was very quiet even with the window wide open all night long. The only negative comment I have about my stay was that the air conditioning wasn't on in my room which made it very hot for sleeping. I was advised that this was due to a heat wave (it was 20 degrees celsius in December!) and that they do not operate the air condiitioning at this time of year. Breakfast was typical european buffet style and the dining staff were also friendly. The location of this hotel really is it's best feature. On my first day I walked to the Forum and Colosseum which was about 20 min. The Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore and also St. Paul's Within the Walls are both short walks from the hotel, and well worth a visit. The hotel is also located about a 5 min walk from Via Nazionale where there are many shops and restuarants. When I return to Rome I will surely stay at the Metropole again, despite the AC issue. The rooms are very comfortable, very clean, the staff are helpful and the location just can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: Larry B
Reviews.Content: Yet again I used Tripadvisor extensively when choosing hotels for our trip to Europe. I was looking for a hotel within a close vicinity of the Rome Termini 450meters that was highly rated. This hotel was great and newly refurbished. The room was large and the bathroom superb. The room had a mini bar. We booked with breakfast and the selection and quality of food was superb. The front desk staff can be a bit aloof and the telephone took preference to me standing at the front of the desk. The staff were however knowledgeable and helpful. Prior to arriving I sent the hotel a mail asking about tours and they were very helpful and gave options on who to use. Restaurants in the area were acceptable and two or three streets away from the hotel we got great value and quality. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, location near train station, so so AC, just ok.”
Reviews.Author: aerobie34
Reviews.Content: Pro: location near the train station makes it easy to get around. Con: Anemic A/C. Only had one pillow of the kind we liked left. Staff was professional but not very helpful. Nice lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Veg74
Reviews.Content: Stayed five nights on honeymoon and were really impressed with the quality of service received from the reception desk staff, housekeeping and the waiting staff at breakfast each morning. Our room was spotless and had shower over bath and very efficient air conditioning and was very peaceful at the back of the hotel, overlooking the central roof. We were delighted to find a kettle and drinks sachets in our room and enjoyed a delicious buffet breakfast each day. The location was perfect and within walking distance for all the major sights once we had got our bearings, although in the heat we found the metro very useful, travelling from the termini station a few minutes walk from the hotel for 1 euro a trip. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, ideally located.”
Reviews.Author: CathyB184
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights after a cruise and had been a little concerned by some of the poor reviews of this hotel. However we found it was a great hotel. Very modern and clean. We arrived very early at 10.30 in the morning and found the we could check in straight away. The room was really nice on the top floor. There was a pillow menu in the room and you have a choice of six different types of pillow!!!! The staff were all very helpful, and there was plenty of choice at breakfast. The hotel itself is ideally located just off the via cavour, and only a few minutes walk from termini. You can walk to any of the major sights in Rome from here, and in any case the main hub of the metro is at termini station. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: John557
Reviews.Content: The hotel was certainly in a good location- only three blocks from Termini station. The hotel its self was a typical city centre business hotel, rooms large and functional. We were upgraded to a junior suite which was little better than other normal double rooms we have stayed previously. We had a view of the back stairs and the laundry chute which kept us awake at night even with ear plugs in. The breakfast was a buffet and very busy. Wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: NancyC08
Reviews.Content: This hotel was situated in the best possible location. We were able to walk easily to every attraction and site on the east side of the Tiber. The Termini station was within a 5 min. walk and we were able to catch the bus to the Vatican for 1 Euro from there. We also took the train from Rome to Venice and were able to walk from the hotel to the station with our luggage very easily. The hotel was clean and well appointed and the attention to energy conservation was commendable. The buffet breakfast included in our room rate was generous and tasty. Highly recommend the Star Metropole and would love to be able to visit there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great find in the center of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: WineGirlCA
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because it was extremely affordable for the star rating and location. When we arrived from a long day of travel from the U.S., we walked into a comfortable room with high ceilings. Spacious and well appointed. We stepped out of the quiet of our room into bustling Rome, 4 blocks from the central train station and an easy walk to all of the major sites (we did take a cab to the Vatican). Breakfast had many choices including eggs, sausage, and cold options.

Reviews.Title: “Birhday Trip To Rome”
Reviews.Author: cfcmoss
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Starhotels Metropole from the 31st August for three nights to celebrate my birthday. The hotel is clean and spacious and in an excellent location only 5 minutes from the Termini station. The room was big, clean and quite. We had a room o the top floor (9th). The room was cleaned every day. The breakfast was average for a buffet, wuth cereals, breads, juices.egss, bacon , sausages and the inevitable pastries. Goof hotel that I would use again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: habek77
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights, and it was a very nice hotel. Staff was very attentive, breakfast was delicious, and free wifi :) Room was quite nice too. Clean and bed was comfortable. Bathroom just a tad small though, but most bathrooms in Europe are like that. The best thing about the place is the location. It's literally 5 minutes walking from Rome's Termini station. If only it's a bit cheaper... then it's gonna be full marks to them :)

Reviews.Title: “Just a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Viking18
Reviews.Content: We were 4 couples stain at the hotel for 3 nights and we just loved it. It´s not a cheap hotel, but it´s placed close to Termini and the service was extremely fine. The breakfast is really splendid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms and solid breakfast”
Reviews.Author: kevd193213
Reviews.Content: This is centrally located to the Termini, Rome's "Grand Central Station." The rooms were clean and really up to date. I felt the price was competitive, given the great location. Staff were helpful with dinner reservations and recommendations. The breakfast included was very good. I would stay here again if I ever go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Central location to termini, expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Nav531
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the end of our trip to Italy and chose this hotels based on its location to Termini since we were coming in from Siena by train and planned on leaving to the airport by train. This is 5 minutes walking from the train station and was our most expensive stay at $222 a night; when walking in the lobby is quite grand and it looks like a great hotel but the rooms are in great need of an update especially for the price they are charging. The floors were dirty, mold on the shower curtain, and the walls are in great need of a fresh coat of paint. I think if they just closed some of the rooms and do a facelift, it would make a world of difference. Breakfast was traditional european but also had eggs and sausage and was good. Service at the front desk was quite good as well and they arranged for a taxi to take us to the airport for 50 Euro which ended up being cheaper than taking the train. It is a great location, you just get a bit fooled by how grand the lobby is.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here - you will not find better value for money.”
Reviews.Author: cocorotsie
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again. When I was doing research for where to stay in Rome I came across many places around the same price that most people would never dare set foot in. Excellent value for money by European standards. There is a 14 Euro Leonardo Express straight from the airport to Termini. We took a 8 Euro train and then changed onto the Metro (I think at Piramide station? which is only 4 stops away from Termini) instead which was fine, just a little more hassle. But if you have a lot of luggage, I think the Leonardo Express is worth it. When you get out of Termini, the Starhotels Metropole is a short 2 block walk away. HInt: I HIGHLY recommend getting the ROMA pass at the airport (buy online before you go, pick it up there). For 25 Euros you get free entry into 2 sights (Colosseum, Galleries, etc), discounts, get to jump queues and is a metro / bus pass in Rome. I'd say it is a must and will save you tonnes of money and time. We arrived an hour or so before before check in but were given our standard room immediately. The room was spotless, nicely furnished, very big by European standards with a very comfortable bed. We slept well and the room was quiet. Breakfast is massive and another excellent value by European standards. The staff at the front desk ranged from very friendly and helpful to, not so helpful or friendly but of course always polite.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Simon M
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located two blocks away from the Termini Station and within walking distance to all major sights in Rome. We stayed at the hotel for one night before driving to Sorrento and loved everything about this hotel. The room was spacious, the furniture was all new, and the bed was spotless. Free internet access in the lobby and we even got wifi in our room. We checked in around 11am and not only the room was ready, they even upgraded our room, eventhough we didnt ask for it or anything. Loved this hotel and loved the price. We paid around $185 thru travelocity. Me and my wife definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. Oh , and the breakfast was included and it was plentiful with eggs, bacon, sausage, and everything else.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay at the Metropole, just as good as the first!”
Reviews.Author: Loobieloo26
Reviews.Content: The reason we returned to this hotel is the location, its so easy to hop on the Terravision bus from Campino and walk straight to the hotel and then you are pretty much ok to to walk to the main tourist sites. However, The Vatican is a bit of a walk away, but you can get the hop on hop off Greenline bus at Termini or it costs 13 Euro's by Taxi (last sunday of the month the Vatican museums are FREE! so we caught a taxi as an early start is essential - 7.30am ish got us towards the front of a very, very long queue and allowed us to avoid playing sardines in the Sistine Chapel). The staff on the front desk were excellent (all apart from one lady who was unable to crack a smile!), they even remembered me from my previous visit. The rooms are clean and comfortable, breakfast is plentiful and of a pretty decent quality offering a good range of fresh hot and cold items - great if you consider a breakfast in the restaurant on the corner is 18 Euro's per person. They serve tea if you ask for it (sorry, typical Brit i know!) and the staff were great. All in all a great value hotel which i would happily recommend to others and return again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Big chains need to get up to speed with wifi”
Reviews.Author: Wilberries
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience overall at this hotel but I just have to say that big chains (not just this chain bit others as well) need to get out of the stone ages when it comes to wifi and the Internet. During our stay we were allotted 30 mins free wifi with password etc. You had no logout option so this had to be used in one sitting. We got the code from a sheet of paper at the front desk. About 90 percent of hotels and B&Bs around the world offer free wifi or 24 hours usage with logout option. I don't understand why this can't be offered at Star properties as well. As I've mentioned everything else was excellent. As others have said, the breakfast is fantastic. No need to worry about the location. We (3 of us) arrived at 12:40 after midnight and walked with luggage off an airport bus the other side of Termini Station. I felt completely safe. This area has great subway access to major sites including Vatican city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Early Check-In”
Reviews.Author: Susan S
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights before our cruise and were very happy with the accommodations and location. We had e-mailed the hotel asking for early check-in and, although not guaranteed, we were able to walk from the train station after our long flight from Atlanta, and check in right away. The a/c worked great and the location was perfect to catch tour buses and the metro. The included breakfast was very ample. Many reasonably priced restaurants were near by for dinner, too. Caught the train to the port which cost less than five euros each. Used the lobby computer to let family know we arrived safely, eliminating the need to bring our computer. Would definitely stay again and recommend the Starhotels Metropole to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: sxctyguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel has very nice, clean, modern rooms. Good A/C. Great breakfast in the morning. Wireless internet in the rooms, fee applies for the smaller rooms, executive and suites free internet. Comfortable beds, clean bathroom, nice showers and tubs. The cheapest rooms are very small, I suggest the executive level room. The hotel is about 4 blocks from Termini Station. We bought a train ticket at the airport (FCO) for 8 euro per person, it was a 40 min ride with several stops before arriving at Termini. We carried our suitcases to the hotel. At Termini you can get on the Metro and be at the Vatican or the Coloseum in a flash! Metro is 1 euro per ride, or you can buy a 24 hr pass for 5 euro, or a 3 day pass for 11 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, disappointing location.”
Reviews.Author: CyrusSongad
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel, we had a really great stay here. We were very impressed with the extremely helpful staff and concierge. Our room was typical for an European 4 star and very clean. Breakfast was very good too. The only thing that was disappointing was the location, you are at least a 30-40 minute walk from most of the major sites and landmarks, walking to the Vatican or Trastevere is out of the question. We did really like the hotel however simply based on the location we would probably look to stay elsewhere if back in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressive”
Reviews.Author: India S
Reviews.Content: The service at the Rosa Grand in Milan and the Metropole in Rome was very impressive! Everyone was very accommodating and friendly. We stayed during their holiday so the hotel wasn't booked and the management offered upgraded rooms for us and the other couple we traveled with for our entire 7 night trip! Not to mention free wi-fi and a plentiful free breakfast everyday that did not end until 10:30a.m. along with complimentary hors d'oeuvres for dinner. I definitely will recommend and revisit!

Reviews.Title: “Typical Starhotels quality - but a bit far from the city centre”
Reviews.Author: Bitabix
Reviews.Content: We were sightseeing and had decided to afford ourselves Starhotels luxury (this from previous experience). The hotel is right by the station and typifies the service, value, food and high standards of Starhotels. [Our only complaint was that the hotel was a bit too far out of the city as we tended to walk everywhere - hardly the hotel's fault!]

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: dr_icecan
Reviews.Content: We got free upgrade to executive room during our two night stays there. The room is spacious and with a kettle (which is not available in classic room). Air conditioning is available, no need to open the window. The room is clean. (We stayed in the other hotel just next to it where the air conditioner is not available at the moment, so it is a bit noisy as we need to open the window)

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Honeymoon201107
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our honeymoon. The hotel room itself seem dated. Not much of a view, but there again, you're in a big city. The staff was friendly. Wasn't overly impressed with this hotel, but its in walking distance to the sight seeing buses and a 15min walk to the Trevi Fountain.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient and clean”
Reviews.Author: alwazerite
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from 3 nites at this hotel and were pleased with the accomodations. The hotel is walking distance to termini station and also located close enough to walk to most tourist sites(except the vatican). You can opt to take the train/bus a few blocks away. I can't say the area is beautiful, but it was surely safe and a good base to start/end the day. The hotel itself was modern and very clean. I did feel that when you first enter from the outside the lobby had a musty odor, but within 20 feet it passes and the hallways/elevators/dining rooms/bar was really nice. We were upgraded at check in from a regular room to an "executive room" and it was great. Bathroom was beautiful, big bed, wood floors, very comfortable. I thought some of the front reception people were a bit indifferent when questioned. We received some misinformation regarding cab fares and although they were helpful with bus information they did not warn us the buses they directed us on to (#40 and #64) are notorious for professional pickpocketers....needless to say, my husband was pickpocketed on the crowded bus! That of course has nothing to do with the hotel, BUT, a tip would've been helpful. Overall, we wanted a modern hotel, conveniently located and well priced, and this exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Classy with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Koala09
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 9.00 am and (I think her name was) Daniela the duty manager arranged for immediate check-in. The staff were generally friendly and helpful and the emergency response was outstanding when out of curiosity I pulled what turned out to be an emergency help cord in the bathroom! The hotel was classy, the bedroom, modern and comfortable and the bathroom was spacious and well appointed. A substantial buffet breakfast was included. The hotel is in an excellent location - walking distance with luggage to the station, close to restaurants and major sites. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Kaleni
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay & visit Rome. Very modern and well designed. Stayed for a week. We have been upgraded in a larger room. Useful information on trips outside Rome and possibility of booking the ones you like even before you arrive at the hotel through email. Breakfast has a great variety of products fresh fruits included and a variety of Italian coffee to choose from. Personnel is extremely helpful, we even got one of our two rooms as early as 8.30 in the morning upon arrival. The only minor issue is internet access which is free only in the lobby area. Overall, this is a great and reliable hotel to choose.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, accessible and elegant.”
Reviews.Author: NYC329
Reviews.Content: While I was only in Rome for two days, after a full two weeks in Italy, this hotel was great in that it allowed easy access to most of the landmarks. And I was determined to see as much as possible. It is but two blocks from the train station and that comes in handy if you are taking the train to FCO and one bus ride from the Vatican (definitely do the guided tours to the Vatican Museum and Sistine Chapel). Also, a 10 minute walk from the Colosseum (shops along that via have the cheapest souvenirs and you can take the bus back). I walked, maybe 20 minutes, to the Trevi Fountain, the Spanish Steps and Piazza Nuvona... that's a stone's throw from the Pantheon. Take via La Republicca around the corner from the hotel and it will lead you to most of these sites. There's a supermarket along the way. Rome is incredibly striking so give yourself more that two days time to enjoy it's aweseome structures and history.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UlysseKL
Reviews.Content: The lobby area is not very impressive, but the room is great! Comfortable and has great pillows! The service at the breakfast room is efficient. The head waiter is very attentive and polite to ALL the hungry guests. Internet service is expensive. Service at the reception could be better. Receptionists are cold and indifferent. Which is a shame as they are the front liner. Location - good. About 20 - 30 minutes walk to the major attractions. Taxis are easily available outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect base for our Rome City break”
Reviews.Author: DerryPaddymac
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 7 nights and it was just perfect for our city break. A double room had been previously booked but we received a free upgrade to a suite when we announced we were in Rome to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. The reception staff were excellent....courteous, effecient and very helpful. We arrived at approx 12 noon and were shown to our room within an hour even though the usual check in time is 2 pm. A very helpful map was provided and we were ready to begin our holiday. The room was spacious, airy and very comfortable. Air conditioning was adjustable and there were 3 TV's including one in the bathroom. The rooms were serviced daily and to a very high standard. This all helped to make the hotel a fantastic base for our holiday in Rome which involved lots of walking.The cool room and well equipped bathroom was very welcome on our return each day from the intense city heat.. The breakfast was plentiful and simply delicious.Breads, fruit, celeal, juices, water, tea, coffee and cooked bacn and eggs.As much as you could eat! We didn't use the restaurant as the menu looked a little adventurous for our palettes with octopus, squid and veal but I'm sure would be worth a visit. We found other restaurants not far from the hotels which offered a simpler menu. I could not praise the staff in the hotel enough.They wentout oftheir way at all times to help and make our stay as comfortable as possible.I was given 30 minutes free internet access on one of 2 lobby computers which allowed me to check in on line for our return flight and print off our boarding passes.this was very useful. The reception staff also arranged a taxis for our transfer to the airport. Unfortunately when we arrived at the airport we discovered we had left the key of our car in the hotel room. I promptly telephoned the hotel where the receptionist confirmed that housekeeping had brought the key to the front dest. As we had checked in on our flight there wasn't anything more we could about the key. I requested that the hotel staff forward the key as soon as possible as we only had 1 key. The receptionist as my request organised express delivery and the key arrived in Ireland 2 days later. This is a clear indication of the professional approach adopted by all the hotel staff. The hotel was quite busy but everything flowed along without any hustle or bustle.We ate breakfast at different times in the a.m. and the restaurant was always calm and realxing despite the many guests coming and going. We used the Green Line Tour company and bought a 24 hour hop on hop off ticket.On the first day we hopped on for the 2 and a half hour tour and stayed on. We had an hour beak for an icecream and coffee and then repeated the tour again. This gave us a clear idea of where everything was and then we set out to visit all the sites on foot over the next few days. We did book a tour for the Vatican Museums, Sistine Chapel and the Bascilica which was worth every cent. The highlight of the trip was our visit to the Pope's Summer residence were we were present at his recitation of the Angelus and received a papal blessing. Again this tour was worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in the city”
Reviews.Author: Robear1954
Reviews.Content: Clean, well appointed rooms. friendly helpful staff, great location for public transportation. Killer breakfast, close to several nice restaurants. Have read reviews that stated the area around was seedy, not in my experience. My wife, daughter & I felt completely safe on the street, even late night.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel. Centrally Located.”
Reviews.Author: ICONPafos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the STARHOTEL METROPOLE ROME for four nights. We were a family of five and booked two rooms allocated on the seventh floor. This hotel is definitely value for money and the breakfast certainly provides a spread to keep you going for the day. The stafff were extremely friendly and both rooms were ready upon arrival. The hotel staff also provide you with a map when checking in, pointing out the location of the hotel, all the sites and the amenities and services located within the hotel area. It is a short walk to the Termini Station where you will find the GREEN LINE 'Hop on Hop off' bus service - the best way to tour all the sites in Rome during peak season and the Summer Heat. The room service menu is a bit pricey as is the mini bar but there are plenty of kiosks, gelaterias, snack shops and pastry shops within reach (less than 300m as you step out of the hotel, turn right and walk along the pavement). An excellent restaurant with good value for money, prompt service and fantastic food can be found on the same road as you come out of your hotel, turn right and walk two blocks up. The restaurant has large white umbrellas and we visited this restaurant three times during our stay. All in all, it was a great stay, nice rooms, comfortable beds, excellent air-con throughout the hotel and in your room (adjustable) and lovely knock-out blinds in the bedrooms (work electronically) which ensures your stay is a comfortable one. Complimentary slippers and bath robes in all rooms as well as a pressure shower and bath system which offers a great winding down session after a long day walking in the heat. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would certainly visit this hotel when next in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Rhettal
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful. It was really well located - we were close to the Main Termini train station and also between two metro stations which made getting around Rome so easy. We also did A LOT of walking and this hotel was also well located from this point of view. Hotel room was small (we tripped over ourselves), but neat, tidy and well fitted out. Bathroom was spacious. To be fair we werent there to sit in the room, so really it made no difference to us. Window has electric sliding shutter things which provided complete darkness which was good. Gym (one of main reasons we booked) was great - well fitted out with good equipment bikes, treadmill, weights etc certainly did what we needed it to do. Breakfast was great - cereals, breads/pastries, yoghurts, fruit, juice, coffee/tea and the like. Good pricing, plenty of restaurants within walking distance. Overall this was a great start to our trip through Italy. Thank you to Star Hotels Metropole, we would recommend to others and would return if in Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “classy”
Reviews.Author: maresca01
Reviews.Content: definately a 4 star hotel, arguably even a 5 star. When you walk into the hotel you enter a huge, modern, luxorious reception. staff were welcoming and friendly. The room we stayed in was a twin but it was huge. the room was neat, clean and very posh. Even had a TV in the bathroom! Breakfast was plentiful and nice would definately stay again

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a very convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: AVJ002
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a nice hotel in Rome, close to Termini but also close to the historical city centre, and this one was indeed the perfect solution! There are so many crap hotels in Rome so I decided to spend a bit more and be sure to get value for money which we did! Very friendly and polite staff, super rooms, fantastic huge bed, well stocked mini bar etc. There is even a small tv in the bathroom! The breakfast buffet is included in the price, and for being in Italy it is really decent and a good way to start the day. I only have a few small things that drag down a bit, first and foremost that it is not super cheap even though it is good value for money. A few of the little shampoos etc were not changed since last guest and were half empty, but I presume oversight from the cleaning lady, and then I missed some real glasses for the wine bar instead of plastic cups (however in the bathroom there are real glasses so just use those) Overall a great place to stay and would definitely love to stay here again. There is a super restaurant just around the corner called Alessio, which I can really recommend, high quality Italian food at very reasonable prices, it is quite cosy sitting outside which is a closed side street and very private, which is rare to find in Rome where you are generally in the middle of everything,

Reviews.Title: “Did not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: Darthradar
Reviews.Content: When planning our trip to Rome we wanted a good quality hotel in a central location that was close to all the sights. Hotel is very close to Termini station (5 minutes walk from some exits, but not all). Reception areas and rooms were well decorated, clean and spacious. The staff were friendly and professional, including the occasion when my daughters managed to lock themselves out of their room! Air conditioning was a bonus in the hot weather and there was not a problem with noise from the street, which we had read could be a problem in some hotels. However we kept windows closed. Breakfast buffet was very good with lots of choice. Recommend asking for a cappuccino which is brought fresh to the table. Staff at breakfast friendly and attentive, which is always a good start for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: DSA1965
Reviews.Content: Located close to the main train station so a bit far from the sights. Decent and comfortable rooms- we were upgraded to Deluxe rooms. The BF was very good in the restaurant though the service could be a bit better.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Lara8283
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 days in May 2011. There is nothing bad I can say about it, but nothing special as well. Everything is average: design is OK - there're new rooms and there are also non-refurbished ones. There are also rooms that overlook the road, they be can rather noisy, ask for the upper floor or for the "internal" rooms (they have rooms overlooking smth like inner patio). Bed & bathroom were fine. The staff is very helpful. Breakfast is very average. Location is OK. Yes, it is close to the central station, but what for do you need this station? It is like 20-30 or even more minutes walk to any point of interest. We took taxi, but COUNT your change, taxi drivers cheated on us like 3 time)))) And if you in Rome the tariff should be "1", pay attention it should be written on the meter! In sum, it's just clean nice place, but I would definitely look for smth newer, more modern with better location next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for cleanliness, food and service.”
Reviews.Author: KEW72
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel with modern bedrooms and good facilities. The breakfast was ample, with a good variety of choice. The waiters were excellent. The reception staff are also very accomodating. We had a quiet room towards the back of the hotel and did not experience the noise of Rome that many tourists complain of. I have only one complaint and that is that drinks at the hotel are a little pricey - 17 Euros for a G&T and small bottle of beer.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it!”
Reviews.Author: FebrynaW
Reviews.Content: The location is close to Termini station. Just a few blocks away. Checking in was a fast. The room was very cosy and clean, quite big actually.
