The bathroom has all the things we needed. Love the breakfast there. We didn't stay in much..it is Rome. We walked to Trevi fountain and Via Condotti and it took us about 45 mins. Definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: travelgbp
Reviews.Content: Metropole - Rome was not a good experience for us. The front desk was rude and disrespectful on numerous occasions during our stay. We arrived at 5pm and our room was not ready. We also tried to use the business center to print tickets to the sites and the internet was not working. I was told it has been down for two weeks and they didn't bother to fix the problem. The rooms were not clean and small. We found hair in our bathroom on arrival and it smelled of mold/mildew. A very bad experience, the only positive thing about Metropole is that it is close to the train terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Our first time in Rome and we'd definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Sharklovers
Reviews.Content: We only had half a day and one night in Rome, in an effort to be closer to the train station for a morning flight from FCO. We really couldn't have chosen a better hotel. It was about a 6 block walk from Termini, but it wasn't bad at all with a roller duffel and one backpack a piece. The hotel is very centrally located. Check in whas efficient and professional, and oour request for a quiet corner room was fulfilled immediately. No view, but that was OK. The w room was bright, big and clean - and best of all, extremely quiet. It was a real pleasure roaming around Rome for several hours then returning for a peaceful evening. The breakfast in the morning was incredible, and started promptly at 6:30AM. Overall, when we return to Rome we will most likely stay at Starhotels Metropole, and hopefully things will stay as great as they are now. Thanks you for a very pleasureable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: SidBar
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in good location. This is a quality hotel with staff that seem glad to see you and always ready to assist in any way. The hotel was very clean as were the rooms.The location is excellent for just hopping on the subway or bus for sightseeing in the wonderful city of Rome. There are also many good places to eat within a very short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good breakfast, Good stay!”
Reviews.Author: ifeelyourpain77
Reviews.Content: Highly reccomended, good breakfast, nice room, very friendly staff @ the breakfast

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, perfectly located for seeing Rome”
Reviews.Author: jrc50
Reviews.Content: well appointed hotel in excellent location for sightseeing as it is close to both rail & metro stations. We mostly walked - it is about 15 min walk to Colisseum & other highlights. Breakfast was plentiful & good variety. Scrambled egg, bacon & sausage available on buffet - found out on last day that you could order toast & omelettes! Did not dine in hotel as there are lots of good restaurants nearby which are much cheaper. Drinks from tha bar are very expensive - our only criticism. Our room was on the 4th floor at rear of hotel - no great view but very quiet. Very clean and comfortable with impeccable service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, Perfect....Perfect Break! I love Rome!”
Reviews.Author: supernicsy
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend visited Rome for three nights over Valentine's weekend. We got an incredibly fantastic deal considering it was Valentine's weekend - and the hotel was fantastic. The staff were friendly; especially one of the older gentleman serving in the breakfast bar. Our room was big; and the bathroom was lovely and clean. Location was perfect too; only a 5 minute walk from the train station and metro station. The hotel exterior was modern and very well looked after. We didn't spend too much time in the hotel to be honest, as we was out all day and evening enjoying Rome. I loved every single second of Rome; everything about the place was buzzing. We visited the Trevi Fountain every day; had gorgeous bottles of white wine (always go for house - incredible!) and pizza at a lovely little restaurant in the Piazza Navona and even managed to see the pope on Sunday! I could go on allll day about everything we did and how much we enjoyed our time - In four days we do everything we wanted. I would definitely love to visit again for next Valentine's! (Big hint to the boyfriend! :D) Hotel was perfect for coming home after a tiring day and relaxing!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: BlueIrishEyes
Reviews.Content: Our 5th stay at the Starhotel Metropole and it was one of the best! Air conditioning in May is almost unheard of in Rome, but our room was comfortable with adjustable air, very nice clean marble bath and nice wide twin beds. We took friends with who had a king and were happy in every way down the hall. Maid service was efficient and breakfast fabulous. We were here to celebrate my birthday and the Beatification of JPII. The #64 is close by so you can't go wrong with the location!

Reviews.Title: “absolutely brilliant”
Reviews.Author: murram
Reviews.Content: stayed one week.upon hearing we were on honeymoon was immediately upgraded to a junior suite.very clean hotel,wonderful breakfast,extremely helpful and pleasant staff..great location,little bit overpriced..some of the rooms we saw very small for the money..other than that no complaints at all..

Reviews.Title: “Top location, very good service, clean and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: twofromHK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 9 nights when Mr attended a conference. It is a short 10 minute walk to the Rome station so no need for taxi and the hop on hop off bus is just around the corner near the Termini train station also. It is a long walk to main attractions but you can get a 7-day pass and go from the Termini station to stations very close to the Colosseum, Vatican, Spanish Steps etc, or, you can walk like we did many times (we must have done over 100K in the 10 days were were there). There are some shady-looking characters around the Termini train station but there are also police walking around, so just keep you eyes on your belongings at all time and you will be fine. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. Renato at breakfast gave us great service. Thanks Renato! There are plenty of restaurants in the area but we found that IL TAVOLINETTO was the best (see our other review).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fabulous city”
Reviews.Author: CBD44
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in March and loved Rome. The hotel is just a few mins from the station, so if you get the train from the airport it is very convenient. Reception staff were very helpful and our room, although small, was vey clean and comfortable. The buffet breakfast was a good quality and the perfect start to the day. For a first visit to Rome the hotel was great. We would stay here again, however would prefer to be closer to Piazza Navona.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Rooms, Excellent Hotel, Modern Decor and Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: jingga18
Reviews.Content: This is probably the best hotel we stayed at during our two-week trip in Italy. At first we were checked-in to an older room with a very noisy air-conditioning. The sound of the air-conditioning was probably on par with the roaring of an old truck. We got moved to another room immediately, where we spent the first night. This room was better, but the air conditioning wasn't working. When we made a complaint again, the got upgraded to a much better room. The decor of the third room was much more modern and the room was much bigger. Because Rome was the last leg of our trip, we sent a package from Milan directly to Rome to avoid carrying heavy bags through Italy. We completely forgot about this when checking-in but the receptionist reminded our bell-man to bring out our package to our room without us even asking for it. This is a busy hotel. There are always a lot of people at breakfast. But breakfast room is big enough to accomodate guests even at peak hours. Breakfast selection is somewhat bigger compared to the other hotels we've stayed at in Italy. Staff is helpful, location very convenient to commute from. Its proximity to Termini Station was the reason why we chose this hotel in the first place. A lot of busses run until past midnight to and from Termini. Wi-Fi is available in your room at extra cost. Lobby area offers free wi-fi but we never used it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - nice hotel, but could use just a little improvement”
Reviews.Author: CB10019
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 nights here. We were given a nicer room than booked upon check-in (they didn't have our reservation in the system when we arrived) that included a terrace area which was nice for our son to run around a bit - also to have a nice lunch one afteroon. The hotel is nicely located and clean which was our goal. For your money (I think it's a very reasonably priced hotel contrary to some other reviews), you get a clean room, a decent breakfast, a small fitness area and mostly professional service. Now, for those that may be thinking this is a four star hotel as it states it is, it's not by American standards (or my opinion). For example, there is no turn down service, no free wi-fi unless you are in higher catergory rooms or you can get 30 minutes in the lobby, no real good choice of on-property dining (did not eat at the hotel restaurant for lunch or dinner as it was always empty), the lobby lounge was always empty too and their selection of wine by the glass was dissapointing (come on, this is Italy)! The waiter was always hidden in the back of the bar and you had to wait for him to appear to get something. Seems they could have a decent crowd if they put some effort into offerings and service in their lounge area. Listening to the elevator at all hours of the night was a bit disturbing, but got used to it after a night or two.The front desk is hit or miss.. a few very nice and helpful, one or two arrogant and condescending on ocassion. We did get one good restaurant recommendation. Overall, a nice, clean place to crash after touring this wonderful city, just don't expect 4 star luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, But if you have a chance dont choose !”
Reviews.Author: ecealtan
Reviews.Content: hotel is very near to roma termini central station, and the breakfast is very good ! Buttt hotel is very old, the door can not opened withput pushing very hard, the furnitures are so old, Tv is old you can watch only few channels, the room cleaners come very very early! And the worst thing is! they try to make an suspended ceiling but then they put some materials between ceeling and the suspended ceiling you can see the concrete, any bug..vs can fall to your head when you are in bathroom. ıf you can find another hotel near to central station not choose this hotel, also price is high for these !

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, fab hotel, if you can stretch finances to stay here do it!”
Reviews.Author: Cooky6699
Reviews.Content: The location and quality of this hotel was why I initially looked at it. Yes it's a bit expensive but for our trip ( me and my sister) thought we'd push the boat out. The location is spot on. So close for transfers train bus etc. Nice quality shops locally and some fantastic restaurants. Staff at the hotel couldn't do enough for you and speak excellent English. Would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “huge room, like a hilton”
Reviews.Author: kcf21
Reviews.Content: refurbished hotel, very new, great big beds, huge room. the room heating was too high so had to sleep with window open. inward facing window so had no problems with noise. area is pretty quiet anyway so can't image any problems with outward facing rooms either. since it was an old hotel, seems the plumbing was not refurbished. the toilet had typical old hotel smell...i've experienced this in some london hotels as well. free wifi in the lobby area and also they have computer station to use the internet in the lobby. breakfast was decent selection but quality was least of the 4 hotels we stayed at in italy. but definitely sufficient. walkable from termini even with several bags, pretty convenient and decent rate. would stay here again for no frills work trip.

Reviews.Title: “A good value and location!”
Reviews.Author: KatietheQuestionLady
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel were very respectful, warm and helpful to tourists. The room was comfortable; clean; quiet; offered a valuables safe, a stocked mini-bar, hairdryer, a useful outlet in the bathroom (!) and space to relax and stretch out. The full breakfast would accommodate many appetites. Couldn't have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best city hotels we have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Michael_R_Dublin
Reviews.Content: From when we arrived, this hotel met our expectations from the Reception onwards. We had a deluxe room (options Superior / De Luxe / Mini Suite). I cannot comment on other room types. It was fresh, clean, very quiet, extremely well-appointed and included bathrobes and slippers for our comfort. The lighting was excellent. Everything worked, including air conditioning. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the duvet and pillows were top-quality. As a back-sufferer the first few nights are usually sore; that was not my experience this time. A selection of teas (including camomile) were provided, along with instant coffee sachets. The bathroom was very well appointed and stocked. If I wereto be 'picky' (which would be a little unfair, given the facilities and service received): TV channels were very limited for English-speaking visitors (not a problem when out sight-seeing all day) Not all Reception staff were as helpful as they might have been (but most were) If you need non-allergenic pillows / duvet; pre-order them WiFi in room requires subscription (and we couldn't access the free WiFi in Reception/Lobby for some reason. What makes this hotel: Location Quality of room and room services Breakfasts (request a cafe latte instead of the coffee from the heated urn.... gorgeous) The restaurant staff at breakfast-time; highly efficient and friendly (one gentleman in particular does his very utmost for his customers). Friendly, attentive service makes such a difference! If I go back to Rome (which is my intention) I hope to re-visit the Starhotels Metropole. The last time we stayed (in Rome) we were in a nearby 4* hotel, and have no complaints whatsoever, but this hotel is 'streets ahead' and worth every euro.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: dschornack
Reviews.Content: Starhotels is the only chain I would ever stay in when traveling to Europe! It is clean, staff is friendly, always centrally located, rooms are spacious and it's always a GREAT DEAL! This is one of my favorite ones out of their chain! Metropole is a fantastic location, right down the street from Termini. So, if you're just flying in or actually site seeing Rome, it's 1 block down the street from the train station!!! And, this train station is a FABULOUS way to see Rome. I believe under 5 Euro for an all day pass, and each of the stops is a major site! I highly recommend this hotel, has an included hot breakfast ... you can't go wrong! And, what's better than a family owned business!?

Reviews.Title: “Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Tjang
Reviews.Content: I really surprised because we can check in at 8.00 am, after we take 13 hour flight from singapore to rome. The room is clean and location very good near termini station. Ia lot off restaurant near this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: MikeSF
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty good. It's close to the central station (in the nice part of town). The room was very nice, clean, and quiet. The breakfast was good, not as good as some others, but fine. The fitness center was small but adequate. The only real drawback was the somewhat indifferent service of the front desk and the servers at breakfast, and there was no free wifi (not that widespread, I guess, in Rome, but for the price of this hotel it should have had it).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, service, and location - best of the 6 we stayed in this trip”
Reviews.Author: BadaBingosMaestro
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with everything about this hotel. location is good, hotel is very clean, comfortable rooms, great breakfast included, very good bang for the buck. i have traveled extensively and come in with appropriate expectations for what i am paying, etc. this place definitely exceeded our expectations. the first room we were given was great except that it was obviously a smoking room and we ended up changing it with no problem and everything from then on was very nice. front desk always very helpful and would definitely stay here again. Great little restaurant/carry out place around the corner and down the block if you want a good cheap meal or bring back wine/beer etc. called il tavolinetto. nothing fancy but great little local joint. it is right next door to the much more advertised restaurant with the big chicken signs that is a complete rip off called la galiana bianca. night and day - great friendly owner at the little corner place and very fair pricing. the chicken joint will rip you off big time with service fees and many other unexpected charges. The opera house is also only about 2 blocks away and we went to a great show and had a box on the 3d floor to the side but very reasonable and a great venue to see a performance with a great orchestra etc. only 30 euros each. Only 2 of us in our private box too. enjoy this hotel and the many sites of rome that are not hard to walk to and also take the busses and trains which were also great and mostly included in the rome pass. we saw all the main sites (vatican, coliseum, pantheon, etc) and never waited a minute in any lines anywhere. weather was in the 50's and i think december is a great time to visit and avoid all the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “a Nightmare....turn into a dream-to-dream”
Reviews.Author: StefanoCamassa
Reviews.Content: Im a business traveller and I am also working within the Travel industry, therefore even if is part of my job to test and check the quality of hotels I also make sure to avoid in leaving my comments following my business trips. But there should always be an expectation and here it is: On the 17th Dec I was one of those unfortunate BA clients which end up to be stuck somewhere in Europe unable to return to London due to the severe weather in most of the UK. I was forced to spend 3 days in long lines facing the BA ticketing office in order to be registered on another flight that later on will be cancelled and start all over again. Out of desperation together with hundred of other travellers I was forced to commute everyday to and from Termini station and the airport. So my accommodation at the Starhotel Metropole, which was planned to be for only 2 nights, was then extended each day to a total of 5 nights. The frustration and drama of been forced to spend a full day at an airport terminal could turn anyone to despair, but luckily each time I returned to the hotel front desk staff made sure that my original room was re-assigned to me and kept it in case another flight cancelled, at one stage the hotel even provided me with clean clothes (without me requesting it, probably they realised I had a 2 days bag lasting on to 5!). The attention to details was to what you would normally expect from a 5 star hotel anywhere else in Europe, polite service followed by honest concern of your safety and well-being. To conclude, if you ever will be in Rome for business or pleasure and want to be located near the Termini station, don’t hesitate to consider the Starhotel Metropole as you main base during your stay, they certainly know how to make everyone feel welcomed and well looked after. Well done to Starhotel Chain in Italy, to keep up with the investment even in such challenging times for the hospitality industry! Well done to all the staff at the Starhotel Metropole Rome, for keeping such a consistency on their standards and service level! And if you ever end up in Rome (with or without snow falling in UK!), and you need a personal touch, dont hesitate to ask at the concierge for their GM Mr Mauro Polmonari, he will never shine away or hesitate to come to the rescue for making your stay a memorable one whatever are your needs or requirements. Certainly Starhotel cannot delete the memories of BAA nightmare but can certainly give some teaching suggestion on how a client should always be pampered as the Most Important Client 'Always'! Well done Starhotel Metropole for turning a daily nightmare into a dream-to-dream.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Dumbo1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and it was fantastic. We took the train from Fiumicino Airport directly to Termini Station, which is just a 5 minute walk from the hotel. We expected hotels in Europe to be small, but we were surprised how big the room was when we got there, also very clean (we booked a double room). The only down thing was that we got a nice view of a telephone mast and not the city, even though we were on the 9th floor. The staff were friendly and can speak English. Breakfast was a buffet (hot and cold food) which was included in our package. There were a few nice restaurants in the area if you walk towards Via Nazionale, and don't forget the gelato!

Reviews.Title: “don't expect a warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: Aussiemum69
Reviews.Content: We arrived with our 2 weary children to a very disinterested reception staff and it didn't get any better. this is not a family friendly hotel ,rooms are looking very tired ,staff generally unfriendly and disinterested ..except housekeeping and breakfast wait staff they were always cheery and friendly..well done to these 2 groups of staff .It was not cheap ,but don't think the smiles are bigger the more money you pay ..as we have found on our travels ,especially around Europe.We had trouble with the reception staff sorting our transfer to the train station we ended up having to ring our UK tour organiser ,this we found very frustrating and poor on the hotel's behalf.We were extremely disappointed and our advice is DON"T BOTHER with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: hollygolightley13
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a two week trip to Rome and stayed at the Starhotel Metropole the entire time. I travel to Europe a couple times a year and was very pleased with this hotel and would absolutely consider staying there again. POSITIVES: - About 2 blocks away from Tremini Station ( a large subway & train station) which is excellent for hoping on the train for day trips to other cities - Breakfast was included in our stay and was very good (by our second day the waiters already memorized our drink requests) with good variety (eggs, sausages, toasts, jam, fruit, cereal, breakfast breads etc.) - Staff was quite friendly, helpful and informative and were always willing to look things up for us - Hotel was clean and very comfortable... we slept very well each night after a long day exploring the city - Everyone was very helpful, made us a breakfast bag to go for our early morning flight back to the US. Had plenty of maps to help guide us NEGATIVES -The hotel is within walking distance to most attractions (about 30 minute at a leisurely kip on average) expect to walk a bit

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: spry13
Reviews.Content: This hotel is upscale within walking distance of the main train station termini. Clean and comfortable with breakfast 630 to 10. expensive internet; use services on same street past Via Cavour for a quarter of the price here. Desk staff very helpful. Three elevators for guests. Full luggage service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marco2311
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot on business and pleasure and this is one of the best hotels in which I've stayed. The staff are courteous, the rooms spacious and clean and very quiet (our room overlooked the central quadrangle). Breakfasts are excellent and the small gym is open 24hrs. You can get a train from the airport to the Termini station and walk 300m to the hotel (no rip-off taxis) and then walk to all the major sites in Rome. An excellent hotel base for sightseeing whilst avoiding all the noisy tourists (like us!).

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel: Modern and Pretty Clean but has a GREAT Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: millcrews
Reviews.Content: We chose Starhotels Metropole mostly because we were looking for a nice hotel with modern decor for a cost of roughly $300 per night. Starhotels Metropole is located about 3 blocks from Termini Station which sounds really nice at first but it's actually kind of out of the way. Also, train stations tend to draw some less attractive segments of society and I saw a lot more people begging and lying on the sidewalk on the streets close to our hotel than I saw in the rest of Rome. As can be expected, the pictures that are on the hotel's website look much better than the hotel itself. It was a bit shabby and the furniture was all pretty saggy in the lobby. In our room, the bed was anything but saggy. It was VERY hard! I fell back on it when we first got to our room and it actually hurt a little bit. We were upgraded to a jr. suite since it was our anniversary, and it was nice to have the extra room provided by the sitting area. The view was nonexistent -- looking out onto the windows of other rooms. The decor was modern and simple and suited us perfectly. The bathroom was nice and pretty big, but the shower setup was a bit odd. There was not a curtain or a door, just a piece of glass that extended out to half the length of the tub which meant that every time you took a shower, the water ended splattering all over half of the bathroom. The drains in the shower and the sink were VERY slow and we ended up standing in our gross, dirty shower water. So, we were not bowled over by the room, but the breakfast was another story. For an included breakfast, they did a GREAT job! We walked in and found that they had eggs, bacon, sausage, pastries, cereals, yogurt, and a selection of cold cuts and cheeses. In addition, they had three kinds of juice, coffee, tea, etc. It was fantastic! I probably wouldn't stay at Starhotels Metropole again primarily because it was kind of far away from Rome's center (I would say at least 10 minutes of hard walking, 15 if you walk at a normal pace) and that extra distance really added a lot of strain after we had walked all over Rome during the day. For the value and comfort, you could probably find something a lot closer to good restaurants or to the sights that would be just as good. Oh, and the internet was not free -- it was 11,50 Euros per day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location/Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: cindy050
Reviews.Content: My partner was put up here for a conference and I was all about seeing Rome. The hotel was in a great location for getting all around the city. I walked almost everywhere but on the occasion I wanted to take the bus, the main bus station and train was one block away. Several main streets out to the rest of the city were near and getting to all my destinations wasn't a problem. The noise from the streets below did not enter the hotel and the staff was always helpful and kind. Breakfast was more than adequate. The rooms were very clean and updated. The beds were quite comfortable. We took 2 day trips and the locations where we got on the tour buses were very close to the hotel. Probably wouldn't have ever stayed here if my partner wasn't on company business, but I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “just an amazing place”
Reviews.Author: pauldawn08
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome for 3 nights, the hotel is ideally situated near to the Termini Building only took us 5 minutes to walk there. The hotel is very clean and the rooms well laid out, and the bed very comfortable - we had B&B and the breakfast was very varied with good quality food with good service. The sights of ancient Rome are about a 15 minute walk with the centre being about the same - we walked to the Vatican and back but you could get the underground as a station is close to the Vatican. We found eating out ok but strongly recommend you avoid the main areas - go down the side streets, places are just as good.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Dolph10
Reviews.Content: This hotel had nice accomodations. We stayed in a suite, so we had more room than I expected. The bed was comfortable, the staff friendly, and the atmosphere was good too. It is also located very close to the train station so we were able to walk to it and then take the metro to the different tourist sites. There were several good restaurants in the area as well.

Reviews.Title: “Snap up a room at a good price”
Reviews.Author: PetertheJustOkay
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. They were so kind to hold on to a suitcase while I traveled to Naples, even though I wasn't going to check in here for another week. Giuseppe's a great baggage handler. Breakfasts were very good. Rooms were nice sized. Beds were so comfortable. BUT when I tried to book for a return, the price was 420 euro a night for a single, way out of the previous booking's price range. So book in advance and watch the yo-yo pricing!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel With A good Location”
Reviews.Author: samira-bm
Reviews.Content: we stayed there at 3 night,the room was small but clean and nice.the breakfast was good...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for money.”
Reviews.Author: theworkerbee0411
Reviews.Content: Great location to walk every where! As mentioned, rooms are a good size by European standards and even though ours was a little tired, it was a welcome refuge for the weary traveler. Breakfast buffet included a little of everything and while none of it was excellent it certainly wasn't awful and allowed us to start out day energized and ready to walk for hours. One thing in particular I'd like to mention is that there is a shortage of rooftop patios around but we noticed that the hotel across the street from the Metropole had a small sign announcing they had a roof top terrace (Hotel Diana). After hours of walking, it was lovely to end the day with a glass of wine or cold beer away from the noise and crush on the streets. Just ask the front desk clerk at the Hotel Diana how to get up there and take your camera as they also have an observation deck up there. Other wise the Metropole has everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you need when visiting Rome”
Reviews.Author: felicarrillo
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome for four days so we knew we would have a packed agenda of sightseeing and walking. The hotel is clean, with friendly service and a very good breakfast (make sure you get it included as it will get you ready of carbs and proteins for a full day of walking around the city). To top all off the hotel is walking distance from Termini which will connect you to 1) FCO Airport 2) city buses and 3) to the two metrolines that will take you directly to the sightseeing places like colosseum, Vatican, Piazza Espagna among others (buy the Roma pass for further discounts). All in all I recommend this to anybody visiting Rome for tourism and when back in rome I will definetely consider this Hotel an option again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location but a little hard to find”
Reviews.Author: sona
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel April 2009, sorry for the late review but I thought I better write one. ROOM: I upgraded my room to a delux, which, apparently is the same size as standard as we've bene told when checking in but had more facilities so we didnt mind paying a little extra. What can I say! Clean bed sheet, clean room, even the kettle was clean (no limescale). With plenty of teabags/coffee etc. Room was big enough for the two of us. The bathroom was very clean, there wasnt anything broken, or cracked. Not even cracks/stains on the walls, it was immaculate (and I am a clean freak!). Plenty of towels. Bed were so comfty, it was like sleeping on a cloud! We even had slippers, a bathroom robe and a small TV on our bathroom as we had a delux room! what a nice touch. Very quiet, couldnt hear the other guests next door so was able to sleep and relax whilst in the room. Though we didnt get much of a view (facing the other side of the hotel) but we didnt mind this.. LOCATION The location is good too, 3 mins walk to terminal train station (just turn left out the station down the main road, turn on on of the road on the right) Though I couldnt find this hotel when I was walking to it, there was no clear sign posted on the street and I literally had to to a double take to go back! When we entered, the reception was well decorated, chandeliers handing, very posh looking. Reception staff were very friendly. One day, we mentioned that a homeless looking man trying to open my bag on the bus from the vatican, the guy at reception was very annoyed and was ready to call the police! but we assured him that nothing was taken as I caught him red handed! Just proves how helpful the reception staff are if one did need the police. But do be careful when in crowded buses/tubes, its the perfect opportunity for pickpockets to steal. You can see most of Rome within walking distance form this hotel but on some days we were too tired so got the bus on the way back, which runs right outside on the main street. We took the bus to the vatican on day as its a little far from the hotel. If you want to visit the vatican, best to avoid sundays as it is busy, we went on monday and was very quiet and didnt wait too long in the queue for the museum, maybe 25 mins or so. There are a few restaurants within the area, some right next door, on the left of the hotel but we found one of them to be expensive and the food wasnt very good, brocolli was overcooked (wasnt green anymore as it should be) and over cooked chicken (was dry) . If you walk towards the collesium you can find better priced restaurants which we did one day and the food was probably a little better. Though one of them along here charged us 1 euro each on top of our bill, which already had the service charge. We asked why theres 2 euros extra, they said because we sat at the table so its 1 euro each!! there wasnt any other place to sit except inside! I couldnt believe this! But most restaurants in Rome are expensive anyway so I guess we just beared with it. BREAKFAST Breakfast was good, nothing fantastic but the usual things: pastires, bread rolls, tea/coffee, cereal, fresh fruit such as oranges, apple etc. Scrambled eggs were a little too wet/watery so I gave that a miss but everything else was fine. Enough to be satisfied. We didnt eat in the restaurant for dinner so I cant comment. I saw the prices and seemed quite expesnive so we ate outside, as there were plenty of places to eat. Overall, we liked this hotel because we couldnt fault the quality of the rooms, service and location. If this hotel is within your budget, then I'd recommend it. Just be careful of the pick pockets!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable, peaceful refuge for a Roman 'holiday'”
Reviews.Author: Delreybird
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 nights at the Hotel Metropole during our recent visit to Rome. I selected this hotel because it was close to the Termini rail station, and I did not want to take a cab to get to the station to catch our train to Florence at the end of our stay in Rome. After we settled in, we also discovered that the Metropole is conveniently located close to Rome's public-bus transportation hub. This meant that we could board the No. 40 "express" bus at the start of its route and be assured of getting seats (in short supply on Rome's buses). We were also only a couple of Metro stops away from the Colosseum and the Forum. But best of all, the Hotel Metropole turned out to be a great place to return to after an exhausting day of serious sight-seeing in the early-September heat. Our room was big and the king bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was spacious. And our room was quiet. We not only never heard a sound from the rooms on either side of us, we never heard any noise from the hallway through the thick door. And since it was an interior room opening on the hotel's "air space," we weren't bothered by street noise either -- and there is a lot of that in Rome. The staff couldn't have been nicer. The desk clerk gave us an upgrade when we checked in. The waiters at breakfast were all very friendly and one of them practically adopted us. From an American's standpoint, the hotel's breakfast, included with the room, was excellent -- several cereal choices, an assortment of fresh fruit, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage and pastries. A large hotel that caters primarily to business people and tour groups, the Metropole is not in the trendiest (or even half-way trendy) part of Rome. But the neighborhood around the hotel is lively and full of decent, affordable restaurants. As we were mostly too pooped at the end of the day to go "out" for dinner, this proved to be a godsend. We didn't feel a need to be close to the Piazza Navona or the Trevi Fountain or the Via Veneto in any case. We needed a good jumping-off point for our daily sight-seeing forays, and the Metropole filled that bill.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location, rooms have seen better days”
Reviews.Author: ana_w1
Reviews.Content: We were moved here for a night from another hotel who had messed up our booking, prior to going on a cruise for our honeymoon the next day. We had only paid £60 for the other hotel and so effectively stayed in this hotel for a fantastic price. Reception kindly put us in one of the larger rooms on the top floor. The hotel lobby was beautiful, as were the other communal areas. The room was large, with two televisions, including a small one on a bracket in the bathroom. There was also a small seating area. The bed was comfortable, room quiet, with good black our blinds behind the curtains, which worked electronically (although, one was slightly temperamental). However, the room has definately seen better days, with older style furnishings, old fashioned tvs and run down bathroom. Once they have been refurbed, this hotel will be great. Would recommend this hotel only if you get a great price. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel all round”
Reviews.Author: 186361Ruben
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed for four nights at the star metropole and found it to be very comforting and welcoming. The room we had was very clean and ready for us on arrival. Plenty of choice at breakfast, the teaboy would come to our table as soon as we sat down and ask us if we would like tea or coffee. The hotel is well situated and within walking distance of all of the big sites. i would strongly recommend a restaurant called thats amore located close to the hotel [via agostino de depretis] good food for goo value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TerryMontreal_Canada
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the Metropole in Rome. Very clean, great room, nice breakfast with lots of variety. Within 10 minutes max walk from the Roma Termini. Close to the start of the Hop-on Hop-off bus tour (ask at the front desk). Walkable to Trevi Fountain, Piazza Republica and the Colisseum.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good service, location and value”
Reviews.Author: loversoftravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a trip to Italy where we spent 3 nights at this hotel. They were extremely accomodating and had a room ready for us when we checked in. They had also made reservations for us at restaurants we had requested by email prior to our arrival and helped us with our travel plans. The room we had was very clean (large by city standards), modern with a large modern bath and beautiful marble shower. The bed was very comfortable! I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great hotel in this location. The breakfast buffet included is excellent but if you like American coffee I would recommend you skip it and ask for expresso or cappucino as others have recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Genuine Service, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ChristenChewSP
Reviews.Content: Service for European standard hotel excellent, 90% of all staff helpful and with genuine smiles. Early check in from 7am after 11 hours very much appreciated. Rooms are clean, well appointed , housekeeping ladies honest and everything works well. You will feel safe and taken care of in this hotel. Special mention to Souare from front desk who maintained always cheerful demeanour all though the night shift , ever helpful and gave great suggestions on places to go and Danielle at the bar, my impromptu Italian language teacher. And the location, near the Termini station where busses, trains and all tours operators seem to meet, could not be more perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you are travelling by train.”
Reviews.Author: Hollywood1973
Reviews.Content: A good base in Rome, especially good location if travelling by train. Only a few hundred meters away from central station without the noise you would expect. Safe, comfortable hotel with all the ameneties you would want when returning from sightseeing. This is a good 4 star property and does not try and be a 5 star property. If you are going to Rome for shopping or fine dining I suggest a hotel closer to the Spanish Steps. More vibe, more 5 star properties but also more cost. Kind front office allowed us to check out at 4pm as they were aware we had a very late flight that night. It won't get forgotten and was much appreciated. One little thing they should develop is FREE Wi-Fi and or allow ineternet usage to be FREE for short periods. I think the cost they charged was excessive.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: NinasMommy
Reviews.Content: Decor is contemporary, but not cold. Excellent and very professional staff. Our room was great- everything- from the plush robe to the nice flat screen TV that we watched when we got in late at night after a long hard day of sightseeing :-). We loved it! Great drinks at the bar too. We would completely recommend this hotel and would plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bella Roma!”
Reviews.Author: samjonk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Starthotels Metropole for 5 nights and we had a wonderful time. The hotel is nearby (5 minutes walk) the main trainstation (with metro and busstation), so you can reach every main attraction within a short time. The use of the metro is cheap and efficient. A one way ticket to every metrostation within the centre of Rome is 1 Euro and a dayticket (also to use in the bus or tram) cost 4 Euro pp. The check in at the front desk was quick and sufficient. We told the hotel by email that we would arrive with an early flight, so one room was held available for us after check in. We had 2 double (Superior) rooms (room no. 101 and 102), opposite of each other and with a private entrance that we looked at night for privacy. The view from room 101 was not so nice. The rooms were clean, spacious and they looked renovated. The bathroom didn't have a separate shower, but that was okay for us. Our beds were wonderful. The sheets were pearly white and were changed every day. Furthermore we could pick out our choice of pillows, but unfortunately after calling the front desk and asking 2 times for the pillows, they didn't seemed available anymore. (a bit strange since it was low season, and, to my opinion, a hotel should not offer this service if they can't meet the demands!). Breakfast was okay, but not wonderful. The quality was very good, but not much variety. The cappucino and coffee were great!!! There are a lot of great restaurants nearby (reasonably priced and good quality food). There were 2 persons at the front desk who I really liked. They were helpful and very friendly. Unfortanutely the other persons looked bored and moody. Here's a tip. Watch out for restaurants nearby the main attractions. They offer you special low priced menu's, but the portions are like kids portions and the choice of food is very limited!! Some restaurants also charge you for the bread the give you as a starter. They don't ask you if you want to have it, they just put it on your bill. The prices are ridiculous, we were charged an extra 8 euro for old bread!!! That was more than they ask for pasta or pizza!!! Also mind the service fee some restaurants put on you bill!! Some restaurants add more than 20 %. Rome is wonderful city to explore. Great sightseeing, lots of fine restaurants and great for shopaholics (like myself!!).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Sylvia162
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for two nights in August. We had two superior rooms, which wre located opposite each other. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel was very modern and clean with huge rooms and although the temperature outside was very hot, the air conditioning was great and the bed one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in and with a choice of pillows there was something to suit everyone. No real view from either windows, but as this was purely a base, we did not spend any time in the room, only to sleep. The sheets were changed every day, even though we only stayed two nights. The location was great, 5 mins walk from Termini station, yet in a decent area, where walking around at night was not a problem. Huge choice for breakfast, both hot and cold, with Capuccino an option for coffee and friendly waiting staff. For a central Rome hotel, I was not expecting such high standards and would definitely recommend this hotel to all. If all Starhotels meet these standards, I would have no hesitation staying in one again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - good value”
Reviews.Author: ElliotNY
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay at the Metropole. After checkin, I was put in a room on the 9th floor. The room was large and comfortable, but you could tell it hadn't been updated in a while. We slept the first night in that room, the air conditioner wasn't working right so the next morning they updated us to a junior suite. The next room was on the 6th floor, and that floor was noticeably nicer and more recently updated. The beds were firm and comfortable, the bathrooms were spacious and contemporary. The rooms are quite sizeable for a european hotel. The location is absolutely perfect. Its a 3-4 minute walk from the central bus/train terminal. You can go anywhere in the city, or even country, from the central terminal. The hotel is only about a 10 minute subway ride from the Colosseum. The hotel staff is eager to help with any queries, and is knowledgeable about getting around the city. They are a bit reserved at first, but will warm up to you after being asked a few questions. One of the night staffers at the front desk was quite unhelpful, but the rest were alright. The internet is extremely overpriced, but there are cheaper internet cafe's down the block. Breakfast was great to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: LinandKirst
Reviews.Content: We have just finished a 4 night stay at the star hotel metropole as part of a 2 week holiday in italy. It is situated 5 minutes from the termini train station near a number of reasonably priced restaurants (expect about 40 to 50 euros) for a 2 course meal. We had a nice surprise when the hotel upgraded us to a junior suite after we mentioned we were on our honeymoon. This was a larger room with a sofa on a higher floor. Rooms are comfy with good air con and modern facilities. Breakfast is a good spread with eggs, bacon and pastries. It's easy to get around in Rome and the hotel has 2 very near metro stops..but you can walk to most sites within 30 minutes or so. All the sites are very busy so we advise that you pre book tickets for the Vatican via their own website which is cheaper than all the tour operators and the colliseum to skip the queues! In summary we couldn't fault the hotel at all. We chose it on price paying about 120 euros a night or so but we booked 4 months prior. If you are looking for a clean, modern hotel then this will be fine for you. Ps the beds are very comfy....! We have tried to be objective even though we had an upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful hotel - exceptionally rude and unhelpful front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: chrisod78
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 10 days with colleagues on business. The front desk staff treated us as if we were an inconvenience to them. Even a request to order a taxi was met with exasperation and surliness. The internet access cost 22 euros per day and the connection was unreliable and extremely slow. The porters on the other hand were extremely helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to return to after a hectic day”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn9
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading reviews on Trip Advisor and were so glad we did. Spent 8 nights there, so plenty of time for things to go wrong if they were going to. Hotel did everything it should - great room (no view as we were overlooking inner courtyard, but totally quiet at night), very efficient staff, and good choice at breakfast. Deserving special mention is the Japanese waiter (Inaki?) who is definitely the star of the show - nothing was too much trouble and his friendly manner with everyone meant a great start to the day. The hotel should make sure they hold on to him - he would be an asset to any good standard hotel! We even had a celebrity presence at the hotel - two of the Osmonds with their families were there for a few days! Location of the hotel was okay - slightly out of the way of the main sights, although transport was nearby. Normally wouldn't have minded the 15/20 minute walk to the main historic centre, but Rome was suffering from a heatwave at the time which made too much physical activity exhausting. We found the buses more pleasant to use than the Metro, and normally caught them from Via Nazionale, just five minutes away. Only slight complaint (and it was a small one) is that the deluxe room we had didn't have an iron & ironing board, which would have been very useful and the front desk couldn't supply one when we asked. Area was okay in terms of personal safety, with enough restaurants if you didn't feel like going far at night. Specially good was Alessio's, just around the corner in Via del Quirinale, which was several levels up from the other slightly mediocre but adequate places in P. Amadeo. All in all, if you prefer a modern, efficient, American-standard hotel, rather than a 'character' place, you won't be disappointed with this one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: lovetoflygirl
Reviews.Content: Had a really wonderful experience at this hotel. After taking the redeye over from America, they allowed me to check in at 10am. Hotel was really nice, clean, modern, and cold AC! Loved it! Highly recommend. As a matter of fact, my friend that I traveled with is going back to Rome with her whole family and they are booking there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Very Good stay overall”
Reviews.Author: deepakmalik1
Reviews.Content: Excellent location Near the train termini - and 15-30 minutes walk to any of the sightseeing locations. We walked to almost all the places (Colloseum / Piazza Novona / Spanish steps etc) comfortably and had to take transport only for our trip to the Vatican Staff was decent and arranged for room for us even when we arrived hours before the check-in time Breakfast spread was very good and the rooms were spacious and comfortable, neat and clean. The Tea-coffee maker in the room was useful with a good choice of teas, coffe and hot chocolate options provided Overall a comfortable stay at the Hotel which supported our sightseeing schedule!

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Hepu
Reviews.Content: We went to the hotel before official check-in time but the receptionist was nice and arranged us room already. They served us in fluent English. The room itself was extremely spacious, clean and quiet. Bed was comfortable and they even had selection of different type of pillows to be ordered to the room free of charge. Breakfast included everything you expect strating from fruits, vegetables, yoghurts to eggs, croissants, muffins. Gym was standard as you usually see (running mat, bicycles, free weights, stepper) for some basic exercise. Location is near metro. On the same street there are other hotels and we felt it safe to walk even late in the evening. I'm very satisfied and nothing to complain.

Reviews.Title: “Professionally Run”
Reviews.Author: barry_silverstein
Reviews.Content: Hello fellow Trippies; My wife and I stayed here during a stop in May. This Hotel is very close to the Station, but fear not, the neighborhood is great and the close loaction makes it very accessible. This is a large Hotel, the chain also owning the Michael Angelo in New York City and Palacio in Paris. It is extremely well run, the Staff prompt and professional. The Hotel does charge 10 euros per hour for the internet, something that is not appropriate given the level of the establishment but this seems to be typical of Rome Hotels. I opted for the 20 Euros for 24 hours, but be forewarned, that's 20 Euros to use within 24 hours, not for 24 hours worth of Internet. Fortunately, the Hotel service provider courteously corrected the confusion when I tried to go on line the second day after using the internet for 20 minutes the first day. The rooms are very nice, the Staff extremely courteous and professional (Thank you Alissandro) and the breakfast outstanding. If you are looking for a larger Hotel with good pricing, a very good breakfast, and very comfortable rooms, look no farther.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeq42477
Reviews.Content: Just came back after staying for 4 days at the Metropole. It was very very clean, the staff was very friendly and helpful, the breakfast was extensive (bad coffee tho!) and the location is walking distance from Termini Station. I would stay there again and will recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Can recommend”
Reviews.Author: AwfulRussian
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in May 2010. Have chosen this one because of the location - few steps from Termini. Not much to say - good quality rooms, good breakfast, reasonable service. About 20 min by feet to Colosseum. Overpriced like most of the hotels in Europe. 2 things which really surprise me in Starhotels (multiple experience) - they also put one bathrobe and slippers in the room despite of the fact it is obviously occupied by 2 persons. Another issue is internet at 10 Euro per hour ... I really do not appreciate this in a reasonably expensive 4 star facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Good solid hotel with helpful staff, great breakfast, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: RedUakari
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend here with my boyfriend over Memorial Day. Hotel is solid-not outstanding but definitely good value for your money in Rome given the location, helpful staff, small but very clean and comfortable rooms. Breakfast is wonderful as other people have written. Location is great-close enough to walk to Termini, near metro and bus stops and on a quiet, quaint street. Definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast, great location, perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: ramblerandagambler
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its proximity to the train station, because the train goes directly from the airport to the train station without transfers (14 Euro, each way). We were very happy with the room - it was large, very clean, and had a nice big bathtub. The pillows were also rockin'! The breakfast was extensive, with tons of fresh fruit, pastries, eggs, sausage, bacon, yogurt, etc. Definitely recommend. The only drawback was the Internet service ... wireless was 10 euro an hour or 17 euro for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location at a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: steviegfan
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Starhotels Metropole and have nothing but positive feedback for this hotel. On arrival we were upgraded to a delux room which was both clean and spacious. The location is just a few minutes walk from Termini station and close to all of the major attractions. Breakfast was included in the price and there was plenty of choice, including a hot & cold buffet and as many expresso's / cappucino's as you could manage! Overall, I would recommend Starhotels Metropole as a great place to stay for it's great central location & great value for money

Reviews.Title: “Superb in every way!”
Reviews.Author: JohnAndDawn08
Reviews.Content: I cannot fault this hotel in any way. Book it without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Gteat Location”
Reviews.Author: KeithMajor
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable hotel with good facilities. Smooth check-in, upon arrival found that we were upgraded to an executive suite. Breakfasts plentiful, with good choice and efficient service. Reception staff very happy to recommend local restaurants if you do not want to eat dinner at the hotel. We recommend "Est! Est! Est!" directly opposite the hotel. Hotel Metropole is 5 minutes walk away from Termini station. Terravision coach travel will take you from Ciampino airport for 4 euros single journey. Main sights such as Colloseum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Forum only 15-20 minutes' walk away. We also used the Metro, (especially to visit the Vatican), just 1 euro each for a single journey . Rome is generally expensive, busy and noisy - typical of a major city - but it is cultural, friendly and with fantastic history.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: LoveIt77
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop of a 6 week trip for my husband and I. After a long flight, we were happy to arrive at this very comfortable hotel. Big lobby and relatively friendly front desk staff. Our room was small (to be expected for Europe) but still comfortable. The breakfast buffet was fantastic and the serving staff were very friendly. Great location for exploring a lot of the sites. Big bathroom was nice. If you are looking for a comfortable stay at a reasonable price, this is a great place!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: hanna52
Reviews.Content: very close to the main railway station and to main monuments; staff polite and nice breakfast

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: fister1963
Reviews.Content: very large room, close to the main railway station, good position to visit the main sights of Roma. we higly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “confortable accommodation”
Reviews.Author: miller11953
Reviews.Content: we are satisfied; good location very close to the main railway station. rooms very clean

Reviews.Title: “central location”
Reviews.Author: tammy1959
Reviews.Content: very central hotel , close to the main railway station, good price, staff very polite with guests.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, in every sense”
Reviews.Author: Needysingh
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late in Rome, exhausted and with two tired kids and there was nothing better than to see a very bright and smiling face at the reception. It was a warm welcome and was only a beginning of the wonderful stay we had here. The room was excellent and so were the facilities. The breakfast was delicious and the service was excellent. There is nothing better than a nice and cozy place to stay in when your feet are killing you after day long walks in the romantic city of Rome!

Reviews.Title: “excellent all round hotel for location, service and accomodation, will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: bobbo48
Reviews.Content: on arriving early at our hotel, selected room was not ready, so we were immediately offered an upgrade for no extra charge. staff were all highly efficient and polite. room was spotless .this hotel is located a 5 minute walk to the metro station "Republica". and same distance to Termini station. we walked (10minutes) to the colesseum and forum. overall, we could not fault this property . I will definitely return and reccommend.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit, would return”
Reviews.Author: lilyCheltenham
Reviews.Content: Very convenient, very comfortable, amazing beds. Breakfast excellent. Could not fault this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Metropole Rules”
Reviews.Author: robren88
Reviews.Content: This was one nice hotel. We spent 3 days in Rome and enjoyed the Metropole imensely. The first room we had the thermostat was broken, but they changed the room without a word. The breakfast was perfect and the staff wonderful. If I would make it my home in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: ChristineK027
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from 3 nights in Rome to celebrate our 30th Wedding Anniversary. The Hotel was only 5 minutes walk from the bus & train station and easily found as we had printed a map before we left. The room was spotless although it seemed to be only set up for one person with one set of towels, bathrobe & slippers etc. However, nothing was too much trouble and breakfast was super with excellent service. If we returned to Rome then we would definately book into this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service, Excellent Room, No Problems!”
Reviews.Author: N0Patience
Reviews.Content: My husband booked a week in Rome for the two of us as a Christmas present (lucky girl I am), and so when I began to read through the reviews posted on this website before we left, I was slightly concerned and apprehensive due to some of the negative reviews. I need not have been. We had booked a superior room, which was clean, spacious and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom also well kept, and the shower had excellent water pressure, which I like! Breakfast each day was tasty - a good selection of pastries, cereals, fruit, yoghurts and cheeses were available (continental), alongside bacon, eggs and small sausages. (I made the most of the continental options, what with it being continental Europe and all - croissants were yummy!) One of the breakfast waiters in particular,was a really welcoming, accomodating and good fun. Even in the cases where staff members are not as 'enthusiastic', they are efficient and courteous. All spoke English; a good job since, I'm ashamed to say, my Italian is minimal. In addition, we ate in the restaurant on our first night, and, although perhaps the price of the meal was above average, I found the food to be tasty and the waiters were kind, and what a laugh we had with them too! Yes, the price for wi-fi is expensive, however, there are two internet cafes nearby. The price of TV films is also quite dear, and no, milk is not provided for teas and coffees, however, cappuccino and hot chocolate sachets are available which do not require milk...or fresh milk can be stored in the minibar fridge. Also, this hotel is part of a chain, with conference facilities, so if you want 'rustic ambiance' or 'a quaint Italian hotel', this is probably not for you...there is nothing that makes it obviously 'Italian', it could be situated in any city, anywhere. Some have claimed that the area is run down, and, in truth, it isn't perhaps as clean and maintained as further into the city centre, however, this has advantages because the street is quiet. In addition, the station is nearby for the metro and sightseeing buses, and there are loads of restaurants in the vicinity of the hotel. Check out the ice cream from the wee cafe a few doors down from the hotel, wander out front and turn right on the same side of the road...lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for first visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Merlemond
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a weekend in Rome as a birthday celebration and I was not disappointed. We took coach transfers from the airport to the Termini and the hotel was about five minutes walk away. It was an extremely busy area and I was glad I had printed out a street map and directions beforehand. The hotel reception staff were helpful and spoke good English. Our room was modern, we expected it to be small but it was big enough for a king bed, sideboard, two chairs and a table and the bathroom was a reasonable size. The room was on a high floor so it was quiet, and we had a view over the rooftops. We found it to be an excellent base for exploring Rome. Breakfast was good, and there was a selection of restaurants and bars very close by. The Colosseum was about 10 minutes walk away. The city tour bus stop was just around the corner and we found this invaluable. We bought a 24 hour ticket and we were able to hop on and off the bus to visit all the sights we wanted to see without having to walk up and down the seven hills of Rome! Before we left the UK we had arranged a couple of walking tours online and this enabled us to see the Vatican museums and the Forum, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, etc. with a guide. Please beware of confidence tricksters on the streets of Rome, we were stopped by a man in a car near the Colosseum who tried to 'give' us a leather jacket and told us he had no money for petrol. Fortunately we weren't taken in and walked away. I recommend this hotel for a first visit to Rome because it was clean, comfortable and conveniently situated for transport to and from the airport and its location within the city centre is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, clean and central. Good breakfast included.”
Reviews.Author: lupifamily
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Location was very central, you could walk to almost every sight. Breakfast was included, and it was also very nice. Staff at the front desk was helpful. The room was clean, and we were given an upgrade to a king bed when we checked in. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Starhotels Metropole location”
Reviews.Author: Xiavosh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to most interesting sightseeing, shopping districts and Rome's main train and subway station (Roma Termini). Hotel staff are friendly and quick to respond to your needs. Some minor issues like Internet connection is very expensive and the air conditioning was turned off . I also want to share some of my experiences on my way from the Airport to the Hotel. Do not change money in the Airport. They charge up to 20% commission for the exchange. If you are taking the train to go to Roma Termini especially late afternoon or weekends, make sure you walk straight to the main exit and do not listen to any Italian showing you the direction. We arrived around 8:30 PM on Dec. 24 in Termini, when we got out of train we couldn't see any exit sign to the main exit doors. There were no street signs to orient us. A lot of tourists like us were confused and didn't know were to go, there was this middle aged Italian man giving us the direction to the exit station he was saying this is the only exit so we followed others after going downstairs turned left and right we entered a hall and the exit door to a side street (which i could not find in my map). Everybody tried to find where we are standing suddenly the same guy showed up and and offered to drive people to their Hotels. within 10 minutes he managed to drive half of the people to their hotels. I tried to ask some locals for direction but they ignored us and walked away, my wife and my little girl started to feel uncomfortable since we were the only ones left in the dark street with all our luggage, while we were looking at our map the same guy came back and told us that this place is not safe and you should leave soon He offered to take us to our hotel for only 27 euro (because the hotel is far and it is Christmas). After seeing my little girl scared and my wife very uncomfortable i agreed and very quick he packed our baggage in to his car and drove us few blocks away and got the money and disappeared and at that moment i knew i fell in to a scam. the whole trip was under 5 euro according to our Hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Service and Location!”
Reviews.Author: EclaireBrighton
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my boyfriends 30th and all though it was a really great hotel. We were upgraded on arrival to a Superior Deluxe room (which was very large and luxurious) the main attractions are a 10/15 minute walk away and the service was very good. Breakfast was average but lunch which we had in the restaurant one day was excellent. As there were 4 of us in our group we got a taxi from Fumicino which as 50 Euros and about 40 mins. Only negative was that the rooms were quite warm and we weren't able to change this....but it was 0 degrees outside so that was probably why! We highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent VFM and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TheConlons
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Starhotel Metropole in Rome and found that not only does the outside not do it justice but some previous reports also. We arrived late on a Sunday evening and the staff could not have been more helpful. We were given a free upgrade on arrival and as expected given many pieces of information including an excellent map of the main attractions in Rome. We used the local tour operator 'Ciao Roma' which is based just one block away (5 min walk) and is bookable in the hotel. This is something i'd recommend to people who want to see everything in a short space of time although Rome is not as big a city as you may imagine. The hotel in only a few minutes from the main train station terminal which takes away the worry of taxi through the busy city centre. Breakfast buffet is good for the money you pay and the staff are excellent and all speak excellent english. When we go back to Rome we will definitely stay here again. The only thing that is poor is the lack of english speaking tv channels but in this city you are rarely in the hotel to notice. If i have any advice it would be just to plan the walk from the train station to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - location, staff, rooms and restaurant were perfect. Would definitely recommend and would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: MairiThomson
Reviews.Content: My husband and 6 yo daughter and I stayed at the Starhotel Metropole Rome for 9 nights in July-August 09. We got an excellent rate booking online through the hotel site, and were fantastically pleased with everything about this hotel. The location was perfect - a 5 minute walk from Roma Termini Station so the train to and from the airport was the best option. Similarly, most tour buses and local buses leave from here, so a perfect hotel to base yourself. Termini Station also has a zillion shops, and a very cheap supermarket so you can get your necessities. If you are staying in Rome for a while, this hotel is also a great choice with an OndaBlu laundromat just a 5 minute walk up the street (viaPrincipe Amedeo). The room was great, the hotel is in a quiet street, the staff were lovely and the free buffet breakfast was delicious. Many restaurants within a short walk juo. And a little shop selling Gelato just a few doors down. (good when you are travelling will little ones). If we are ever back in Rome, we will definitely stay here again. Thanks to all the staff for an excellent stay. Cheers from Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: tu-quoque
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a three night stay in Rome Italy at the Starhotels Metropole-our family stayed in the triple room. The hotel was conviently located in a side street near Termini as well as the Repubblica metro stop . All the conceierge were extremely helpful and gave great directions and tips to enable you to enjoy sightseeing- any question about Rome sightseeing, shopping or entertainment can be answered by the staff. The room was nicely decorated, modern and had a great bed which was very comfortable as other reviews had previously stated. Bathroom was also very good, with bath, and even a TV in it for the fun. The room and the hotel were very clean at all times. The food was excellent - breakfast was filling and there is plenty of choice ((eggs, bacon, ham, cheese, cereals, fruits, croissants, everything you can imagine in a very large buffet). I will return to this hotel on my next visit to Rome. The price was well worth it and this is the best way to spend a vacation in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, huge room and excellent breakfast!!”
Reviews.Author: katrinabf
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and had a wonderful experience. Location was perfect-walked to all major sites(but the Vatican) and the shopping in the area was great. Tiny restaurant next door(had to go down a few stairs) had delicious food-well priced-dined there every night.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect spot for the night at a fair price”
Reviews.Author: Hadlee34
Reviews.Content: I was going to Rome for a cruise with my wife and mom and needed a reasonable place to stay for a night. The location was nice, by the opera house amd some restaurants nearby to eat at. The room was clean, fresh and quite functional. It is what I call a business room, no real local flavor, but clean and functional and all I need when traveling abroad. I have been to some real bad hotels and this was perfect for me, no problems. The included breakfast was very nice and this served all my purposes for the stay. If you need a clean hotel that is modern and fuctional for your stay this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean elegant Room”
Reviews.Author: dvmv
Reviews.Content: The Star Hotel Metropole was the first Hotel we stayed at on our 10-day tour of Italy. This was our first overseas trip. Staff at the desk were helpful - we were the last of our group to arrive & the brief for our tour had already started. Check in was quick and desk staff directed us to meeting room after we checked into our room. The foyer was tastefully decorated with marble floors and staircases, timber cabinetary, well lit and some large comfortable leather couches in foyer. Door man at front welcoming guests and the entry was very clean and welcoming. We had decided that before we left on our trip to be open minded about the quality of the hotel rooms on this tour as we were pre-warned that the star quality rating is different in Europe to Australia.. We were more than happy with our room, for us it was elegant, without being overly ornate or plush and way above our expectations.The room was spacious with a tasteful decor. Marble bathroom complete with shower and bath - small LCD tv in bathroom was a bonus. Lots of good lighting over sink. Air conditioning, bar fridge, good cupboard space and room safe. Beautiful clean crisp bed linen along with large bath towels were changed daily. We were very impressed to be able to request a specific pillow as my husband requires good support after having surgery for neck problems and had not been able to bring his along for the trip. No iron in room but laundering service available. Breakfast was served in large dining room and was traditional American contintental including lots of fresh fruit, juices, a variety of cooked items plus the wonderful assortment of Italian cakes, crossaints and biscotti. Dining room staff were very friendly and always quick to serve guests with their preference of tea or coffee. Location was good.Close proximity to Termini and train stations. We took the train to "Spanish Steps" and Trevi Fountain on our free day - easy to get around. The other sights of the Coloseeum and Vatican were with the group. We ate out at a little restaurant a block away from the hotel both nights which served a tasty pizza and a glass of red . Lots of places close by to choose from. Internet Cafe across the street.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect location with very helpful staff and an intimate feel”
Reviews.Author: WarrenMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel located in a quiet street opposite the Roma termini. The staff were extremely good, making us feel very welcome while also providing extensive local knowledge to make the most of our visit. The room was very quiet and well presented creating a great place to relax after busy days on tour. The location is perfect both for access to Rome attractions and also to arrive and depart from this busy city. We could not have had a better trip to Rome! Bravo StarHotel Metropole.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money and great water pressure.”
Reviews.Author: jagel19
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for Termini station and walking distance to most of the other major sites, especially the Colosseum (ten minutes walk). We stayed four nights. The major pluses were the size of the room, the size of the bathroom (we had a bathtub and not a horrific microscopic shower cubicle like some other Rome hotels) and the excellent water pressure in the shower. We booked a triple and were initially given a decent sized room (for Rome) with a king bed and a pullout couch. The couch mattress was one of those cheap foam ones with no support, but there was no room to put in a third bed as we requested, so they upgraded us to a junior suite at no charge and brought up a single bed (at midnight - great service!) for the third person. The beds were comfortable, the rooms were very clean, and the airconditioning worked well, although a little noisy. It took some time for the hot water to arrive occasionally, but the water pressure was great. I read some of the other reviews for the same period about the staff, and I disagree. I found the front desk and other staff responsive to questions, helpful on the room upgrade, booking a taxi etc. and friendly although the hotel does not have a concierge service and the front desk staff is a mediocre substitute for that . The breakfast buffet was decent and is identical every day but you can order cappuccinos, toast and eggs from the wait staff if you know to do so. If you want a decent, clean hotel with good size rooms near the station, I would not hesitate to recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and lovely brekkie in a handy location.”
Reviews.Author: Dritan
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for two nights in this hotel. It's incredibly handy to the Termini station and was an excellent choice for those who just need a base and don't intend to stay that long in their hotel rooms. In saying that, the room was large, clean and with a very comfy bed. The main plus point was the excellent breakfast buffet. This really set you up for the day and the head waiter was fantastic fun. The food included a range of cereals, cold meats and cheeses, fresh fruit, yoghurts, scrambled eggs, bacon, croissants, pastries etc. Tea, coffees, hot chocolate were ordered via the waiters.

Reviews.Title: “Functional but not great”
Reviews.Author: nyc_t08
Reviews.Content: This is a functional hotel. It is more like a days inn/holiday inn kind of hotel-old rooms,fixtures. I wouldn't stay here again. The front desk staff is exceedingly ill mannered and incompetent. Besides being generally disinterested they have a tendency to start cackling in Italian- considering their salaries depend on tourist traffic and not local traffic you would expect them to be a tad more courteous. The doorman probably hasn't been paid for a while (he did rather yap on the phone or get a smoke then open the door). To sum up the front desk staff wouldn't find employment in super 8 motel in the US. If you can ignore all this the hotel is adequate for a day or two.
