Dont expect 4 star accommodations and you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean & quiet”
Reviews.Author: CPFCeagles
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel ( with map) easily from Termini station- 5 mins walk. Delighted when Concierge checked us in to our room 2 hours early and found our room was huge by italian hotel standards- even had a bed settee so could accomodate 3 easily. Super comfortable feather bed, good quality clean linen and good size bath and shower. Couple of drink stains on carpet but so what. Good service all round and good choice at breakfast including hot, cold and fruit. Really nice and quiet, area feels safe enough as well but in Rome always be vigilent. Nice reasonably priced trattoria on corner. Borghese gallery is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel would recommend it”
Reviews.Author: harrisment
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because we have stayed at a Star hotel in Milan before and really liked it. Arrived early at 11.30 and were checked in straight away which was a nice surprise. Room was great, spacious and very clean, nice bathroom with big thick towels which were changed daily. Nice breakfasts with lots of choice, efficient friendly staff. Sky sports on TV which was a bonus.The only negative is that the restaurant was a bit of a dissapointment, we ate there one evening and were the only diners in there all evening. I think this is because there wasn't a particulaly inspiring menu and there were lots of cheaper restaurants nearby. However we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just about as average as you can get”
Reviews.Author: jpowell79
Reviews.Content: We had high expectations for this hotel, as it's rated in the top 100 hotels on tripadvisor, but unfortunately the word "average" is the main word that springs to mind. The reception area is pretty smart. Modern décor, but certainly not any kind of wow factor. There was no wi-fi in the room, which was frustrating, as I had to use the internet café each day across the road to check my emails. No iron or ironing board…quite frustrating as I would've liked to have changed into something else when we arrived so we could go out to dinner, but the only service availabe was a "next day" ironing service. Our view was of a wall, so hardly inspiring, although to be fair, you don't go to Rome to stay in your hotel room! Also, our electonic door kept making a weird electronic noise at random points in the night. Its sounds as though the door is electronically unlocking and locking again. We kep thinking there was someone about to come into the room, which was annoying. The only free UK channels you can watch in the room TV are Eurosports, CNN, BBC World News and MTV. As I said before, you're not in Rome to sit in your room all day, but it's still nice to lay on your bed and watch tv after a hard days sightseeing, so was disappointed with the choice. The "pay to view" movies cost about 15 Euro's per movie, which is a bit expensive. The breakfast is ok…. A selection of continental breakfasts, or more traditional sausage, bacon and eggs, or fruit. The food was ok, but never changed, so it was always the exact same selection every morning. Ok so the good points! - The place was very clean and tidy. The maids did an excellent job in tidying the room every day. The location is great for getting around Rome. If you are arriving at Fiumicino Airport, just jump on the train to Roma Termini station, then it’s a 5- minute walk to the hotel. As a tip, you should probably steer clear of the Roma Termini station at night, as there seemed to be quite a few dodgy looking characters around there of an evening. Everything is in walking distance - 20 minute stroll to the Colosseum, Roman Forum, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, and also close to the metro subway to get to Vatican City. As a tip, take a stroll up to the Park at villa Borghese...it's so beautiful :-) It's also good to take an afternoon train down to Anzio, which is only about 8 Euros Return, as it has a nice beach to sunbathe and swim :-) On the whole, if you can get a cheap deal, and aren't too fussed about the things I've mentioned, then the hotel is fine. Just don't expect to be amazed.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Travellator10
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in July. The hotel is less than 5 minutes walking distance from the train station. The staff was friendly and helpful and they gave us a free room upgrade. The rooms are neat and clean and hotel is in a quiet lane. Good value for money. Will recommend to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed.....will not be reurning again!”
Reviews.Author: Comfortseeker66
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a five night stay at the Starhotel Metropole. We first stayed there in 2004 and had a great stay then however I can't say the same of this recent stay. Having read some very positive reviews and remembering our first time at the Starhotel, we decided to stay there again. Having paid for 2 superior rooms, I was expecting newly refurbished rooms however the rooms we were given were small, and much in need of redecoration. I had requested rooms close together as were a family of four. One of the rooms was so small, and I had to double check with reception that it was a superior. There was no air con or fan in the bathroom and it was like a sauna and if you had a hot shower then it was unbearable. The walls were dirty and cracked, in need of a good paint job and the bathroom had the ugly gold mesh ceilings with wires and pipes visible. There were no toiletries in the bathroom and no air con/fan. There was no tv in the bathroom as it states on the Expedia website....and the hairdryer was a relic from the 80's! The towels had seen much better days. In the other room, the air conditioning was noisy and ineffective. When I called reception to complain, they seemed uninterested and were learly not bothered. Even when asking for directions or recommended restaurants, it all seemed too much trouble for the reception staff and this was very off putting. We planned to go to the Vtaican and the Sisitine Chapel on Saturday 15th and when I checked with the staff on reception I was told yes it was all open, however when we arrived at the Vtaican on Saturday, I found that all the museums were closed due to it being a national holiday, and I was very upset that the guy on reception didn't tell us this. Especially as we had spent over 90 euros to get there and back. We ended up going twice as we wanted to see the Sistine chapel even though the first trip had been a waste of time and money. The check in took so long and seemed rather inefficient, and I agree with another reviwer that the staff are rude and rarely smile. We requested extra pillows one night and I was told that we had four pillows in our room so why did we want more....not the answer I was expecting. All in all not the greatest of experiences. When I complained at check out, all I was offered was a rather weak apology and a shrug. We will return to Rome but not to the Starhotel Metropole.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but beware the hidden costs”
Reviews.Author: morkieBirmingham
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel after refusing to stay at a nearby property which did not meet expectations. The hotel itself is excellently located for the railway and metro, and for the main sights in Rome. The rooms are large and well appointed. The staff however, are rude and very unfriendly. When checking out of the hotel, my mother wished to pay by Euro travellers cheques. She was told by the reception staff that there was a 1.05% commission charge, but only after she had signed each cheque. This would have resulted in a deduction of EUR40 on a bill of EUR355. When asked why he did not point this out before she signed each cheque, he shrugged his shoulders and said she did not ask him if there was a charge.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel good location, we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: 3irishBelfast
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Metropole for 4 nights in Early August with my wife and 15yr old son. The room was comfortable clean and spacious 2 twins and a bed settee. We had fresh linen and towels throughout. the breakfast was excellent and ample for all needs. the hotel is 3 mins walk from Termini rail station or 2 mins from Via Nationale. We walked everywhere from the hotel. There are numerous eating places within easy reach and these vary from economical [ie pizzas] to expensive a la carte. Our 15 yr old was especially taken with the LCD television in the luxurious bathroom we enjoyed the Rome trip and the Hotel was a major hit with all of us. I would recommend this to anyone and we'll be back

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Care Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Koeey
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in Starhotels Metropole on 28-30 July. I made this booking early in May with a special 'CityBreak' package, we are 2 adults and 1 teen (boy 16yrs). This package is very good as child under 16 is free with extra bed and breakfast. Two days before we arrived Rome, my sister decided to come with us so I made a request with the hotel for a room for 4 people. However the 'CityBreak ' package is only for 2 adults with children in a room not for 3 adults with children. The staff in Starhotels Metropole were very nice and helpful, they arranged a big room for us with one king bed, one extra bed and a big sofa bed, also only charged us 20 Euro more each day. The room is big , clean and comfortable with cool air, breakfast is good too. On departure we have booked a minivan with the Reception Desk which costed 60 Euro to the FCO Airport, this is a private car for us not a shuttle. We enjoyed staying in Starhotels Metropole. We are from Hong Kong and will recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot fault the place”
Reviews.Author: Jimbob1256
Reviews.Content: If you're heading into Rome for a weekend of sight seeing, all you require is a clean, well presented and well situated hotel. The Metropole delivers all these and had a decent breakfast too. Lets face it you're not travelling to Rome for a break to sit in the hotel and as a result will probably not spend a gresat deal of time there. I've seen some reviews saying the staff were rude! I didn't find this myself however, i thought them no better or worse than any other staff in a busy city hotel. All round good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel with large rooms, friendly staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: db99986
Reviews.Content: We booked a regular room but were given a junior suite on arrival. It was large by European standards and had a separate walk in closet/changing room. The room was very clean and well appointed. The lobby was quite pretty, as shown on the hotel website, and the people at the front desk were friendly and helpful with directions and restaurant recommendations. They spoke excellent English. The breakfast (which was included in the rate was pretty good - eggs (a little runny), bacon, fruit, cereals, croissants and other pastries, coffee and juice. The fitness room is small but clean and has enough for a cardio workout. One downside is there is no free wifi. You can purchase it but it is very expensive, around 22 euro for 24 hours. For the quality of hotel and its price, I would have expected this to be included. The location is very good, a 3-5 minute walk from the train station and maybe a 15-20 minute walk to the colloseum and forum area.

Reviews.Title: “A good quality hotel located close to the main station, but expensive for what it is”
Reviews.Author: nick164
Reviews.Content: I have no doubt that compared to most other hotels located in Rome in its class it's good enough, and I suspect offers reasonable quality and value for Rome, however when compared internationally (or even with other Italian cities), in terms of bang for your euro, pound or dollar the Starhotels Metropole comes up short. Location: Very close to the station, and convenient for the departing city bus tours and/or the metro/subway or normal buses. Check-in and Check-out: I was underwhelmed by both the check-in and check-out process, which I personally found was impersonal and unfriendly compared to other hotels. Room: The room was a good size, finished to a good quality and was undoubtedly well maintained, however my standard room overlooked a non-picturesque inner courtyard - which, with a small window, resulted in the room being rather dark. Unfortunately, the hotel's single room consists of two single beds (pushed together and made-up separately) and not a double, queen or king size. This, coupled with the hardwood floor, resulted in the bed moving across the room at the slightest movement. The room has the usual facilities you'd expect (tea/coffee, safe, mini-bar, etc), however it didn't include an in-room iron. Housekeeping: I was underwhelmed by the speed of housekeeping service, having placed the "please make-up my room" card on the door before 9am I was surprised on my return at 3pm to find my room had still not been serviced. Communal areas: Finished to a high standard, and well maintained. Apart from a lobby bar, and small restaurant, there are no other facilities however. Admittedly, with the large number of fine restaurants in Rome, I suspect your first choice won't be to dine in. However, for convenience, on one evening I chose to - the food was of a good standard and the service provided by the waiter and maitre d' were exceptional. Tip - the station to the hotel is only a 5 mins walk so I'd recommend walking if you can, otherwise a taxi will set you back ~8euros (with a "train station surcharge", and a couple of pieces of luggage at 1euro per item).

Reviews.Title: “7/10”
Reviews.Author: gujji81
Reviews.Content: After reading all the lovely reviews of this hotel me and my wife decided that this was the place to spend our 3 nights in Rome.I give it a 7/10 because of the following reasons: POSITIVES: 1.LOCATION-it is one of the best located hotels one can stay in Rome.A block away from both the TERMINI(train station for metros and Eurail) and Santa Maria Church.Lovely street restaurants on the doorstep ready to welcome you as soon as you cross them. 2.ROOM SIZE-for Europoean standards the room was reasonably large with tea/coffee maker and the bathroom even had a bathtub!!Rooms were nice and clean and housekeeeping did a great job. NEGATIVE: 1.STAFF-Having travelled a fair bit,I have realised that a smiling and welcoming reception staff of a hotel can make you feel right at home anywhere in the world.Im not saying that the staff is rude but they do their job mechanically and there is no "what can I do for you" feeling.The breakfast restaurant manager is quite fussed in the morning and seems like in a hurry to finish breakfast 15 mins before time!! I would however,recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice and conveniently located hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Best place and the least expensive from our Europe trip”
Reviews.Author: itisgr82travel
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel since I knew very little about it except for the reviews here and I found it to be the best in price, comfort and space after being cramped in London at a Hilton and in Paris at a locally owned very small hotel. The Metropole was a short walk from the Termini (we arrived by train), no more than three blocks. The staff was the most helpful. They let us check into our rooms at eleven in the morning. This hotel is very new and modern inside and the rooms are beautifully outfitted with large bathrooms. Don't expect much for breakfast but it is included and has variety. Some street noise but the double pain windows keep most of it out. We walked less than five minutes to catch the hop on and off tour. There is a laundrymat a short walk (3 minutes max) down the street from the hotel and across the street from the laundrymat is the restaurant we ate at three night in a row. The best Raviolis I have ever had (Ravioli Caprese). Restaurant was reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JessNY76
Reviews.Content: This hotel was soo nice and modern!! It was close enough to walk from the train station (Roma Termini). It was a nice walk to the Coloseum, Pantheon, Spanish Steps. If you don't like walking just take the A line to the coloseum, or the spanish steps (Spagna stop). The Vatican is all the way on the other side so just take the metro, again Line A, red line to the Octtavio station stop. This is the only hotel that had a coffee maker in the room. They provided instand cappuccino, hot coco, coffee, tea with sugar, brown sugar or sugar substitute. Breakfast was very nice. 630am-10am...eggs, bacon, meats, cheeses, pastries, fruits, croissants, yogurt, juices. The seating area was very pretty and the waiter there is very attentative. He will bring you coffee or a cappuccino. Overall a very nice hotel and i would def stay here again!!!! WARNING: WE GOT JIPPED SINCE WE DIDNT KNOW IT WAS SO CLOSE. IF YOU TAKE A CAB MAKE SURE IT IS NO MORE THAN 5-10 EURO. HE CHARGED US 28 EURO AND JUST MADE A BUNCH OF TURNS TO MAKE IT SEEM FURTHUR FROM THE STATION THAN IT WAS!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: kenc
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here before but couldn't remember the hotel or street name when I wanted to book it again - but I knew how to get there from the Station. So, onto Google Street View and I 'walked' my way from the station to the hotel and could see its name and was thus able to book at a good rate. The room was nice and spacious and had a reasonably good view of the street outside. The bathroom was clean and well appointed. Breakfast was good and the staff in the breakfast room deserve a special mention for their friendliness and helpfulness. The hotel is well located in what I regard as one of the better located parts of the city. There are plenty of bars and restaurants in the area. I'd definitely stay here every time in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great start to a 2 week tour.”
Reviews.Author: OKLynne
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean room. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was good size, including bathroom. Breakfast was a good variety of typical buffet items. Breads, Croissants, Cereals, Yogurts, Eggs (too runny for scrambled), bacon (not cooked long enough) but Europeans do not usually eat this fare. Had a great evening meal around the corner for fair price. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business hotel and right by Train station”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel714
Reviews.Content: For the price paid this was a perfect hotel for me traveling alone. Very nice hotel and decor. I was given a corner room with a private large patio with a nice view of the street. Rooms are clean and have a nice walkin closet. Bed is very state of the art where you can request different types of pillows at the front desk. Very busy and alive. Location right next to the train station which is much cheaper than taking a cab. The breakfast was free and very tasty. I walked all of Rome on foot and this hotel is close to the Colliseum, Arc and Old Roman Ruins. The only drawback was that the internet was very expensive in the hotel, but good news is right across the street is a cheap internet cafe. Other drawback if you plan to go out partying beware the hotel is shut down in the middle of the night. I rolled in about 4 am and the hotel was dark...it took a couple of rings on the doorbell and one sleepy employee let me in with a "shame on you" look on his face. What can I say it was Friday night?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location- Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yolcular
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Stahotel Metropole in Rome and loved it. The room we stayed in must have been recently refinished (see pictures). The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. Even the maid, who spoke no English and we spoke no Italian, was friendly and like a sweet mother, reminded us to put on our sunblock and watch our bags while out sightseeing. Breakfast was included in our room rate, which was a full spread of pastries, rolls, jams, fruit and hot items like bacon and eggs. It was very close to Termini, which was great because we left for our next destination by train so we able to walk to and from the station with our bags without needing a cab. It was also close to Metro stops for both lines A and B. If we ever return to Rome, we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A good solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: nerv0usflyer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated near the termini and this is very handy for buses, metros and the train. The area is perfectly safe and we always felt comfortable walking around. We checked in and out at weird times (1am and 5am) and both times were speedy and courteous. Breakfast was plentiful and tasty with fruit, cereal, croissants/cake, rolls, salamis and hams and egg/bacon on offer. My daily cappuccino was delicious. Quite the best. Just make sure you order this instead of the usual Americano style bland and bleughhh coffee. The hotel is beautifully air-conditioned and quiet. Our room was spacious and clean and the bed was large and comfortable (always a worry). Just beware of extortionate internet charges. I found reception staff brisk but helpful. I can see how guests may consider a degree of warmth to be lacking but this wasn't an issue. We needed to print out our boarding passes and they kindly did this for us. I also lost my engagement ring down the plughole in the room and they could not have responded quicker, sending two hotel technicians to the rescue. Sure - you won't get top notch touristy advice at the front desk but isn't that what the Rough Guide to Rome is for? This is a good solid hotel and I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ellenh46
Reviews.Content: From first contact to our departure the experience was excellent. As a business and leisure traveler I can tell you that this stay was one that made a huge difference in our overall Rome experience. The courteousness of staff, cleanliness, amenities, size and decor of rooms, common areas, breakfast offerings, everything was absolutely at the top. Any questions we had or requests we made were handled quickly and very efficiently. Our stay at the Metropole was one that definitely enhanced our overall trip to Rome. Thanks to everyone at Metropole for a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “This place is awesome.”
Reviews.Author: fl_librarian
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to the train station and attractions, yet on a very safe,nice ,quiet street. Breaksfast was incredible and all the staff was very attentive. Cannot say enough wonderful things about about our stay. Sheila and Richard

Reviews.Title: “Star Metropole good for families”
Reviews.Author: KarenHough
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the few in Rome which offers spacious family accomodation. We travelled to Rome for a four day break at Easter and with two young children were lucky to find a city centre hotel which caters for families. The room was spacious, clean and very comfortable. Breakfast was great and really set us up for the day. Staff friendly and efficient and didn't mind kids in bar areas etc. Only critisism the hotel brochure claims location within walking distance of major attractions but this wasn't the case taking a good half hour to reach anything worth seeing. We used the open top city tour buses to get around so wasn't too much of a problem. Would definitely stay here again but wouldn't book with Citalia the company we travelled with as they were rubbish.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: NYCTraveler3636
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff were courteous and helpful, and although not fluent in English they spoke enough for us to be able to communicate effectively. For people who enjoy walking, the location is convenient to the train station and for taking walks to sightsee. There were some good and reasonably priced restaurants closeby, which came in handy for rainy night dinners. The room was very comfortable, and the breakfast spread offered many choices. There is a nice sitting area and bar area in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable modern hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Lulubelle75
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in other Starhotels before and as a result we were given a room upgrade. A really pleasant surprise. Our deluxe room was large and comfortable - the bed, pillows and sheets were clean and very comfortable. It really is a modern, beautiful hotel. There was a good selection for breakfast. Staff were also pleasant and helpful. The Hotel is only 15-20 minutes walk to the Fontana di Trevi, a walk which I thoroughly enjoyed as we passed by other minor landmarks and monuments. Will definitely return to stay here again. Just a note - if you park your car in the garage below the Hotel, it'll cost you around 26 - 30 Euros per night. Then again, Stazione Termini is so close...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Fab Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Dawnywawny
Reviews.Content: Me and my bf stayed here with another couple for a few days. I was glad to see plenty of good reviews on here but when we got there it exceeded all of our expectations. The hotel is super modern and the bar area is stunning. Our rooms were great, really big beds - I think they were 2 big singles joined together but it didnt matter at all. There was a tv in the bathroom as well :) Breakfast was yummy - the scrambled eggs did look a bit dodge but they tasted fine. One of the managers I think his name is alessandro or something - was a bit rude but other than him all the other members of staff were really courteous and polite and very very helpful. We arrived at the hotel really early - like 11am or something but one of our rooms was ready which allowed us to have a quick change before we set off to explore the beautiful city of Rome ........................

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel that I would recommend highly!”
Reviews.Author: mimi46
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here recently and found the location to be perfect for us. We used the nearby train station, both for trains and subway connections. (Beware of pickpockets at the train station, though. NEVER use outside pockets for your wallet, even if you think you could notice if someone tried to reach in! The pickpockets are SLICK, which we found out the hard way.) Our room was spacious and always clean when we returned from a long day of sightseeing. The room was also well lit and felt freshly decorated.The breakfasts were quite good as well, with crisp bacon, which my husband loves! All in all, we couldn't have been more pleased with all aspects of the hotel The ONLY down side was the expensive internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel,”
Reviews.Author: Chatham4
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed for four nights at the star hotel metropole and it was just an average hotel would rate it at 3 stars rather than 4 the room wasn't a very high standard as it was very small but was clean. The restaurant was nice although expensive and the piano at the bar was not played once for the duration of our stay. The breakfast was very nice although the restaurant got very crowded as they only opened half of it and the staff were very slow and tables did not get cleared very quickly. Additionally, the barman was very rude on more than one occasion and we frequently saw staff members smoking at the hotels entrance. The hotels wireless Internet service was costly. Overall the hotel was average and is in a very good location near the central station just needs new staff.

Reviews.Title: “Totally perfect”
Reviews.Author: KTUk
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from Rome and a wonderful stay at this hotel. We found the staff really welcoming, helpful and we were grateful that they spoke to us in English when needed. Rooms and communal spaces were very clean and modern. The room we had was a great size, always well presented and clean when we returned from a long day of walking in Rome. Very relaxing. Breakfast was a relaxed affair, a lovely variety of choice including pastries, scrambled eggs and REALLY nice bacon, perfect for stocking up before a day of sightseeing. Like most city hotels near train stations, there were dodgy areas nearby with beggars etc but to be honest it was so close to The Forum (20 min walk down hill) we always felt safe. Once you get a feel for the area and use your common sense you know which main routes to use such as Via Cavour and Via Nazionale to reach the main sites. PLease don't be put off by fear of the area, the hotel is like a haven and perfect for a mini break! We only needed to venture into Termini twice and that was just to transfer. When you are used to London this is so much easier!! The hotel was very quiet and we couldn't hear any traffic at all from our room despite being very near some main Roman roads! All in all the hotel ensured that our first trip abroad was perfect and we will return to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, good position”
Reviews.Author: chibold
Reviews.Content: - Located in a very good position (close to the main station). - Very rude staff. At breakfast, the waitress mistook me for an English person and, when I "dared" to sit at a table without the teacup and the napkin, she mumbled bad words in Italian, that I could clearly understand as I am Italian! - The website says that there's wireless internet in every room, but they leave behind the fact that it's not for free (actually, it is very expensive)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel,bad location...”
Reviews.Author: kotzak1977
Reviews.Content: It's 2 minutes away from termini station which is very useful for getting around the city, but the location is one of the worst in Rome.The rooms are nice and clean.The bathroom also.Beware of the taxi drivers!They will always try to charge you extra money!Try to get around with buses and metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great Safe Location”
Reviews.Author: MrsAp
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely and clean. The rooms were large and spacious. We had originally booked a superior room but were ugraded to a Deluxe room free of charge. The hotel is in a great location for exploring Rome. However dont get ripped off by the tourist buses that charge 25 euro for 24 hours usage. Use the metro we purchased a 3 day ticket for 11 euros and this included useage of buses also, it was definately the best way to explore rome. The hotel was lovely and clean, staff friendly and the breakfast was superb for a continental breakfast, it included cheese, meats,fresh bread,fruit juice,fruit salad,scrambled eggs,bacon,sausages,croissants,tea and coffee. All which was fresh and regulary topped up. The only thing I found odd about this hotel is that they do provide tea/coffee in the rooms but no milk - On ringing reception I was told to ring the bar, on ringing the bar there was no reply. So it might be a good idea to ask at the bar on arrival for milk and to store it in the rooms fridge. I would definately recommend this hotel and I will definately say here again on my return visit(s) to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “rome february 2009”
Reviews.Author: mum53
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Metropole Hotel. Very clean and efficient hotel and reception staff were helpful. Our daughter and boyfriends room was upgraded to a mini suite as it was her birthday! Breakfast a cut above the usual bread and coffee. Hot scrambled eggs, mini sausages, bacon, variety of breads, yogorts,cereals, juices, cakes. Coffee was awful but what the heck. Hotel very central for all sites other than the Vatican but it is a short ride on the Metro station a few mins away. Do watch valuables on the Metro. We had no probs but there are signs warning about pickpockets. On the first day we took a round trip sightseeinf tour bus which gave us the chance to get our bearings and decide what to see. We took a guided tour of the Vatican via Vatican Tours and it was the best. Not as cheap as do it yourself but you skip the dreadful queing and are in a party of max 20. A 3 hour trip that is well worth the money. All in all a good 4 day city break but not the cheapest holiday! It will work out even more expensive in the long run as my daughter got engaged during the trip and plans to marry next year!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, customer service is lacking”
Reviews.Author: mlsmn
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very modern with large clean rooms. The room had nice amenities (robe, slippers, CD/radio). The daily breakfast buffet had a lot of options. The hotel was very convenient to Termini for arrival/departure to Rome as well as metro connections. Very short train ride to reach any major site (Vatican, Spanish Steps, Coloseum). Close to shopping (Via Nazionale). The hotel staff was not helpful with any type of question or request. They did not seem to want to help with any 'tourist' questions - recommendations on local restaurants, transportion or directions. They also were very bothered when our keys did not work at check-in. Depending on the rates available, we would recommend if you are okay with limited customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: NicolasLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel for Christmas. During the selection process, we had our reservations against the location near the railway station as railway stations are usually rough untidy areas. However our fellow travellers on this site gave to the hotel excellent references so we took the risk. We booked the double room for 100 euros per night, but on arrival the receptionist upgraded the room to the kingsize. This was nice touch indeed. The room size was adequate with comfortable bed and chairs. Bathroom had marble surface around sink, powershower with three different settings was a treat. The room was very clean and tidy. I would make two remarks to the hotel management and travellers. First, we could not do online checking in the hotel as internet in the lobby was quite pricey, 35 cents per minute and in addition vauchers for its use were not available. There are few internet caffes nearby. We used one on di Napoli street just 5 minutes walk from the hotel. They charge 1.5 euros per half an hour. Second, unlike in other italian hotels, morning coffee was plentiful, which would be a good thing if that drink could be called coffee. Here for those who is used to start day with a cup of good coffee, especially in Italy, we suggest to order a cap of cappuccino instead of the coffee pot. The option is not advertised, but good coffee will be delivered without extracharge. There are a lot of restaurants next to the hotel. Most of them are inexpensive with limited choice. In the adjacent street, we found good place di Napoli offering authentical neapolitan pizza. Pizza is baked in the open stove. They also have good selection of salads and sea food. Transportationwise, for those who like taking sightseeng bus we suggest using bus No40 instead which starts from Termini to Vatican through the Rome historical centre. As an illustration, we attached four pictures taken in the hotel room we stayed and showing the view from its window. Overall it is a good hotel. It may not have a wow factor, but does not disappoint either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rome Excursion”
Reviews.Author: Luke123Australia
Reviews.Content: A very well located, first class hotel, with ready access to shops, restaurants and Rome's attractions. This hotel was a real but very pleasant surprise as a base for a package tour of Rome. The rooms were excellent, the staff very pleasant and walking in the area was safe and hassle free. All in all, it provided a perfect base for the Rome excursion. Luke123Australia

Reviews.Title: “Not the best place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ktx85
Reviews.Content: I was not impressed with this place, for the rates they charge I expected a top notch hotel with excellent food and attentive customer service - I was disappointed. The worst problem with this hotel is the attitude of some of the staff - if you want them to help you they act like they are doing you a massive favour, if you ask them a question they treat you like an idiot, if they are busy they will tell you to stop bothering them and go away. The hotel is located in one of the worst parts of Rome, it is noisy, dirty, seedy and quite far away from the picturesque city centre & main attractions. The food was mediocre and tepid and did not cater well for vegetarians. On the up side the decor was impressive and the room was clean and spacious, some of the staff were polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: bluskie3
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went to Rome for a long weekend as a 'girlfriend trip.' For all the hotel/motel/b&b options we had, we looked up reviews on this site and were discouraged about the level of service we would find for our budget. Luckily, I came across the name of this hotel, and booked for 3 nights for double bed, breakfast included. Our flight arrived around 10 AM, and the check-in was at 2:00 pm. I tried to call them to ask about early check-in, but couldn't get through their weird phone number. Nevertheless, we were let into our rooms early!! I guess it's all about availibility. Upon arrival, our rooms were 'upgraded' to a deluxe double, but I didn't see the difference- if at all, the room was smaller than I saw on their official website. Although seeing from other reviews, our rooms were big considering the location. Breakfast- They have hot/cold breakfast buffet, with scrambled eggs, coffee, 3 options of juice, many pastries, fresh fruits, sausage links and bacon, etc. We took full advantage of our breakfast there. Service- It was more than I expected. The hotel staff were friendly, and at one point I asked for a corkscrew for a wine we bought outside, and the waitperson from the bar came in person to open up our wine! The breakfast staff were courteous, and the main desk people were very friendly. After a full day of encountering many rude people in the service industry in the city, we fully appreciated coming back to our hotel. Location- Two streets away from the Termini Station. What more can I add? =) Facilities- Hot shower, clean rooms, comfortable beds- sheesh, I can go on and on. Anyways, I would go there in a heartbeat if I go to rome again, but not sure about the other Starhotels. I hope my review helps, since I came back again and again to this website while planning our weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: BrissyGirl-in-London
Reviews.Content: Totally agree with previous positive reviews. Spent 5 days with 2 teenagers at the Star Metropole and was very happy with package experience. -Extremely convenient location. -Polite & helpful staff. -Comfortable, clean & spacious room. Kids loved the fluffy slippers & robes. -Good variety & plentiful buffet breakfast. Only down side was internet was quite expensive (38c/min) and was told that a little milk, for a cup of tea in my room, would cost the pricely sum of 2 euros!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Borocouple
Reviews.Content: Just got back from rome a week ago and had an amazing time, me and my boyfriend went for 5 nights and that was just right to do everything we wanted. The hotel was lovely, on arrival we got a free room upgrade, there are about 9 floors and we were on the 6th, there are no views so if you want a view of rome this isn't the right hotel. Although its location is great, 20mins walk to colloseum, metro is just 5mins walk and the trevi fountain is about 30mins walk. We only used the metro for the vatican otherwise we walked everywhere and got to see historic buldings you normally wouldn't see, so I advise don't be lazy and walk. (You get a very useful map from reception on arrival) We went on a day trip to pompeii through keith prowse which was well worth the 3 hour coach ride to get there, highly recomended. Now for the hotel it was posh, clean and friendly service. Breakfast had a great assortment, we never ate in hotel on evenings went out and the rough amount for a meal is about 40 euros. Hotel room was a decent size, clean bathrooms, comfy beds, sizeable storage space, minibar not cheap. The only problem we had was the tv the only english speaking channels were CNN and sky news with the occasional footie match on skysports in english, oh and a pay per view film is about 15 euros!! But overall this hotel is great in everyway, if we go back to rome woud stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Comfortable Beds, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: kungphuey
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place to sleep - I wanted to take the bed home with me. Rooms are spacious, clean, and with plenty of amenities. I stayed twice (at the beginning and at the end of my travels) and both rooms were very quiet. I found the staff pleasant and helpful - they remembered me when I returned almost three weeks after my first stay. The price is an excellent deal for the quality. The Metropole is well located with respect to transportation as discussed in other reviews. I arrived and departed from Termini Station, an easy walk from the hotel. At the hotel breakfast, try the Roman rolls (they look like knots) spread with some of the fresh ricotta. Luscious. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: IrelandTed
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 5 day stay in Starhotel Metropole Rome and like previous reviews I rate this hotel highly. The location is excellent - 5 mins walk from Termini Station and within walking distance of the Trevi Fountain (about 15 mins walk) spanish steps etc. Very near to bus stop for sightseeing bus tours. The hotel itself is very modern and the rooms are spacious with great blackout blinds and air conditioning. Breakfasts were lovely but did not have evening meal there as so close to other restaurants in the surrounding area. I found the reception staff very helpful when I needed info on travelling to Naples. I would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Superb ...”
Reviews.Author: AJD57
Reviews.Content: We had problem at the property next door to the Metropole and so did a walk in. Absolutely brilliant response and we had a room at the same rate as the very sub standard next door property. The hotel facilities are absolutely as advertised. The multi-lingual staff just couldn't do enough for us. And location, location, location - just a couple of blocks from the central rail and bus stations - and everything in Rome goes to, from or through those. We have stayed at a number of Rome properties and this one has surpassed all of the others - and at a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “staff was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: cindy60
Reviews.Content: We had a large group that were displeased with our original reservation for a hotel down the street. The front desk staff were awesome and able to accomadate our every need. The hotel is very comfortable and close to all Rome sites. The breakfast was wonderful. On the top floor they have a nice resturant and bar. We stayed here for three days and loved every minute.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Starhotel Metropole”
Reviews.Author: DublinDubliner
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from 3 days at Starhotel Metropole and loved our stay there. We booked 2 superior rooms and were upgraded to deluxe free of charge. They seem to do this a lot and its a nice touch. The beds ,as lots of others have said ,are so comfortable. Just what you need after a day walking around Rome. The hot buffet breakfast was a welcome every morning. Great selection of food and breads available. Hotel location was excellent, 5 mins from Termini station. Tried a few restaurants around the hotel and didn't think much of any of them. We tried Est, Est, Est just across the road as it was mentioned as a top 10 restaurant on some site I goggled before going. We were very disappointed with it. The staff were rude and the food average. My sister ordered a side salad with her main course and it consisted of a load of lettuce leaves, not a tomato or anything else in sight. The only negatives I would have about the hotel were the very pricey bar with no atmosphere, though I'm sure all hotel bars in Rome are pricey. The staff at reception were polite but so busy they didn't really have time to advise on anything. I guess this is a problem with most large hotels. I couldn't fault the hotel though. The accommodation was 1st class, well worthy of 4 stars. Would defiantly stay there again. We also found the prices on the hotel website were a bit more expensive than other websites.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: achetram
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel. My wife and i stayed here for 5 nights and i must say for a european hotel it is is very spacious. the hotel is centrally located and minutes away from major attractions. the staff is very friendly and breakfast was included. which goes a long way with the current exchange rates. just fyi if your visiting Piaza Navano, although the outdoor restaurants in the piazza look very appealing please be aware that every one charges double for everything on the menu. we found this out the hard way when our lunch bill was $53 euro which was $110U.S with tip. and this was just for Pizza and a plate of pasta. a can of coke will cost you $ 10 U.S. if you walk down one of the side street you will find the food just as good for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and service!”
Reviews.Author: 4Traveller
Reviews.Content: I'd like to recommend this hotel to anybody who likes good quality of room and excellent service. I booked superior room and and was welcomed by reception stuff with free upgrade to suite which was really great. Room was very clean, calm with perfect bed and even if it doesn't look so good on pictures it's well furbished and maintained hotel. It's located in walking distance to Termini and Republica stations and also you can walk easily to almost any of well known sight spots in Rome. Breakfast was also very good. I can recommend this hotel without doubts.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel/location”
Reviews.Author: Kambrie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Starhotel Metropole in Rome during our last visit to Italy in Sept/Oct of 2006. We stayed there at the beginning of our trip and again on our last night in Rome before coming back to the States. We had different rooms both times. The room we had upon arrival was superb. The bed was the most comfortable thing I have ever slept in (and that is saying a lot)!!! We had a different room our last night in Italy. It wasn't quite as nice as the first, but still very good and worth the price. We are going to Italy again this summer and have booked the Rome portion of our visit at this hotel because we liked it so well and because of the location. We find it very convenient. Debby

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: d823fu
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel (and flight) through lastminute.com. We were very impressed with the hotel, in terms of cleanliness, room size, service and food. We arrived at about 1am, far later than expected, but the concierge greeted us by name and checked us in very promptly. We had a fantastic room, large and with modern, attractive decor. The hotel is in a good location. Less than 5 minutes from Termini station, 15 mins to the forum and colloseum with plenty of cheap but lovely restaurants in the area. We'd thoroughly recommend the restaurant Alessio just around the corner for good food, friendly service and reasonably priced. If we returned to Rome, would definately stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Really fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: rosie122
Reviews.Content: I felt that writing a review about this hotel was essential because if staying in Rome i would say to most people to look no further than the Hotel Metropole. My Fiance had booked us a surprise trip to Rome for my xmas pressie and as we both had never been to Rome before, we didnt know what to expect. When we arrived we were impressed by the modern decor of the lobby and then we had our room upgraded free of charge. On first seeing the room i was very pleased, it was very big and the bathroom was gorgeous - they even had a flat screen TV in the bathroom. There were two single beds in the room and when we said to the maid about changing them to a double it was done within minutes. We had breakfast every morning included in our stay which was nice and the waiters were always very pleasent. The hotel was just minutes walk from the termini station where you could get a taxi or find a tour bus to your choosen location - we did a tour called 'Ciao Roma' which was excellent as the bus left you at your choosen destination and you could stay as long as you wanted as a bus would come back every hour on the hour to pick you up and leave you to the next stop on the tour. Back to the hotel, i would strongly recommend anyone to stay there and I am quite a fussy person when it comes to where i will sleep and eat and am not easily impressed. The only thing i would say, is to bring a travel iron to the hotel as one will not be provided - the hotel offer an ironing service which i could not fault (ive never had such well ironed clothes) but it was expensive and between us our ironing cost 70 euro in the space of 3 days!!!!

Reviews.Title: “best stay in Italy”
Reviews.Author: rose_oday
Reviews.Content: our entire tour was nothing but fabulous! star metropole in rome was the best hotel on the tour. most modern with the most amenities and centrally located in the heart of Rome. the best was the comforts in the rooms - mostly the bed and pillows. when you are traveling it is important to get a good nights sleep so you can do as much sightseeing each day. the sleep was induced by the matress and pillows! would like them in my own home. breakfast was more than expected. a very pleasant stay overall. would do it again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Gd location, new hotel, staff service can improve”
Reviews.Author: Sparkylow
Reviews.Content: Good location, 10-15mins walk from Roma Termini Station. Hotel is pretty new, rooms are big for european standards. Buffet breakfast has good spread of continental fare as well as eggs, sausages and bacon. Staff knowledge of the city and service level can be improved though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Break”
Reviews.Author: Afajob
Reviews.Content: Having travelled with friends we had 3 rooms in the hotel all of which were great and extremely comfortable. The hotel is not far from the Termini and our taxi driver did tell us not to venture in the direction of the Termini as it is not the best of areas. However the hotel is situation amongst many other 4 start hotels and there were pleanty of tourists around and we felt safe. There is not really any requirement to pass the Termini as you venture towards the centre of Rome, unless you are lost! We stayed at the hotel on a bed and breakfast basis, the breakfasts catered for all. The restaurant looked nice, although we did not sample the food. We found that to eat out was easy enough, as there are many restaurants. Once you get your barings you soon find that you are not too far from the attractions and there are so many in Rome. We did not have to use public transport at all, apart from travelling to and from the airport. However for older travellers, or those adverse to a good walk, I would perhaps suggest a hotel nearer the centre. To be honest I was glad we were not right in the centre of the city as this was extremely busy, I can imaging its jam packed in the summer. Great hotel, great city and a fantastic weekend break! We armed ourselves with the Rough Guide to Rome which really helped get a feel for the City and offered a great guide to the sites. Enjoy...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel, Bad Staff.”
Reviews.Author: Talalq8
Reviews.Content: I came to this hotel and I was expecting the worst scenario like dirty old smelly hotel but what I found is a new modern hotel. I booked superior room to avoid any small rooms but I guess this hotel don’t have any deference between superior and deluxe room!! I couldn’t stay in the room I booked until I change it to higher class room with 50 Euro extra every night. I liked the new one, good size and very homey. I found some difficulty with the reception because the keep talking with their costumers with load voice.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice, and centrally located hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Sletvol
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, close to the main train station. We came in about 10am, and they had a room ready for us. We actually got upgraded to a junior suite, which was very nice! The room was in great condition. The breakfast was good, but not the largest ive seen.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, worth the money you pay for it”
Reviews.Author: nassos
Reviews.Content: After returning in Rome for the third time in a year, I couldn’t stop reporting about how I I have lived in this wonderful town. . First of all, I picked Starhotel Metropole because I couldn’t spend more than 235 euro for each night. I first read everything that was written about more than a hundred hotels about rome.. It was near to stazione termini, and it was a nice hotel, with well kept rooms, clean bathrooms, and large corridors.. The staff was helpful, and I was very glad to notice how sincere and gentle everybody was (I especially liked the people that were working in the breakfast, and the person that helped us with our luggage-a young, little short one) The rooms were not spacious, but they had all over mirrors and this was clever (although the bed had an old mattress that didn’t live get a good sleep..).. Of course they should do sth with the a/c system… We had all day long something about 24-28 degrees, and in the night it wasn’t very comfortable… I tried some of the restaurants in the area and they were o.k. Overall, I would suggest to everybody that would like to visit Rome to stay in this hotel, if he wants to be near the metro station area, and the cental railway station area.. But the truth is that according to me the best area is near the Spanish steps.. (although you have to pay a fortune to stay in one of those hotels, that are kept in the same level as Starhotel Metropole…)..

Reviews.Title: “loved thos hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrqTravlr
Reviews.Content: Great hotel within minutes of the train station. My wife and I spent the weekend in Rome and used this hotel as our base. The room was great although our "double" was two singles pushed together. Other European hotels do the same thing but this one put seperate single sheets on each bed instead of queen sheets. The lobby is contemporary and the staff was excellent. The breakfast buffett was adequate. We'd stay here again if we came to Rome and that's the test to pass for any hotel.

Reviews.Title: “clean, modern hotel... recommended”
Reviews.Author: jaisingh
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel was excellent. clean spacious rooms, modern with all amenities required. breakfast was fine served in a clean modern environment, staff friendly. Only downside was they need hot food for vegetarians also! As we walked everywhere in rome, the hotel room was heaven from a hot day walking in rome. The vatican is only 45 minute walk, and there is lots to see on the way. colloseum only 15 mins down via cavour, and santa maria maggoire just down the road 2 mins. The location is excellent, 2-3 min walk from via nazionale, republica or station termini. Contrary to some opinions the area was fine, quiet, and there were no undesirables hanging around in the area around hotel. Instead lots of tourists til late in night were either dining , walking or arriving at their hotels. The area is completely safe. I believe the problem area is further down south of termini station, but if you are a tourist you will have nothing to do with that area or ppl. All in all for Euros 125. per night it was excellent value. I could not recommend this hotel enough. Go for it you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Service, close to Rail Termini”
Reviews.Author: Skytraveller1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights at the Starhotels Metropole last weekend 31st August and had a great time. The hotel was definately a 4*, we regularly stay in 4*s and this did not fall below the standard even though we were a little concerned after reading some of the previous reviews. The hotel is located about 5 to 10 minutes walk from the rail termini which was convenient for us, as we used the Terravision coach transfer service (EasyJet), 14 euros per person return to and from Campino airport. The hotel, as other reviews have stated is probably not in the best location, but we had no problems walking back to the hotel around midnight. The main attractions such as Trevi Fountain, Colosseum, Spanish Steps Pantheon are all approx 1 mile walk from the hotel. We walked to the Vatican which is about 5 miles but if you are not as ambitious there are bus and open top buses frequent from just around the corner about 5 minutes away from the hotel. Plenty of shops of all types and some good restaurants within close proximity of the hotel. We would definately stay at the hotel again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service”
Reviews.Author: samsstl
Reviews.Content: Good points. Great Breakfast., Excellent bathroom, Good beds Bad points, Lousy customer service, small rooms. The worst front desk, one can have. I had to fight to get my triple bed rooms. Very rude staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but didn't like location”
Reviews.Author: Missshopper
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and clean. Our room was modern, comforable, and attractive with a good sized bathroom. We were pleased with it. Unless you plan to use the Termini rail which is nearby, I would not suggest the area. There are much nicer areas to stay in. For an upscale hotel, I would rate the location not up to the hotel. The breakfast buffet was terrible! It starts at 6:30 AM but most people leave on tours at 6:45 so unless you have them pack you something, you cannot use it anyway. The eggs were awful, bacon and sausage not cooked enough, and the pastries never seemed that fresh. The selection was poor compared to even a standard Holiday Inn buffet - only three hot items (eggs, bacon, sausage). There is little choice for breakfast anywhere nearby early. With the exception of one person who was at the desk, we found the staff not interested in helping you or answering your tourist questions. Some of them made you feel you were bothering them. A few times when we asked directions, we were just given a map and told look at this instead of pointing out suggestions of where to go. All in all, it was acceptable as I booked it through a tour. This hotel seems to be extremely popular for tour groups as there were many Japanese tour groups booked there also.

Reviews.Title: “Not for me”
Reviews.Author: Japanese-TEA
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 4 nights with my family in 6rooms. Because I had good experience of Starhotel at Florence, I chose this hotel for trip of my sister's wedding. The facility and atmosphere of this hotel is great, such as beds, pillows, bathroom, breakfast, comfatable front...etc. 1. untrained staff First of all, one of the of front desk was horrible. When we checked in, his service is the worst. I said "Checking in." Then he said "Please?" I give him all passports of my group and print-outs of comfirmation that shows all members name with room assignment. However, he want me give it him back as division of room. When I order a taxi to same person as above, he just said "I can not do it right now because I am busy." 2. non smoking room I reseved non smoking rooms. But when I entered my room, I smelled smoke. 3. amenities All of our rooms did not have enough amenities. We just had only for one person even though we reserved for 2 persons per room. 4. late checking out I ordered late checking out for all of our room when I reserved. They never response me about that. But they refused on day of checking out. And they said they will charge 50 EURO per hour. 5. Dipper My mom had her accessaries stolen which were kept in her suit case when we left the hotel for sioght seeing. She brought those for my sister who was a bride. I wil have several chance to go back to Rome, but I am sure I will never go back to Starhotel Metropole...

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Stay”
Reviews.Author: macmanor
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Metropole very much. After fleeing another hotel close by due to a disasterous start to our holiday the Metropole lived up to all expectations. On enquiry at reception if there was availability we were offered a very good rate as we were staying a number of nights. A very pleasant male receptionist arranged a room upgrade as well. The room was spotless and clean and had all the modern conveniences that you would expect in a hotel that size. The shower had very good pressure. The breakfast buffet which went till very late in the morning was absolutely fantastic and close to the best we experienced in 7 weeks of travelling in Europe, if not the best. A huge range to choose from replaced often and good service in the restuarant . The location is ideal for those travelling by train as you can walk in two minutes to the station. The only thing that I could say in the negative is that our room was located by a staff walkway to deliver goods/room service and that at times the staff would let the door bang very loudly which was unnecessary as they could hold it to close it slowely and quietly. Overall and very good hotel and great location to all transport.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: nhr1
Reviews.Content: Before staying in Rome I did a lot of research about which hotel to stay in and I found the reviews on this site really useful in helping me choose this hotel. My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and were very impressed with it. Due to its proximity to the Termini (train station) there is a choice of public transport to use ie metro or bus, which is a positive as taxis can be hard to flag down. The hotel seemed immaculate, very modern and the room size was decent. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the only issue we had was one morning we were woken by a drilling noise which seemed to be coming from inside the hotel, I rang the reception to complain and they said they would stop the work immediately and resume it once our stay was over. The noise stopped strright away and we never heard it again. Overall we were very pleased with this hotel, and would definately return to it. Many hotels in Rome claim to be a 4 star when they are not but this is a genuine 4 star hotel and we would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Initially concerned but pleased as punch.”
Reviews.Author: SEESPOT
Reviews.Content: Earlier reviews were mixed so I was prepared for anything. This was last hotel in Globus tour ,Thames to Tiber. Wife and I with 3 grandsons, 19,15, 11. They had large newly furbished room with 3 beds and jacuzzi in large bath. Our room for 2 was smaller but still roomy, all new appointments like theirs, including t.v. and phone in bath, pants presser, marble and wood counter tops, motorized window shades, large closet, safety deposit box, mini bar (too $) and all new carpets and fixtures like theirs. As a residential builder , quality was 4 star in my book. Talked to all other members of tour and they had same quality of rooms. Walked down from our 8th floor and all hallways were the same. From earlier review , I thought maybe they were remodeling floor by floor and so you would have different opinions based on floor assignment.From our room 820 you could open the window and look through the maze of antennas and see and hear St. Peters and swallows soaring during Roman sunset. Staff courteous, lobby looks new, same with elevators. Dining room was well appointed. Breakfast buffet satisfied the guys with eggs, sausauge (looked like chopped hotdogs), bacon (they don't make it crispy in EU), 4 breads,lots of fruit,yougurt.,coffe pot on our table. Place is centrally located, 2 blocks to termini and metro, 1 euro to any place in room, two stops to Spanish Steps, just be alert, keep all valuables in safe and have hidden pouch for $ and cards and wife take small purse. Conclusion, this was the best hotel and best location in tour.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient place and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmfh
Reviews.Content: Very convenient place mainly if you are coming from the Termini railway station, clever option if you want to avoid the traffic jams from the airport and save money of taxi fare. A lot of facilities near the hotel and all the most interesting places of Rome in a pleasant walk. Nice breakfast buffet and clean and comfortable hotel installations. I'll return again the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good, comfortable hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: IguanaGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel during a week-long trip to Rome in March 2007. We were pleased to find that the room size was quite good by European standards. Our room was clean. Everything was in working order. Beds were comfortable and sheets were nice and soft. Bathroom was relatively small, but quite adequate. There was even a small TV in the bathroom. Nice touch. Hotel staff at the desk were polite and helpful. Thankfully for us, they all spoke excellent English, so communication was no problem for us. A full breakfast is included in the price of the stay. There was a nice assortment of hot and cold breakfast items available. The only problem we encountered was that the milk was sour a couple of mornings, so cereal was not an option for breakfast. The location is within a 20 to 30 minute stroll of the Colosseum and Roman Forum. Restaurants and shops are easy to find nearby. I would definitely consider staying here again if I returned to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: juls1809
Reviews.Content: Starhotels Metropole - Rome My husband and I visited Rome in December 2006 and booked this hotel through Hotels.com, it was very cheap for a 4* so we didn't expect much to be honest as we usually pay a lot more. We arrived at our hotel and were pleasantly surprised, our room was very large and exceptionally clean and ultra modern, large bed and all the mod cons, gorgeous coffee and hot chocolate, the bathroom was beautiful and even had a television in it. The cleaner left chocolates every day which was a nice touch. The hotel is near termini station, quite convenient for the bus to the airport. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great experience we were not expecting”
Reviews.Author: OxfordEnglish_bloke
Reviews.Content: Our stay was 2 nights in mid January in a superior room. The hotel was booked by a local representative of the company I work for as part of block booking for a business meeting. My wife came along with me so we could take advantage of the following weekend to do some sightseeing. After reading quite a few negative reviews on a number of sites, we decided to book elsewhere (Hotel Capo D'Africa) for that weekend but based on our excellent experience on this hotel, wished we had not moved. The hotel staff understood and spoke a reasonable level of English and we found them to be very responsive, although in a quiet unassuming way. Even when things were busy they were efficient and appeared to be in control. The room was fantastic; a very good size, reasonable and including everything we needed (such as coffee-making facilities) and more. There was a numerous variety of pillow types to choose from. It even had a bath robe and TV in the bathroom! In summary the room was more like one in a quality hotel in the USA than a typical European one. The room was very warm but did have air-con which would be key in the summer. The evening meal was excellent value for money for Rome - a good quantity of good quality food and decent service. The breakfast was quite acceptable as long as you kept away from the cooked breakfast (something I have experienced before in some mainland European hotels).

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Starhotel This Year”
Reviews.Author: drbdoubek
Reviews.Content: I have been to Rome perhaps 5 times now from the states. I have now stayed at this hotel twice. Last year, late arrival, nice room, and good experience. My partner and I arrived from Barcelona mid day at Termini, which is close, but when coming in from the airport, you are not let out very close. We walked quite a while, then, even as a returning customer (who, by the way had sent them 3 clients during the year) was given this mediocre on a floor undergoing construction. So much for gratitude and loyalty. For a four star hotel, this was a two star experience. The room had a nice bed – two doubles pushed up against each other. The lighting buttons next to the bed are convenient, but the bathroom was cramped, and it took 6 hours for the room to cool off. Amidst this arrival, we heard banging, hammering on our floor. This is, of course, contextualized by my experience the year before when I had a rather grandiose bathroom. The drapes had a few holes in them, and one of our lamps did not work. The bathtub fell apart twice, but they fixed it only once. This room was done with yellows and greens, which could have been nice if it didn’t feel so cramped. The lampshades seemed old. While this hotel is ideally located next to Termini and the subway, the rooms obviously vary in quality. The front desk staff usually has 4-5 people scrambling, but generally attentive. We noticed a rather large Asian population staying here both years which was nice. The breakfast is nightmare on a plate. They must use powdered prepared eggs, and I would suggest NOT including breakfast as it seems very unhealthy. Occasionally, we could grab some fruit or a roll, but my partner and I would look around the room at people’s faces as they began to eat, and we would have to leave from laughing. This seems to be the standard for Starhotels as I have now stayed in 5 of them in Italy. It would be unfair to report this isolated incident as a typification since our experience that followed in Milan was quite different, except for the wretched breakfast. It is, however, easy to get around from this location, and the blessing is the Murano glass place right next door, where the people who work there are very descriptive, helpful, and courteous to travelers. I will not be staying at this hotel again, mainly because, as an American Express partner with Starhotels, I have expectations of better standards of loyalty. In Rome, I would recommend Capo d’Africa.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ecinanni1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Metropole for 3 nights. The location of the Hotel is excellent. It's located on Via Principe Amedeo which is only a few minutes walk from Termini station, Rome's central train station. From Termini you can catch either Metro line A or B to most of the major sites such as the Colosseum, Spanish Steps and Trevi fountain and you are there within minutes. I have visited Rome in the past and have had some bad hotel experiences. This hotel is quite good (by Rome standards). Our room was clean and we had a spacious bathroom with robes and slippers provided. There were tea and coffee making facilities, again, this is rather a rare find in Italian hotels, (even in a four star). The buffet breakfast was good with a reasonable selection of breakfast times items such as cereals, eggs, bacon, fruits etc but sometimes the eggs were a little runny or cold which was disappointing. Overall a pleasant stay at the Metropole.

Reviews.Title: “A Shaky Start to our Italian Vacation”
Reviews.Author: loveyloo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on the first night of a Group Bus Tour of Italy. When we opened the door to our room, we began to worry about what the other hotels on this tour would be like. The Room: We were given a room on the eighth floor that faced away from the street. I had heard that the rooms in Rome were very small, but this room was the smallest and worst room that we stayed in during our entire Italian vacation (both on the tour and independently). The bathroom, however, was a good size and had wonderful toiletries. Our room had the green carpet halfway up the wall, peeling wallpaper border and very large cracks in the ceiling and along one wall. It sounded very much like the room described by another reviewer here. Judging by the pictures on the hotel's website, we were not given a refurbished room. Our room was crammed with furniture. It contained two twin beds pushed together, two night tables, a small round table and two chairs, a bar fridge with a television on top of it and a desk with a desk chair. On top of the desk there was a tray with a kettle so that you could make tea or coffee. With all this furntiure, we could barely walk around the bed! It was also difficult to find a place to put our luggage. The room was very dark and had a standard eight foot ceiling. The size of the room and the height of the ceiling made me feel like I was trapped in a box. To top it all off, the air conditioning wasn't working and the temperature in our room hovered around 29C according to our travel clock. Opening the window did not help as it was a hot and humid July night with no breeze whatsoever. The front desk staff kept insisting that the air conditioning was indeed working. The next morning we asked other people on our tour group about their rooms. People on other floors seemed to have larger rooms with fully functioning air conditioning. Breakfast: There was quite a choice for breakfast. My husband had the eggs and bacon while I stuck with the pastries and yoghurt. The freshly squeezed juices were self-serve. Coffee or tea had to be ordered from the waiter/waitress. The morning we were there there were two other tour groups having breakfast at the same time. Although the breakfast room is big, it could not accomodate all the people. The serving staff could not cope with all the people either. All in all, I was very happy to leave this hotel. Thankfully, the other hotels on the Bus Tour were nothing like the Starhotel Metropole. I doubt I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location at the Metropole”
Reviews.Author: BlueIrishEyes
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Metropole before, so I went direct, and let them know that I am a repeat customer. Location is important to me, so this hotel is great, just at walking distance of Termini station. However, the room I was assigned to had no working air conditioning and right outside my door, maintenance was taking care of plumbing issues in the ceiling. They had to get down off their ladder and move, just so I could get inside my room. Sawing and drilling started at 7 AM, a total disturbance to sleep. I went for Holy Week services and Easter, so I was out and about in the afternoons into early AM so this noise was bad. The front desk said they were full, however, when the 5th day of my stay came along and the elevator was out for 5 HOURS, I wouldn't leave the front desk (my room was on the 8th floor) and they gave me a first floor luxury room to freshen up in. What happened to no available rooms? I was disappointed as a loyal client (3rd time there), but felt that it was the holiday week that made them think the big bucks would come in for the luxury rooms. Baloney on the air conditioning situation. We had to keep the window open, just to get air so falling asleep was hard.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, disgusting, made me itch”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read the other reviews of the Starhotels Metropole before booking our last night in Rome at this hotel. I have NO IDEA what everyone else is talking about! There is absolutely no reason that this hotel should ever, ever, ever receive a rating any higher than a 1. To me, a 1 might be a bit generous. To put my review in context my husband and I stayed at the Victoria Park Plaza in London which was amazing, the Radisson SAS Champs Elysses in Paris which was fantastic, and the Capo D'Africa near the Coliseum in Rome which was top notch...then for our last night in Rome, the Starhotels Metropole. OH THE HORROR. I'm not being dramatic, this place literally made me itch. There is so much to complain about I'll just bullet point it to save us all a bit of time: 1. No one helped us to our room. No greeting, no bellhop, no one to help us with our bag, no one to explain the amenities...nothing. 2. I guess they couldn't decide between keeping the wallpaper border up, or taking it down, so they just left it in an in-between stage of partially coming off of the wall in our room. They also removed some of the wallpaper border, yet the painted faded on the part of the wall that wasn't bordered, so you can see the difference in color. Which is just plain tacky. 3. And speaking of walls, they were stained, dirty and cracked. I'm not talking little cracks, I'm talking BIG, very noticeable 8 foot long cracks on several of the walls. 4. The ceiling (if that's what you want to call it) is actually the interior, unfinished, inside of the building, yet "covered" with this metal, faux gold painted grid of which you can look through and see the interior. A huge chuck of the ceiling fell off, through the grid and onto our bathroom floor while we were there. It's the most disgusting thing I've ever seen. 5. Don't look up in the shower. Just believe me, you don't want to see what's up in that ceiling. 6. The walls are partially covered with carpet. Green carpet. Dirty green carpet. Crusty, dirty, green carpet. Honestly, if you're going to carpet they walls, at least steam clean them!!!!! OH I'M ITCHING JUST THINKING ABOUT IT! And it was only 50 euros less than the Capo D'Africa near the Coliseum, which was so fantastic! Don't stay at the Starhotels Metropole in Rome. Don't ever stay there. I beg of you. Just reliving my stay there is making me sick, so I'm done. I'm going to shower now.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: smjak02
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend in May. Arrived late so took a taxi from Ciampino, Train would normally have been fine, we took one back 11e 35 mins. Only people at check in although receptionist weas a bit sdiinetrrested and engegd in conversations with 2 other staff whilst slowly "processing" our passports. Never mind we were given an upgrade. Clean, modern, decent size, room with excellent bathroom. 3 speed Air con was working, despite info in previous review, and was required 26c when we were there. It doesn't work if you open the window, there is an electronic device that cuts it out. Shutters on window kept out light and noise. Our rate included breakfast, had it in room 1st day. Not brilliant no butter, hot food cold, no bread just packeted toast. Not as advertised on door hanger. May be better going down for it. Great location for Termini/Republica stations but able to walk most places except perhaps Vatican, 6? stops on metro. Liked the hotel, loved Rome, execeede expectations.

Reviews.Title: “what happened to the airconditioning???”
Reviews.Author: helenb31
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for only one night as part of a bus tour.
