Foyer and desk staff where great and room was very impressive: large, bathroom with plasma screen and phone etc. Only problem was that the airconditiong even the fan didnt work. It was so hot we had to sleep with our window open and as our room faced the street it was very noisy. When we asked about the airconditioning we were told that in Italy you are not allowed to turn it on until July. Other people on our tour complained about the same thing and were given the same response. I find this hard to believe as we had previously stayed at a budget hotel at Termini station and had had the air conditioning on! Good luck if you are there and its hot and NOT summer!!

Reviews.Title: “Problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our first problem occured at check-in, we were actually bumped from the Hotel! They booked us into a lesser hotel a few blocks away for the first night. We were told to come back early the next morning to check in. Since we had a full day of sightseeing planned, we returned early only to find there still was no room. We stored our luggage and late that day were given a nice room only to find it had no hot water. After much dithering and repeated requests for repairs, we were eventually given another room. The staff was apologetic but not very effectual. Expedia, could not negociate a refund, but did give us a certificate for future use. On the other hand, the location is great, the hotel very comfortable and well appointed, and the breakfast was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great value !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed at the Starhotels Metropole for 7 nights in february. We were totally happy of the hotel. You get exactly what you pay for, great rooms (very comfortable, totally new, clean, etc.). Bathroom is also very good, with bath, and even a TV in it for the fun. Room very quiet and warm, we slept with the window opened in february ! The break fast is fantastic, the best i had in an hotel, lot of choice (eggs, bacon, ham, cheese, cereals, fruits, croissants, everything you can imagine in a very large buffet). So big breakfast that we never eated at noon, breakfast was suffisent for all day long ! Staff is kind, no problem. And the best, the hotel is very well situated, don't hesitate if you plan to visit Rome, Termini is a very good location as you can go everywhere in the city with ease thanks to the metro. Buy a ticket for a week (15 euros) and you're ok to go anywhere. And the center of rome is not very big, in fact we walked a lot, you can lot of monuments by foot from the hotel. By the way, great shopping in rome for the girls. Just be careful with the italian restaurant, they charge bread + services + water and some charges even the "table set", lot of tourist trap. If you go to Starhotels Metropole, you MUST eat at the restaurant Giglio (in front of the theater opera), which is by far the best food and service we had in Italy. If you're looking for a good hotel in Rome, wich deserve his 4 stars, don't hesitate, Starhotels Metropole is a good choice. Enjoy your stay and forgive my poor english.

Reviews.Title: “A good, convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: obolti1
Reviews.Content: Very convenient for Termini station & coaches to airports. Rooms are clean and reasonable size, bathrooms ditto. Daily maid service is good. About a 15 minute stroll to the main sights - colleseum, trevi. If I were to go to Rome again, I would probably come here, although I would avoid the bar next time as it is v.v.expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Average in all aspects”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Metropole for 4 nights over new year. I had booked a double room and we were given a twin, they moved us the 2nd night with no problems. In my opinion this is a pretty average hotel there is no room service after 10pm (when the restaurant shuts) there aren't even any room service menu's in the rooms, the bar shuts at 1am and you'll be lucky if anything arrives within 30 minutes of ordering it, occasionally it may never materialise! Our double room was average size, nothing special. The rooms on the 9th floor were still being renovated and the lifts hardly ever arrive so be prepared to walk. We ended up staying an extra night and moving to a charming little hotel near the vatican which was half the price. I guess the location of the Metropole was good, a couple of blocks from Termini and the underground, but as rome is small and you can get anywhere on foot, location is not a deal breaker.

Reviews.Title: “No problems here - Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: woodhurst
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 nights on 27th and 28th Dec with my Girlfriend. I had looked through so many reviews from so many hotels, eventually coming accross this one. Nicely situated in the city centre, the rail terminus is 3 minutes away. Arrived very late due snow in the UK but met with very warm welcome. All staff on front desk speak very good english. Room was excellent, if very slightly small, the bathroom was large. Very clean, warm and comfortable. We both breathed a huge sigh of relief! Breakfast was hot / cold buffet again with no complaints. I really thought we'd done very well here. One piece of advice - I normally just book with Expedia but this time I checked the hotels own website AFTER checking reviews and the Starhotels site saved me almost £70 on the Expedia price (some special deal)so do check round. Overall very good, very central, lots of restaurants within 2 or 3 minutes walk. I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tker48
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed there for two nights. Its about a seven walk to the train station and about a five minute walk to the metro. I walked around a couple times at night time and did not feel scared at all. There is also an ATM two blocks away. We also took a wonderful 9 hour tour, I forgot the name, in which they bus comes to pick you up at the hotel-ask them for more info on this. The breakfast was also pretty good. The room was clean and comfortable-Executive Room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for three nights 20-22Nov, after reading the reviews on tripadvisor. The hotel is a very good standard compared to many 4* hotels I have stayed in,with good 5* attention to detail in the spacious rooms, which seemed newly refurbished. It is close (short walk)to Termini station, and we were able to walk easily from the hotel to all the major attractions, including the Vatican. I would certainly return there, and recommend it as a 4* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location, very good service and spacious well decorated rooms. Just a few minutes walk from the Metro & Bus station with plenty of local eateries round about. Don't hesitate, this hotel is fine!

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked and rude”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the lobby the hotel looked very nice but unfortunately we never got past the front desk. When we arrived at the hotel (around 7p after a very doable 10 min walk from the train station) we were informed that there was a "problem with the computer today" and the hotel was overbooked. We were told that reservations were made for us at another hotel (which was way on the other side of town, completely defeating the purpose of staying at this hotel because we had an early train out of rome the next day). We were obviously unhappy about the situation, but in the end, i'm sure this "problem" is not unique to this hotel. Our main complaint, however, was how rude we were treated after finding out that we did not have a room waiting for us despite our pre-paid reservations from Hotels[--] (the couple next to us that suffered the same fate and were on their honeymoon even called multiple times in the days before and had assurances from the manager that their room would be guaranteed). We asked to speak to a manager and were handed a phone to speak with "the manager" who had left for the day and was on his cellphone. Apparently there is not always a manager on duty and overbooking is so common that he didn't think to stay to oversee the problem. At one point after we asked them for a refund and told them that we didn't want to be moved to another random hotel, the woman told us that a refund was impossible, but they would cancel the other reservation, adding "OK, bye bye." As if that would be a reasonable resolution to the situation. Clearly it would have been more convenient for her if we had just disappeared. I'm sure the hotel is fine, especially judging by the other comments here, but we couldn't tell you first hand and we thought it would be worth it for people to hear about our experience. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one night in October 2005 as part of a visit to Rome, Sorrento and Pompeii. We chose the hotel, in part, because it was close to the Termini (Rail Station) and we were coming into Rome from Sorrento by rail and then catching the bus back to the airport from the Termini the next day. It was convenient for us to stay near to the Termini. We did have our reservations about the area, as the area around the railway station is generally not the best in most big cities, and my husband was a bit concerned as we walked down the street to the hotel. However, our fears were completely unfounded as the hotel was very good. The lobby and reception area are spacious and quite impressive. The reception staff were efficient although perhaps a bit business-like for some leisure travellers. It is not the most picturesque part of Rome but we felt completely happy waking around even at night. It is about a 15 minute walk to the Colosseum from the hotel but you can walk this along the Via Nazionale which has plenty of shops to keep you interested along the way. We walked back from the Piazza Navona at night and it took us about 25 to 30 mins. By the way, don't eat here if you can avoid it. Although the atmosphere and setting is lovely, the service is a bit slow, the food is only average and you are charged for the bread they put on the table regardless of whether or not you asked for it and there was a 5 Euro service charge added to our bill as well. There is better food to be had away from the really touristy areas at better prices. We had a room on the 7th floor and it was fantastic. Looking at the floor plan on the fire escape map, it seemed to be one of the largest on the floor even though we had only paid for a standard room. The room had a separate living area with sofa, tv and tea and coffe making facilities. There was also a spacious bedroom with the biggest and most comfortable bed of all the hotels we stayed in during our trip. You could also ask reception for a range of different pillows, should you need them for back or neck conditions. There was no noise at night and we had a good night's sleep. The bathroom was again large with a whirlpool bath and a lovely powerful shower. Complimentary toiletries of a good standard were provided. There was even a set of bathroom scales and a mini TV in the bathroom! There was also a electricity socket in the bathroom next to the mirror and the hairdryer for all those girls who can't live without their hair straighteners like me! Bathrobes were also provided. Some of the other reviews of this hotel said it was in need of repair and attention. From our experience, this is unfounded. The hotel and room was spotlessly clean. Perhaps some of the carpets in the public corridors of the hotel had been worn a bit but they were still kept in good order. It was certainly in a better state of repair and more newly furnished then the hotel we stayed in on the first night of our trip to Rome. We did not eat in the restaurant so cannot comment on that. The only few things that we would say is that if you want internet access you must pay for it by the day which can be expensive. There is no free internet in the lobby or a designated room as there is in other hotels. Breakfast is not included as it was in the other hotels we stayed in in Italy during this trip and there wasn't a view from our room (although from this part of the city, I don't think it would be possible to see any of the major sights anyway). We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recently renovated. What a great job. Huge rooms, all teak furniture. The staff couldnt have been more helpful. I would stay here again & again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were wonderful, helpful and spoke fantastic English. The rooms were a nice size (which is not the norm in Europe) and comfortable. There were no hidden fees and the breakfast buffet in the morning was BY FAR the best we had our entire trip through Europe (almost three weeks). And if you think this doesn't matter, rest assured it does. Most places that offer a breakfast, it consists of bread products, bread products and more bread products. That must be all they eat for breakfast over there. This spread had eggs, bacon, sausage and fruits. Some talk of the Termini area as being scary. Not so. It is safe and there are many places to eat within walking distance. The metro is closeby and while it is a bit intimidating at certain times, we had no problems. Just watch your pockets and belongings. You can't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely, clean, friendly, and well situated hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Anthonia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Metropole for a week last August. We got the bus from the airport to the Termini station and it is only 5 minutes walk from where the bus leaves you off. The convenience to the Termini is very useful also if you wish to take some bus or rail trips out of the City e.g. we took a trip to Assisi on the train (which was much cheaper than taking an organised tour) . And you can pick up the city bus tours from there also. We were upgraded to a beautiful large double room on the 9th floor. The bathroom had lots of nice toiletries with the added touch of a bathrobe and slippers not forgetting the mini tv in the corner. The weather was still hot and humid so we appreciated the very good air conditioning that was most user-friendly to operate. Don't forget when you open the windows the air-conditioning goes off, the helpful security man pointed that out to us. Our room was cleaned everyday as well as fresh sheets and towels. We greatly appreciated our mini fridge where we kept our own little snacks cool. The hotel also as a very nice restaurant with friendly and helpful staff, we enjoyed two of our evening meals there and both were excellent. The restaurant is spacious with a little hint of luxury, you do feel your are dining out. I would have no hesitation in recommending the hotel or indeed Rome, the only quibble would probably be; that a week is not enough!!! One hint about the sight seeing. When we went to the Colosseum on Sunday the english tour had just begun so by the time we would have queued we would have definitely missed it. But as luck would have it we were approached by an english speaking 'Green Tour' guide and we took their tour instead. It was a little bit more expensive but worth every penny. Our guide was most informative and amusing they also give a free complementary tour of the ancient Forum. We also wished to visit the Catacombs so it must have been providence that we met this tour group because, right after the Colosseum guide, they had another trip going to the Catacombs, which for us was an absolute must. There is so much to see and do in Rome and therefore time is of the essence that it was great to be just taken to the Catacombs arriving just in time for the english tour. It was a truly spiritual experience. When you get your bearings you can walk quite easily from the hotel to alot of the tourist sites. The Santa Maria Maggiore Basilica is just around the corner and is very, very beautiful. One last thing, there is an audience with the pope every Wednesday and is completely free and we found heading for the Vatican afterwards just fitted in very well. Also , when we went to Saint Peter's we found the official audio guide so helpful enriching the whole experience. It goes without saying we flung the coin into the Trevi fountain, once is never enough to visit the Eternal city. Lets just hope there will be room in the Metropole and then everything will be perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near Termini”
Reviews.Author: Michealangelo
Reviews.Content: We booked these two nights in Rome through priceline and once we found out it was this hotel, we were a bit nervous after reading the mixed reviews here. We clearly received a new room as we loved this hotel and it was a nice place to spend the last leg of our trip. The hotel was conviently located near Termini as well as the Repubblica metro stop. The front desk was very helpful. The room was nicely decorated, modern and had a great bed with nice pillows. The bathroom was also very modern and well done, although the water pressure was a bit to be desired which was too bad as it was a nice shower. And while I stated the front desk was helpful, I would suggest do not have them schedule a car/taxi for you - we had an early flight so they arranged a car service for us and they said that we wouldn't have had been able to get a better price (75 euros) - so we bit, but then come to find out in the morning we had to share the car service with another couple! All in all it was a great room and hotel and would definitely stay here again (but just wouldn't have the front desk arrange for a car!).

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good Value”
Reviews.Author: steve23
Reviews.Content: After getting the Leonardo express train from Fluiminco Airport my wife and I arrived at Termini station and proceeded to the Star Hotel, we expected the area to be less than average - as most central railway station areas usually are and by the earlier reviews posted - but the area is fine as soon as you walk a street or two away from the termini - which you will do to get to the starhotel. Earlier reviews refer to not feeling safe etc - essentially what they are alluding to is the fact that the streets nearer to termini has a few african immigrants either selling fake handbags, or just loitering and passing the time away, or there is the occassional arabic internet cafe, indeed at the other end of via principe amedia the street is littered with bangladeshi grocery shops, resturants and internet cafes, likewise the whole of via flippo turati (which is parallel to the termini) is populated by Chinese businesses - so if your averse or frightened by immigrants getting on with their lives - then stay away from termini - otherwise it's quite safe. As soon as we arrived at the Starhotel we were upgraded immediately - didnt even ask! - Mario F (who is usually the concierge in the day will sort you out, he's also the most objective and caring and will advise you honestly on any travel plans you have rather than fob you off with the standard responses like the rest of the staff do. We were placed on the 8th floor, all the 3 lifts smelt of food - presumably from room service not having their own service lifts and using the guest lifts - so the smell varied from day to day depnding on what food had been ordered that day - leaving a constant stale stench of food in the lifts, the communal area on the 8th floor was dreary, worn carpets like the lifts, but luckily no smell in the corridors. Our room was excellent - i recommend upgrading to a suite to be on the safe side, everything was clean - almost new, definitely refurbished, there were 2 downfalls - no view - only a view of the rest of the rear building accomodation, and we were close to the lifts - round the back of one - so we could hear the lifts going up and down anywhere in the room, but we were out most of the time and the quality of the room offset the disappointment. The breakfast in the morning is really just cold and continental. They have scrambled eggs only, no toast just rolls and firm baguettes, the bacon and sausage is too wierd tasting to count as such, the rest of the food although cold is ample if you get there before 10am. Mario the concierge gave us lots of guides to Rome so that helped - but Termini is terrible for eating out, in fact i didnt come across one good resturant from Termini to Piazza Spagna! - i think this may be due to the fact italians like eating at home, that 99% of the resturants are tourist traps - you know you're in one if you pay more than 5 euros for pasta (and the menu is in English) but then in this area you have no choice, i'm well travelled and trust me when i say Rome is not the place for good food, maybe if you ventured out of Rome away from the sites you may well get proper italian food that is not cooked frozen food - which alot of the food was. I can only recommend one resturant near the hotel - that is turn left out of the hotel, left again into via viminale, straight down and adjacent to the fountain is a resturant which is out of the way, ok food but not great - but the best in the termini area. As for drinks after sight seeing or shopping - go to the hotel opposite - Hotel Diana it has a roof top garden pub/bar - go straight in and ask reception for the lift to the roof garden - the drinks like hotel prices are 4-5 euros for a glass of wine, half a lager, or any spirit with mixer - its the best place to chill out near the termini area - all in all the hotel and location is satisfactory, you can get to anywhere from termini because that is the only place where the only 2 underground lines in rome -red and blue tube lines intersect (be warned the underground shuts at 9pm!) and where you can get any bus you want, and of course you dont have to haul your luggage around when you arrive/depart from the airport into rome. Oh yes i recommend the no110 tour bus to see all the sights to see what interests you and then go back and explore in more detail the same day - 13euros for one day pass. all in all I probably wouldn't stay in Termini area again because i hated the food, and i would have liked to be closer to the shopping and sites in Spagna or Barberini - which is where i would stay next time.

Reviews.Title: “Simply excellent!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good position, nearby Termini station. Simply to reach from the airport directly to Termini without use taxi! The rooms are amazing: italian style, of couse! All the reception staff, very helpfull, and the dining little expensive, but nice. Breakfast nice. I will provide for my next holidays at Metropole in 2006.

Reviews.Title: “Specify a refurbished room prior to booking”
Reviews.Author: Chris228
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Starhotel Metropole for four nights in July of this year - a group of 6 in three separate rooms. We stayed at the hotel after researching on this site and we were very pleased with our decision. After reading other reviews it was clear that the newly refurbished rooms were the ones to stay in, and so we specified this requirement prior to booking. This was done by email direct with the hotel and the staff were very helpful. On our arrival we were delighted to find that all of our rooms were close together and all exactly like they are in the hotel website pictures. The electronic safe did not work in one room, but the others were fine, and there were no other problems. The facilities in the rooms were more than adequate and there were nice touches like sweets and chocolate biscuits left by the cleaners each day, which made the stay even more enjoyable! The barman - I can't remember his name - was eager to please and very friendly. The prices were higher than outside the hotel, as is usually the case, but you pay for the service. We found the location to be ideal. On the first day we explored the area on foot, but it is a fair walk back to the hotel from the Spanish steps etc. The close proximity to the Termini, however, means that the hotel is perfectly placed for trips by bus to get to the main sights. After reading about it in guidebooks etc, we were apprehensive about staying in the area south of the Termini. None of us felt in any way unsafe in this area during our stay though, and the streets around the hotel were pleasant to walk along whatever the time. It's a shame to read other reviewers' criticism of the older rooms at the hotel - every part of the hotel we saw was furnished and decorated to a very high standard. Make sure you ask for a new room and you can't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “You can do better than this!”
Reviews.Author: capitalstereo
Reviews.Content: I've just come back from 4 nights in rome, the last of which I spent at the Metropole. The hotel did not live up to my expectations. First of all the (few) positives, because I want the view to be balanced and objective: The hotel staff were friendly and efficient. They deserve better surroundings to work in! The room was clean and the bed comfortable. The breakfast buffet was ok and the range of food available was good. Now the bad stuff. The room I stayed in had an air conditioning system which leaked water through the light fitting. Nice! The room had clearly had a damp problem at some point. Furthermore the walls were cracked. The room looked to me as if it had not been redecorated for about 10-15 years. Some highlights of the impressively 80's decor included....a gold plastic mesh ceiling (see photos), peeling wallpaper, a wash basin mounted in faux marble plastic wash stand, and half carpeted walls which were stained with something rather unpleasant looking. The curtains would not close at all. However, there was a working blackout blind to compensate or I would have been forced to change rooms. There was kettle in the room, but no milk! Overall I would say that the hotel has probably once been very nice and furnished to a high standard, but on the basis of the room I stayed in and the somewhat faded grandeur of the communal areas, I think that the hotel is long overdue a refurb and would suggest that you give it a wide berth until some serious cash has been lavished on it. On the other three nights of my break in Rome I stayed in the hotel capo d'africa. I paid about £7 more per night, but for the slightly higher price I had a modern, well appointed room in a better location for seeing the sights. I have visited Rome before and as a general note for people visiting Rome, I would suggest that you steer clear of the area surrounding the termini and the via cavoue when deciding where to stay unless you have a specific reason for staying there. The area doesn't always feel entirely safe on a night, and it is difficult to find good food. Furthermore, the termini area is convenient for the colosseum and forum, but other sights can be a bit of a hike.

Reviews.Title: “Good accommodation, average location”
Reviews.Author: Hailes family
Reviews.Content: We had five nights at this hotel at the start of August 2005. We had a second floor room with massive double bed, plenty of storage space, easy chairs, safe, kettle & all facilities to make drinks, well appointed bathroom (soaps and shampoos, slippers, dressing gown), minibar and air conditioning. It was like a larger UK hotel room, very modern in styling. One frustration was that the three-speed fan control for the air-con didn't seem to make any difference to the noise it made, and I couldn't sleep with it on. As another reviewer has pointed out, the air-con goes off when you remove your key-card from the slot in the room, but we got round this by asking reception for a second card which we left in the slot in the room when we went out in the evening. Result: nice cool room when we returned and I could turn the air-con off to get to sleep! In our room we didn't have problems with noise from rooms around or above us as some have reported; we were located on one side of the hotel so avoided the street-noise problem (but don't expect to get views of Rome from this hotel - our window faced the next-door building a few metres away!). It was also very clean and relatively new, not as per one recent report posted on this site. There was refurbishment work going on so it may be there are older rooms on other floors. Some people have expressed concern about safety walking the streets around Terminii station. This hotel is at the north-west end of Via Principe Amedeo and the immediate area seemed quite touristy and safe, with street-side cafes in abundance. One evening we walked the length of the street and it changes character as you go south-east - if you are nervous, then I'd avoid going much further along than Via Gioberti, four blocks away. Access to the main train station, the metro and the bus station is very easy; we visited most sites in Rome using the 64 or 40 buses that go between Terminii and the bottom end of St Peters, and/or the metro. With a three-day pass this was easy to do. You can also walk to some of the attractions, but don't forget that Terminii is at the top of a long rise if you plan to walk back! Breakfast was good, other reports have accurately described what is on offer. We never had to queue but August in Rome isn't the busiest time of the year for hotels. We did encounter several Japanese tour groups during our stay. We never ate an evening meal in the hotel, but used some of the pizzerias and trattorias in the surrounding area. Some were better than others! Choose carefully. Our best meal was when we decided to go for Chinese fare rather than Italian, at Mr Chow, Via Genova 29/a. We paid about 175 Euros for the room and breakfast, booking through UK travel company Citalia.

Reviews.Title: “Old and dirty!”
Reviews.Author: theninthmuse
Reviews.Content: THe staff is the only nice thing at this hotel. This is more like a 2-star! The elevators take forever and at times would randomly stop on all floors going down. The glass where the push button for the elevator was shattered on our floor. The rooms clearly have VERY worn out carpet that were VERY dingy. My boyfriend and I, both, had to wear our slippers around b/c the carpet felt sticky and dirty. The corners of the ceiling were cracked and there were gaps! Our room was an executive room and still, it was horrible. The ceiling in the bathroom is expose beams and such. The hotel is very old and needs alot of repair. The location is great. There are a few other hotels across the street (on Via Principe Amedeo) that seem nicer, but I don't know. DO NOT purchase your rooms here without looking at it first. Also, when you leave the air turns off automatically. It does not have COLD a/c.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely start to Italian vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fantastic helpful staff. Queit comfortable rooms. Great location. Lovely breakfast. A terrefic place to start a trip.

Reviews.Title: “Don't think twice about staying here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rooms were immaculate and beautifully appointed with lavish marble baths. Excellent full breakfast with large assortment of breads, meats, cheeses and eggs. Location okay about 20 minutes from the Spanish Steps. Train and bus station just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: simontrnt
Reviews.Content: My Fiancée and I recently stayed at this hotel after reading the reviews of the hotel on Tripadvisor. I must say it was an excellent choice. The location is very good being about a 10 minute walk from the major sites such as Trevi Fountain & the Coliseum and easy walking distance to and from the train station were most of the connections from the airports arrive. Upon check in at the hotel earlier than the stated check in time we were upgraded to an 'Executive Room' without even having to ask. The check in staff were very friendly and informative. The room was excellent very modern and contempory with excellent decor and amenities. Also the bed was very comfortable as other reviews had previously stated. The only criticism I could find was that the noise from the room above could be heard when walking on the wooden floors and moving chairs etc etc, but the room itself really was excellent and a very good size for a European city hotel. We would certainly stay at this hotel in the future if we were to visit the magnificent city of Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as I thought”
Reviews.Author: SJP01
Reviews.Content: Having read the reports on the Trip Advisor Website, I was expecting something special. The hotel was within easy access to most areas. The reception staff were ok but if you caught them on an off moment, you would consider them rude. The main hotel area is a little tired, and the piano bar reminded me of a holiday camp, with no pianist! The barman who was exceptionally helpful, but his white jacket certainly hadnt seen the washing machine for a number of years. We nicknamed him DAZ! Breakfast consisted of hard rolls, cold 'hot' food, screaming children, not for me. A few good bars and resturants in the area if you search them out.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I (in our early 30's) have just returned to the UK after having spent 5 nights at the Starhotels Metropole - our first visit to Rome (12-17.05.05). This web site was instrumental in helping us to choose to stay at this hotel and I am pleased to report back that it was as good as we had hoped. Excellent and quiet location in a side street, within walking distance to the Termini and main streets offering good shops and restaurants. We stayed in a twin room on the top floor (9th). Our window opened out into a courtyard arrangement with rooms on the other 3 sides and the stained glass ceiling of the bar below. We were therefore facing inwards, not overlooking any streets, and it was very peaceful. The room was decorated to a good standard, very clean, with good supplies. We even had slippers! Breakfast was good - ample choice, although don't expect much in the way of hot food. We found the staff at the reception desk to be extremely polite and helpful in providing maps, directions, and good recommendations for restaurants. As 2 travelling females, we can also say that we felt reasonably safe and confident in moving around the city - although you shouldn't rely on taxis to get you back from anywhere, especially late on a busy Friday evening! We waited at one taxi rank for nearly 2 hours. We used the Metro during the day. It is unbelievably cheap and easy to use, and it takes you to quite a few of the major sights in the city. I would also suggest either a very good guide book or the services of a guided tour. We went a little blindly to some of the sights and would have liked more information as to what we were looking at! I hope to return to Rome in the not-so-distant future and would definitely stay at this hotel again. A great hotel - good value for money, and a wonderful holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Shutter_Bug
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here because the pre-season prices were very good and the location was incredible (near Roma Termini train station). Rooms were average size, by European standards, but very clean and well-decorated. Comfortable beds, and clean and comfortable bathrooms. The continental breakfast was the best we had the entire time we stayed in Italy. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our regret was not staying at this hotel longer. We will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed staying here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in a twin room with a friend. ican't comment on what posh hotels are normally like, but this was excellent, clean, tidy, helpful reception. Breakfast hall had a small queue if you go when everyone else does.

Reviews.Title: “Beauty, Hospitality and ambience. A Roman Feast.”
Reviews.Author: Ulisse
Reviews.Content: The character "Auntie Mame" once said "Life is a banquet but there are still too many people that are starving." Then literally they haven't had the brakfast buffet at the Metropole of Rome! Seriously,though, I was at the hotel in July of 2002 before the massive renovations that have been recently happening and I still found it to be a beautiful hotel then with a staff that I thought worked in an exceptional way to satisfy the needs of its patrons. I saw a strong sophistication on the part of the staff and many of the people staying there that I didn't always see in what one would call the more "luxurious" hotels that I have visited. As with some I questioned the hotels nearness to the Termini station,but when I arrived there I found it to be extremely convenient because one could come directly there from the airport and walk to the hotel if they chose to. Also, the subways are right there as well as trains you could take for other cities. There are very good restaurants in the area and if you felt like walking you could "stroll" to some of the famous landmarks. I am looking forward to staying there again this summer because its rates are still reasonable and it fits the quality and ambience that I am looking for in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay here: The hotel seems to be going through some renovations right now - so my experience might be different from those travelling last summer... Our room was lovely and smelled still pretty new. The beds were haven: A proper 4 Star hotel even in the point of view of people not only travelling in Italy... Room was hardwood floors and very welcoming and comfortable and even modern.... wireless internet, a bathroom with TV and a service always with a smile. Breakfast was ok. Roomservice is a little pricy but protions are good. Hotel location is great: Just 2 blocks from Termini Station we did everything by foot... Via Nacionale is just 3 blocks for shopping and we discovered quite a few small restaurants in the smaller streets around... . In regards to former reviews: Our wake up call was on time each morning and the room had an inroom safe... MOre than to expect for the great rate we got....

Reviews.Title: “Great room, with high tech amenities”
Reviews.Author: CaptainBristol
Reviews.Content: The 4-star hotel was remarkably comfortable and surprisingly high tech. That is probably because it caters to Japanese tour groups. The Japanese collectively have the world’s highest standards for hotel amenities, and it shows at the Metropole. Our room was large, classy, and recently remodeled. The bed had a modified futon mattress that was the best I slept on in Europe. The hotel is located about 3 blocks from the main railroad station: a 10-minute walk. The railroad station is also a bus line and subway hub, so it’s not hard to get around Rome from there. The main downside to the hotel is that its neighborhood is far from charming. There are a remarkable number of one- and two-star hotels in the area and a great many restaurants that serve overpriced, mediocre food to the unsuspecting tourist hordes. The area seems run down but not seedy. We walked the streets with no fear for our safety. I got the place on Priceline for 2 nights @ $120/night, which was a value. We ended up staying a 3rd night and paid 160 Euros: about $200. Across the street from the Metropole, at the Hotel Diana, there is a lovely outdoor bar on the roof. Flanking the bar are two elevator shaft towers, which you can climb to enjoy the view. The Roman skyline is not terribly dramatic, but we went up there with a city map at sunset and were able to spot a number of landmarks. It seems to me that almost no one knows about that little bar. This location was virtually deserted the 2 times I visited. It’s a nice place for a drink and the antipasto table. But a bad place to have dinner.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kmozena
Reviews.Content: The star hotel is in a great location (you can easily walk there from the tremini-we used the directions provided by one of the other reviewers and they worked great). We were upgraded upon arrival to a bigger room, and the room was very nice, clean, cool, and decorated well. We got a great deal by booking through AAA, and would highly recommend this hotel for anyone's stay.
